speaker: Eldigan
text: Lachesis, I'm leaving for Agusty. I can't rest until I've convinced King Chagall to end his foolish warmongering.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Please don't do it, brother! You know as well as I that Chagall murdered his father himself. You'll only be endangering yourself for a lost cause. He won't listen to you!

speaker: Eldigan
text: You mustn't say such things about your king! I, too, have heard the rumors of King Chagall's involvement, but they are just that: rumors. There remains no evidence against him. Surely, His Majesty will see reason in this matter, if I simply persuade him.

speaker: Lachesis
text: But-

speaker: Eldigan
text: Enough! I'll leave three of my finest knights here to defend Nordion, should the worst come to pass. Lachesis, you needn't look so sad. I will be back. I promise. I'm not about to abandon you in death.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Eldie…

speaker: Eldigan
text: Please, Your Majesty! Reconsider your militant ambitions. Your father before you worked so hard to build an era of peace with Grannvale. A war will only bring ruin to our people, bringing disgrace upon your good name for generations to come. I implore you: do not start a war!

speaker: Chagall
text: So it's you... Eldigan of Nordion. You dastard... My father adored you, and you used his trust to undercut me at every turn. But now, my father is no more... And long live the king of all Agustria! For years you've made me play the fool, and now, I will reward you in kind. Guards! Throw this man in the dungeon!

speaker: Eldigan
text: W-wait! Your Majesty, please-

speaker: Chagall
text: Pfeh! Good riddance, the eyesore. Send my orders to Bordeaux at Heirhein: seize Nordion Castle! Once that nuisance is dealt with, we're clear to throw all we've got at Grannvale!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Your Majesty, King Chagall... I see you've made your decision at last.

speaker: Chagall
text: Manfroy? Yes, just as we agreed. Father is dead, and by my hand. ...There is no turning back now. Even so, I still don't know if we stand a chance.

speaker: Manfroy
text: Remember, Grannvale still adheres to that tawdry old peace treaty with you, and their entire army is distracted in Isaach. Strike now, and you could not possibly fail.

speaker: Chagall
text: You're right. The downfall of Grannvale will mark the rise of Agustria as Jugdral's new leading power! "Chagall, Emperor of the World"... I like the sound of that.

speaker: Manfroy
text: Hmhmhm... We can only hope your ambition will be rewarded.

speaker: Yves
text: Milady! We've received word that Lord Eldigan was arrested in Agusty!

speaker: Lachesis
text: What?! You must be joking! Oh... Why didn't I try harder... I shouldn't have let him go...

speaker: Yves
text: That isn't our only problem, milady. With Lord Eldigan gone, we need to be aware of Heirhein's movements. Knowing of his lordships absence, a strike from them is inevitable. After the Verdane incident, they're most likely out for revenge on us... Especially Lord Elliot.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Ugh, that Elliot... I can't believe how many times I've had to tell him I'm not interested in him. Smug, self-absorbed swine like him are the absolute worst! If only more men were cut from the same cloth as Eldie... It's too bad they aren't, else perhaps someone would stand a chance to marry me. Perhaps.

speaker: Yves
text: Er... Be that as it may, Lord Eldigan's Cross Knights are still dispatched to the north at Fort Silvail, well away from here. We three are all who remain. Nordion is vulnerable, and they know it. Rest assured, my brothers and I will do all we can to defend the castle, but the odds are against us. I'm sorry, milady.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Very well. Thank you, Yves. But please, look after yourselves. Don't waste your lives for me. Be sure to tell Eva and Alva that I'm sorry for this.

speaker: Yves
text: We are not worthy of such kind words, milady. Even so, Lord Eldigan handpicked us to defend you. Our lord gave us a task, and we will see it through. As paladins of Nordion, our lives are yours, no matter what. To our dying breaths, we live to defend you!

speaker: Bordeaux
text: Let me get this straight. Eldigan ticked off the king and got himself a little prison time for his troubles? Ahahaha, that's perfect! Elliot! Lay siege to Nordion at once! Let's see some tears roll down Eldigan's Cheeks!

speaker: Elliot
text: With pleasure, Father!

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, we have trouble! It appears that Lord Eldigan has been taken prisoner and Nordion is under attack. I bear a message from Lady Lachesis, pleading for aid.

speaker: Sigurd
text: They've taken Eldigan?! Why... Why in the world would they treat a man so esteemed this way? Inform everybody to make ready. We ride for Nordion at once! No matter the cost, Lachesis needs us. He might never admit it, but Lachesis has always been dear to Eldigan. The loss of Lachesis would gravely wound him...

speaker: Deirdre
text: Milord... You're preparing for another battle, aren't you?

speaker: Sigurd
text: I'm sorry, Deirdre. I owe so much to Eldigan. I could never abandon his sister in a time like this.

speaker: Deirdre
text: I thought as much. I'm not about to stop you. No... I will accompany you.

speaker: Sigurd
text: What?! No, I can't allow that! I refuse to endanger you like this.

speaker: Deirdre
text: Milord, do you not remember our vows? You swore to never leave my side, and... I... I am... uneasy... I have a feeling that if you and I were to part, we would never find each other again... Please, grant me this. Let me stay by your side...

speaker: Sigurd
text: I'm sorry... you're right. I did promise. Very well! Let us ride together. But you mustn't leave my side.

speaker: Deirdre
text: I won't.

speaker: Holyn
text: Hah... Heh... Nobody here's ever bested me before. Who in the world are you, anyway? The way you fought... You were brimming with spirit! Hm... I'd wager there's something you're here to fight for, right? All I've done is chase the money for all these years... But I look at you, and suddenly it all feels so meaningless. Hey, I don't suppose you're recruiting? Maybe using my blade for something real and grander than me is just what I need.

speaker: Knight
text: Sigh... Who in their right mind would want to be sent to this blasted outlook? To think that even at a time like this, I, the pride of the Agustrian ballisticians, am... Hm? Is somebody there?

speaker: Knight
text: Must've been the wind...

speaker: Beowulf
text: Hey, you! Wanna hire my blade? 10,000 gold. Take it or leave it. ...Right, deal. You ain't gonna be disappointed.

speaker: Arden
text: ...Sigh. I don't get it. No matter how hard I train or how strong I get, I'm still the butt of every joke 'round here. Maybe if I were more like Alec, with how he can attack twice... That'd be all I need to get a bit of respect, methinks... and maybe a cute lass while I'm at it... Hee hee. But I'm still just me... Back to the ol' grind, I suppose... Hang on? What's this little ring thing? Ooh, maybe it's one of those magical ones I keep hearing about. That'd be grand, wouldn't it? Let's try her on... Hm... Hwooooarh! W-what's this power I'm feeling?! IS this what Alec feels like all the time?

speaker: Elliot
text: Lady Lachesis of Nordion, huh... I've been looking forward to this. She's been playing cruel games with my heart for years... But look how the tables have turned! I've an entire army behind me, against her insignificant guard. What could she possibly do? She's powerless to resist coming back to Heirhein with me! And who knows... Perhaps one day she'll admit she wants it.

speaker: Philip
text: Our task is to form a defensive line. Don't let the enemy lure you from your post. Stand your ground! Understood?

speaker: Macbeth
text: So, Heirhein's finally made their move... Perfect. Release the brigands on the villages, as we arranged! Under the old king, you couldn't even dare to meddle in any of his property... Yet it is the easiest thing to cheat Chagall! Strip everything of worth you find and bring it back here. Leave no stone unturned!

speaker: Clement
text: Heirhein is going for Nordion's throat? Hm... who do I side with here? Let's wait and see how this unfolds. Instruct the men to remain where they are until the dust settles.

speaker: Oifey
text: Heirhein is secure, sire. What are you thinking for our next move? Do we pull out?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Hm. The imminent danger has passed. Nordion should be safe, but Eldigan is still being held in the capital. Furthermore...

speaker: Oifey
text: Yes?

speaker: Sigurd
text: I'm hearing that the frontier towns in the central forests are grappling with bandit raids. We can't afford to leave them be.

speaker: Oifey
text: Agreed. It is crucial that we help the locals, that we might convince them we aren't their enemy. In that case, we must ride for the north at once. There's no time to waste. Let's go!

speaker: Chagall
text: You imbecile! You turned your back on this crisis to line your own pockets, and now we've lost Heirhein! There had better be a good explanation for your behavior, Macbeth!

speaker: Macbeth
text: Er, um... My humblest apologies, Your Majesty! Forgive me, I beg of you! I've already sent out the order for Waltz's sellsword unit to move in at once.

speaker: Waltz
text: Hrmph. There's the order to move in. Guess we don't 'ave much of a choice now. Bet he's gonna send us in, then 'ave his men turn tail right when we need 'em. I'm stayin' put till I see how this all plays out. Oi, Beowulf, how 'bout you?

speaker: Beowulf
text: Yeah, I ain't up for this at all, Waltz. That Macbeth swine really rubs me the wrong way. I'm this close to just walking off the job.

speaker: Waltz
text: You're a free man, Beowulf. If a job isn't right for you, you're free to quit it. That's the funny thing about mercenaries, innit? Today's pals are tomorrow's foes.

speaker: Beowulf
text: Amen to that. Hopefully we're not gonna end up enemies someday. Wouldn't have a hope in hell against you, would I?

speaker: Waltz
text: Heh... Ain't met anybody in the whole world who can take me!

speaker: Lewyn
text: What's going on, sir? What's that din outside?

speaker: Man
text: Well, well! The bard's still here, are you? You oughta get outta here. We've got bandits headed our way.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Bandits? Isn't the Agustrian army doing something about them?

speaker: Man
text: The army? Hah! That's rich, boy! The army's too busy with their little civil war to deal with our problems. Clearly that's more important than our safety. Actually, that's not all... Rumor is, the Lord of Anphony himself is pullin' the bandits' strings here.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Oh, you've gotta be kidding. That's it. That guy's gotta go. I'll go sort out the bandits, okay? Now, how big a reward'll be waiting here for me when I get back?

speaker: Man
text: Still full of hot air, are you? Just get outta here, wise guy. Nobody here's got the time to listen to you blowing your own horn.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Oh, come on! A little confidence would be nice! Eh, whatever...

speaker: Silvia
text: Oi! Lewyn! Runnin' off behind my back now, are ya?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Silvia?! Damn! Er... I mean... you found me!

speaker: Silvia
text: Yeah, I found ya! You've had your fun with me, so you're just dumpin' me without so much as a goodbye?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Hey, careful with that tongue of yours! We barely just met here a week ago! We've only been out for dinner for... What, two or three times? You're a dancer. I'm a bard... There's not much else to it.

speaker: Silvia
text: But... But you called me adorable! That... That really meant a lot to me...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Er... Sometimes I just say things and don't really mean them... Oh, come on! Enough with the tears! Things'll probably get more than a bit rough out there, though. Think you'll be okay?

speaker: Silvia
text: Yeah! I like it rough!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Geez... She was crying her eyes out just a few seconds ago. It's like she never really grew up...

speaker: Silvia
text: Huh?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Er, nothing! Let's get going.

speaker: Erinys
text: Oh, that must be Agusty Castle! I'd say we're due for a break. Hopefully we'll be able to find a lead on Prince Lewyn's whereabouts in town.

speaker: Waltz
text: Right, it's show time! Boys, you know the drill. Surrender ain't an option. Let's show 'em how real men fight!

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, we have a visitor. Lord Filat of Belhalla seeks an audience.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Lord Filat, I presume? Thank you for coming.

speaker: Filat
text: Lord Sigurd, the Agustrian conflict has escalated into full-scale war, I see. How does this battle look at the moment?

speaker: Sigurd
text: We're faring well so far, somehow, but this hasn't been easy by any means.

speaker: Filat
text: Incidentally, Lord Sigurd, I regret to say that I come bearing bad news...

speaker: Sigurd
text: What's happened?

speaker: Filat
text: Nasty rumors have emerged of late in the royal court... and they concern you. The rumors claim that, in concert with Quan of Leonster and Eldigan of Nordion, you are conspiring against the crown. This, it is said, is why you are harboring the prince of Isaach in your ranks.

speaker: Sigurd
text: What?! That's absurd! Who in the world could've started such nonsense...

speaker: Filat
text: Chancellor Reptor and Duke Langobalt.

speaker: Sigurd
text: I see... I should have known, knowing their disdain for my father. Yet, to take that grudge so far...

speaker: Filat
text: Those two are ruled by their envy of your father's immense power as Prince Kurth's advisor, I'd say. They likely believe a Chalphy-controlled prince will strip them of their influence once he takes the throne. Fear and jealousy dominate their lives... Don't let your guard down against them.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Thank you, sir. I appreciate the warning. By the way, sir... Pray tell, how goes the Isaachian campaign? Is there an end in sight?

speaker: Filat
text: It seems there is indeed, from what we've heard. We expect the triumphant return of the prince and your father any day now.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Thank the gods Prince Kurth is safe. Losing him to this war would have dealt such a blow to Grannvale's future... I know my father worries so about how the Belhalla lineage would end with His Majesty's death, unmarried as he is.

speaker: Filat
text: Indeed. Before the war started, we were trying to hasten him to search for a wife.

speaker: Sigurd
text: If I may, is there a problem?

speaker: Filat
text: Indeed... The story behind this has been well known in the royal court for a long time now. Regrettable, His Highness struggles to move on from a long-lost love.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Really? Why did he never marry this person?

speaker: Filat
text: Well... Perhaps I ought to tell you the complete tale. This happened some twenty years ago. Prince Kurth had an affair with the duchess of Velthomer, a truly lovely woman as I recall. Duke Victor of Velthomer was... Well, he was a philanderer of the worst degree, and had countless lovers. The prince, of course, is nothing like him. He wished only to support the duchess at first, but the two soon fell deeply in love. Victor was distraught, needless to say. He penned a letter denouncing the pair, then he took his own life. The duchess could bear to stay no longer. She fled Grannvale and was never seen again. As I recall, her name was Sigyn.

speaker: Sigurd
text: ...Wow. That's horrible... So she was the mother of Lord Arvis...

speaker: Filat
text: Indeed. I can scarcely imagine what this was like for him... Losing both parents at only the age of seven...

speaker: Sigurd
text: Mm. And yet, I feel so sorry for the prince. Not to mention, for Sigyn as well...

speaker: Filat
text: Oh! My apologies. I'm sure a soldier of your caliber has better things to worry about than court gossip. Please, don't worry about the story. You have a war with Agustria to win, after all! Farewell, Lord Sigurd. We look forward to the day that you, too, return to the fatherland in triumph.

speaker: Clement
text: You can't be serious! They've come as far as Anphony?! Are they just going to keep going until all Agustria is theirs? They'll have to come this way. We've no choice but to fight. Deploy the ballistae. We're all that stands between the capital and Grannvale's dogs of war!

speaker: Erinys
text: King Chagall, with all due respect, may we begin already? I need to find Prince Lewyn as quickly as possible. You said you know his location. That's the only reason I'm here.

speaker: Chagall
text: Apologies for the delay, knight, but I just received word of a lead for you. I trust you've noticed we're currently contending with a Grannvale invasion? They have taken Prince Lewyn captive! My scouts report that their army is arresting and executing anyone and anything which stands in their way. Your prince is being held in Evans Castle. Reports say that he is soon to face the axe.

speaker: Erinys
text: No... I can't allow this! Thank you for your assistance. We'll leave to rescue him at once. Our queen, Rahna, cautioned us against clashing with other nations on our mission, but we may have no choice. Should Grannvale's troops cross our way, they'll be confronted without hesitation.

speaker: Chagall
text: Oho... This is even better than I'd hoped! Best of luck on your hunt.

speaker: Erinys
text: I'll be on my way, then.

speaker: Chagall
text: She's gone... Pah! Stupid little girl. Ready the Agusty knights to deploy! End those pigs in a single strike!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Good. Mackily is ours. That leaves the capital, Agusty…

speaker: Oifey
text: Indeed, sire, but don't get too careless. We've been informed that Agusty still hosts a sizable defensive force. We ought to take the most utmost care.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Mm, you're right. Who knows what Chagall has up his sleeve…

speaker: Chagall
text: W-what?! Mackily has fallen too? Ugh... Zane! Your unit's our last line of defense. Take the field, immediately!

speaker: Zane
text: Y-yes, sir, but-

speaker: Chagall
text: Cease your whining! Get out there!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Chagall... So quick to panic at the first sign of trouble, are we?

speaker: Chagall
text: Y-you! Manfroy!! If it weren't for your schemes, I wouldn't be in this mess! How in the blazes will you fix this?!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Heh heh... You exaggerate my role. All I did was advise the removal of the king, obstacle to your ambition as he was. All else was your choice. Can you doubt this?

speaker: Chagall
text: I... Damn it all! How is Sigurd's little army even this strong? This isn't fair! Manfroy, I'm begging you... Help me. What am I supposed to do now?!

speaker: Manfroy
text: As I said, this isn't over. As a last resort, I do believe you have a fellow of use imprisoned here... Yes, I speak of Eldigan. Eldigan and Sigurd have been associates for years. Sigurd will unquestionably listen to Eldigan's counsel. Of course, Eldigan can't do that while locked up, can he? Go apologize to him.

speaker: Chagall
text: Er... Y-yes, of course! Surely, Eldigan is the answer! Now, if you'll excuse me...

speaker: Manfroy
text: Ugh... what a simpleton.

speaker: Dark Mage
text: Your Excellency, I bear news from the east. Just now, I bore witness to the assassination of Prince Kurth.

speaker: Manfroy
text: Is that so? Excellent. This grows more interesting, if I do say so myself. With Kurth's death there remains but a single scion to Naga's holy lineage, and that old fool hardly needs our help to die. And then, all that will remain is the restoration of the dark one, and then the world will belong to us...

speaker: Dark Mage
text: What of Duke Arvis, Your Excellency? Is he in agreement with your plan?

speaker: Manfroy
text: Why, of course. As a bearer of the dark one's blood, what choice does he have? Not even one of Arvis' stature can afford the wider world learning of his dark heritage, lest he be burned at the stake. Could a man as prideful as Arvis bear to meet such an end?

speaker: Dark Mage
text: So he will betray his king and style himself emperor, and...

speaker: Manfroy
text: Indeed... But that will not be enough. Arvis alone cannot restore the dark god. We still need one more person... That woman's daughter.

speaker: Zane
text: Men, move out! We may die here today, but we shall die in the fatherland's name!

speaker: Yves
text: Milady, we three shall return to Nordion. Before we leave, however, we have something for you. This ring will help you fight more like a mounted knight. Put it on and it will allow you to keep moving after fighting or healing. I know it will prove highly useful to you. Take care, milady!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Deirdre?! Oh, thank the gods! You’re alright!

speaker: Deirdre
text: Mm. The enemy captured and imprisoned me, but I knew… I knew you would come for me, no matter what.

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, King Chagall survived the battle, but he was badly wounded. He's currently being attended to by a royal priest.

speaker: Sigurd
text: From what I heard, somebody pulled him from the battlefield when he was defeated. Who in the world would've done that...?

speaker: Eldigan
text: That was me, Sigurd. I rescued King Chagall. I preserved the life of the last survivor of the Agusty dynasty. No matter how unwise his decisions, no matter how ill his temper, I cannot sit in silence and allow my liege to die.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Hm? Eldigan?! You're safe! Thank the gods! I've been looking everywhere for you, since I heard you'd been arrested.

speaker: Eldigan
text: I suppose I was... But what is the meaning of this, Sigurd? Why is your army swarming the capital the first thing I found upon release? Why are reports saying our castles are now under the rule of Grannvale officers, as if we are a mere tributary state? I'm indisposed for barely any time at all, only to find Grannvale has made itself at home in Agustria behind my back! There had better be a damned good explanation for all of this, Sigurd, or there will be consequences.

speaker: Sigurd
text: I'm so sorry, Eldigan. You're absolutely right: none of this makes sense to me, either. As if out of nowhere, the entirety of Agustria suddenly turned against us. We had no choice. I've been ordered to remain here with my army for the time being, to maintain peace and order. Eldigan, please. I know this is a dreadful situation, but one year is all I need. I can restore the country's peace to normal and repair our diplomatic ties, but only if I'm allowed time to do it. Once our time is through, we'll leave your country with no objections. My king and I pledge our word.

speaker: Eldigan
text: Hm... I suppose I've little choice but to take you at your word. Very well: you have your year. I shall relocate the king to the northern Madino Castle for his own protection. I'll also leave my Cross Knights stationed at Fort Silvail. Offer even the slightest provocation, and your forces will have us to answer to. Remember, I'm holding you to your word. Break your promise, and we will break you. Do I make myself clear, Sigurd?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Of course. You know I'm not about to betray you. Please, Eldigan. You have to trust me!

speaker: Man
text: Anphony's Lord Macbeth is the foulest, most gold-obsessed man there is. He does nothin' but torment us for his own profit. I wish I could kill em' with my bare hands!

speaker: Young Woman
text: Hey, thanks for saving us! I want you to have this, one of my favorite things. It's a pretty little bracelet, huh? Wear it at the shops and the nice man there'll be happy to give ya a discount!

speaker: Woman
text: War's the most dreadful thing, and 'tis always the innocent and helpless who suffer most for it. Please... go home to your families.

speaker: Old Man
text: We can’t thank you enough for helpin’ us. This here sword’s the best we can do. It’s an unusual sword, innit? They call it an armorslayer. In the right hands it’ll cleave through the thickest armor. If your hands aren’t the right hands, though? Maybe it can make ya a quick buck at the pawn shop.

speaker: Woman
text: Lord Eldigan is a sincere and righteous man, but alas, his sincerity's never been welcome to the ears of King Chagall. That's gotta be why he was locked up. Please, for the good of all Agustria... Help Lord Eldigan!

speaker: Man
text: The great Lord Eldigan of Nordion is a descendant of Hezul the Brave, one of the legendary Twelve Crusaders. He wields Hezul's old weapon, Mystletainn, the demon blade. They say it's as strong as Isaach's Balmung and Chalphy's Tyrfing... The three mightiest blades in all of creation.

speaker: Old Man
text: The late King Imca was truly a great man. His sudden passing has been nothin' but devastating for us all. He's barely been buried for long and his son Chagall's already runnin' the country into the ground! If Lord Eldigan had a claim to the throne, somehow, then we wouldn't be in this mess…

speaker: Woman
text: Psst! Wanna hear something saucy? Y’know how Lord Eldigan has a li’l sister, right? Well, lookin’ at ‘em, wouldn’t ya say there’s more to it than that? If you know what I mean… Ohoho! I love me a li’l bit of gossip! Hmm? I’ve better things to do than run me mouth, y’say? Fine, then.

speaker: Young Man
text: There's still gotta be descendants of the dark lord Loptyr livin' somewhere, right? Folk in the big cities like Agusty an' Mackily certainly seem to think so. Every year they do these huge hunts for Loptyr's spawn. They arrest a ton of people, then burn 'em all at the stake, even if they're innocent... Madness, I tell ya!

speaker: Old Man
text: Beware of Bishop Clement, the lord of Mackily Castle. That dastard wields a magical staff that they call a Sleep staff. If you're not careful, you'll find yourself snoozin' and wide open to bein' attacked.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Sir Sigurd! Thank goodness you're here! Things were looking so bleak for a moment...

speaker: Sigurd
text: I'm glad to see you're safe, Lachesis. What about Eldigan? Is he still being held?

speaker: Lachesis
text: Yes, he's still in Agusty... It's as if all the lords of Agustria have turned on us. Please, Sir Sigurd... Lend us your might. No matter what it takes, my brother must be saved.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Of course. I've no fondness for bringing war to foreign lands, but in this case we've little choice. His Majesty, King Azmur, is aware of King Imca's assassination, and of Chagall's hand in it. He's received word of Chagall's ambitions to invade Grannvale itself, and has already approved military action. His Majesty also believes Eldigan's rescue to be vital if we're to put an end to hostilities. Rest assured, Lachesis. I swear that I'll save Eldigan…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Wait... Erinys?! The hell are you doing here?

speaker: Erinys
text: Huh? Aren't you... ...It can't be! Prince Lewyn?! ...What exactly are you wearing, milord?

speaker: Lewyn
text: What, this? I'm a bard now. You know, walking the land, spreading songs and cheer? What do you say: perfect, or perfect?

speaker: Erinys
text: Er... Perfect? But why, milord... Aren't you supposed to be held captive at Evans? I got here as fast as I could, but...

speaker: Lewyn
text: I'm imprisoned at Evans, am I? Where'd you hear that one?

speaker: Erinys
text: King Chagall of Agustria said so.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Chagall? Hah! Hate to break it to you, Erinys, but you've been tricked! It's nice and all that you're so ready to trust, but you wouldn't last ten seconds out there in the city! It'd eat you and your innocence alive. You might even end up like Silvia...

speaker: Erinys
text: Silvia, milord...?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Oh, Silvia's... Er, it's not important. Point is, what are you doing all the way out here?

speaker: Erinys
text: Isn't it obvious? I'm here to find and bring you home, milord. It's been two years since you fled Silesse. Her Majesty is gravely worried about you. Please, milord. Come home with me.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Do you have any idea what that'd do to Silesse, Erinys? If I go back, I'll have no choice but to take the throne. It's my late father's will, but my uncles would never accept it. Just one false step and we'd have a civil war, just like here. And it's always the common folk who suffer for it! If there are people who want to be kings or whatever, great! Out here, though? I'm free, and I like it that way. I don't want a thing to do with that throne. For the good of Silesse, just give it to one of my uncles.

speaker: Erinys
text: I can't allow that, milord. You know as well as I that the kings of Silesse must bear descent from Forseti, the wind god. You, milord, are the sole living scion of his lineage. Neither of your uncles bear it. You milord, are Silesse's future! Yourself and your uncles aside, all Silesse wishes to see you claim the throne. And... And your mother, the queen, was in tears when she sent me... Please, milord... Come back.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Erinys... Ugh, don't you start crying too! Give me a break... I can't stand to see a woman in tears... Okay, fine. I'll think about going home. Just... Give me some time to muster the nerve, alright?

speaker: Erinys
text: Thank you. In that case, I'm staying with you until you're ready, milord. I'll send a messenger back to Silesse to report that you're safe.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Wow, you're persistent, I'll grant you that. All right. I think I'll stay with Sigurd's army for now. He's a pretty neat guy to work with, not to mention his army's full of beauties! Hey, Erinys, you could stand to get to know some of the ladies here. Maybe their stylishness could rub off on you a bit!

speaker: Erinys
text: Yes, milord...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Hey, I'm just kidding, Erinys! Relax a bit! Don't take everything so seriously! ...Heh, nobody in the world's as sweet as you. Don't you ever change a thing.

speaker: Erinys
text: Y-yes, sir... I mean, no, milord…

speaker: Ethlyn
text: How are you faring so far, Deirdre? I know my brother is worried something fierce about you risking your life like this.

speaker: Deirdre
text: Ethlyn...? Thank you for asking, but I'm doing just fine for now. Everything will be alright. I can feel it. So long as I'm at Sigurd's side, our happiness will see us through.

speaker: Ethlyn
text: I don't think I've ever seen Sigurd as happy as he's been since he met you. He's practically a changed man!

speaker: Deirdre
text: Ethlyn... Here. I'd like you to have this. I've been meaning to give it to you for a while.

speaker: Ethlyn
text: Oh? ...Is- is this a light brand?! Wow... These are so rare and hard to come by! Are you sure you want to give me this?

speaker: Deirdre
text: Of course. I know that it will serve you well.

speaker: Ethlyn
text: I can't thank you enough, Deirdre! I'll always treasure it!

speaker: Dew
text: Hey! Lachesis! There y'are! Check out this little beauty of a sword! Thought I'd give it to ya.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Oh? I can't say I've seen a blade so peculiar before. Does it have a name?

speaker: Dew
text: It's called a thief's sword. Wanna gut the bad guys? This thing's yer best friend.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Er... Thank you. Although, why are you giving this to me? I'm hardly complaining, but surely you need a decent sword?

speaker: Dew
text: Nah, I'm not bothered. There ain't any point in me keeping it. Let's just say it does a lot more than just stab... Heh. See ya around!

speaker: Quan
text: Finn, these Agustrians are proving to be far worthier opponents than the thugs of Verdane, wouldn't you say? For stronger enemies, what could be more fitting than a stronger weapon? Let's see how you fare with this.

speaker: Finn
text: Is that... a brave lance?! Are you sure you want to entrust me with such a rarity?

speaker: Quan
text: Of course. You are House Leonster's most promising young knight. You are our future, and I'd sooner see you live this day. Arming you properly is the best I can do to help for now, so yes. Take this spear.

speaker: Finn
text: What an honor, milord! Thank you.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Lewyn, I presume? The one who's been helping defend the villages? I appreciate the aid. As I understand it, you're a bard, but you also wield magic? That's unusual.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Something like that. I guess it's a hobby. You're that Sigurd fellow, aren't you? It's obvious what your little hobby is: war! Clearly you've got so much spare time, you spend it starting war after war!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Come again? You seem angry, but-

speaker: Lewyn
text: Don't play dumb! Think about the people of all the countries that you're flattening! You come barging in, swords flashing, and all you do is ruin the lives of normal folk who're trying to make a living here!

speaker: Sigurd
text: You're right. My apologies, Lewyn... I didn't even think about that, but I can't stand knowing I've done this to them.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Words are just words without actions backing them up. If you really feel so bad, then why not pull your army out?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Mm, you're right... Very well. I'll consult with my troops and arrange a retreat.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Wait, you're serious about this?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Of course. I've been mulling over retreating for a while already, and you just gave me the answer to all of this. I've had enough of the war approach. I think I'd rather seek a diplomatic answer.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah, no. Trying to get through to Chagall now would be a total waste of everyone's time. Besides, if you lot pull out now, then nothing stands between a peeved king and all the citizens who've helped you so far. Are you sure you're okay with leaving them all hanging like that?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Well, no, but... Er... I…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Ahahaha! Y'know, I guess I was wrong about you. You're alright, Sigurd. Say, why don't I help you finish this fight up?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Er... Okay, I suppose... Who are you, anyway?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Who, me? I'm just a wayward troubadour, my friend…

speaker: Alec
text: Hey! You're Silvia, aren't you? Excuse me for being so forward, but you're adorable!

speaker: Silvia
text: Finally! Here I was, thinkin' this army's nothin' but stiff and borin' military types. It's about time someone appreciated me!

speaker: Alec
text: Heh, I guess I'm the only decent guy around here. Glad I found you.

speaker: Silvia
text: Thanks! Me, too!

speaker: Alec
text: I guess we'll be here a while, so how about dinner sometime? Bet that'd be nice.

speaker: Silvia
text: Ooh, yeah! Maybe I'll dance for you too! I've got a special one that nobody's seen yet. It's kinda embarrassing, 'cause it's VERY special. Maybe I'll show it to ya, though!

speaker: Alec
text: Y-you will? Oh, I can't wait!

speaker: Silvia
text: Eee! It's the great Lord Sigurd!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Er... Hello, there? You're a dancer, right? The battlefield is too dangerous for the likes of you. Go back to the castle.

speaker: Silvia
text: Come on, sir! Don'tcha know who I am? I'm Silviaaaaaaa! You can call me Silvie if ya want, though!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Look, I'm sorry, but I really don't have the time to look after children. Be a good little girl and run along back to the castle, alright?

speaker: Silvia
text: Rrrgh... Good little girl?! Look at me! How d'you look at someone this hot and think "little girl"?! What is wrong with you? Never thought ya'd be such a borin' old stiff, just like everyone else 'round here...

speaker: Sigurd
text: Enough! I have work to do.

speaker: Silvia
text: Sigh... Oh, well. Back to being a lone, delicate flower, sprouting in a battlefield... My beauty is nothing to the tide of bodies...

speaker: Sigurd
text: Ugh... What in the world is…

speaker: Beowulf
text: Hey, you! You're that Nordion lady, aren't ya?

speaker: Lachesis
text: E-excuse me?! Such boorishness! What manner of lowlife is asking?

speaker: Beowulf
text: Oh, er, sorry 'bout that, ma'am. The name's Beowulf, a hired blade.

speaker: Lachesis
text: What do you want?

speaker: Beowulf
text: Uh... Well, I just wanted to give ya a quick heads up about fightin'. See, war ain't the fun and games you're used to. And someone as green as you... Well, you're gonna get in the way. Besides, a princess's a princess. Why not run along back to your castle now?

speaker: Lachesis
text: H-how dare you! My business in battle is just that: my business! Not yours! I'll nail your foul mouth closed!

speaker: Beowulf
text: Heh. You really are Eldigan's sister. Shoulda known you wouldn't be a pushover.

speaker: Lachesis
text: What's that? Do you know my brother?!

speaker: Beowulf
text: Oh, yeah. Eldigan and me, we go way back. I'd never've been so noisy if he hadn't asked me to keep an eye on ya.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Is that so? Oh, I'm sorry for snapping at you so.

speaker: Beowulf
text: Eh, I've seen a lot worse in me time. Hey, how about a quick battle lesson? Eldigan thought it'd be a big help.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Why, thank you. I'd like that.

speaker: Erinys
text: Lord Sigurd, I presume?

speaker: Sigurd
text: I am indeed. And you, madam?

speaker: Erinys
text: My name is Erinys. I'm a royal knight of Silesse. I wish to join your army, so as to keep an eye on Prince Lewyn.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Er... Prince Lewyn? What are you on about?

speaker: Erinys
text: My lord Lewyn is the rightful heir to the Silessian crown. He is a scion of Ced, the Wind Crusader, and is the sole inheritor of his power.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Wait, THAT Lewyn?! Heh... I knew there was something odd about him, but I'd never have thought him to be Silessian royalty. Any idea why he's pretending to be a bard?

speaker: Erinys
text: That's a long story, sir, and I'm hardly the most qualified to tell it. Perhaps try asking him later, but for now...

speaker: Sigurd
text: Fair enough. It's hardly my business, anyway. I'm glad you're here, Erinys. A pegasus knight among us would be a great help. Would you mind aiding us in battle?

speaker: Erinys
text: Yes, sir! I'll do my part!

speaker: Beowulf
text: Don't take this personally, yeah? We've all gotta make a living...

speaker: Beowulf
text: D-damn... this just aint my…

speaker: Erinys
text: Listen carefully, Grannvale knight! Release Prince Lewyn immediately!

speaker: Erinys
text: Oh... Queen Rahna... I failed you... Forgive me…

speaker: Erinys
text: Prince Lewyn?! This can't be happening…

speaker: Elliot
text: Gah... Grannvale! Don't interfere with this, unless you want me to wipe the floor with you too!

speaker: Elliot
text: Lachesis! I grow weary of this little song and dance! Become my wife, and I'll spare you.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Enough, you vile worm! I'd sooner die than be your wife!

speaker: Elliot
text: Gah! Blast... Why must... everything... go Eldigan's…

speaker: Philip
text: Warriors of Grannvale... So long as I draw breath, you shall never reach Heirhein!

speaker: Philip
text: L-Lord Bordeaux... I beg... your pardon...

speaker: Bordeaux
text: Grannvale's here already! Blast... Why couldn't my men have been useful for once? Fine, I'll take this into my own hands!

speaker: Bordeaux
text: Gah... My... castle…

speaker: Waltz
text: You seem like decent folk, but a job's a job. Too bad.

speaker: Waltz
text: Th-this can't be... You got me…

speaker: Waltz
text: Heh... Beowulf. You ain't even close to a match for me yet.

speaker: Beowulf
text: Oh, definitely... But this is what they're payin' me for.

speaker: Macbeth
text: I-it can't be! Grannvale's here already? Damn it all! What are those useless mercenaries doing out there?! Ugh... Fine, I'll fight them myself!

speaker: Macbeth
text: Ugh... why me...?

speaker: Macbeth
text: H-huh? Who are you?

speaker: Lewyn
text: You're that Macbeth slime, aren't you? You've no business being a lord. Here, allow me to help you... retire.

speaker: Chagall
text: Tch... Don't even think about underestimating me. You don't stand a chance of besting me!

speaker: Chagall
text: Urgh... No, w-wait! Spare me! Please…

speaker: Zane
text: Grannvale's dogs stand no chance in the face of my warrior's pride! I'll put an end to your rampage!

speaker: Zane
text: No... Is this... the beginning of the end... for Agustria…

speaker: Chagall
text: Eldigan's little sister? What do you think you're doing, defying your king like this?!

speaker: Lachesis
text: I'd sooner bow to a festering pig than call you my king! Return my brother! Now!

speaker: Chagall
text: Heh heh... So, it's you again. You've finally realized, have you? Ignorant wench.

speaker: Erinys
text: How dare you, Chagall! You'll pay dearly for deceiving me! Prepare yourself!!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Congratulations, Seliph! You’ve endured so much so well to make it this far.

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank you, Lewyn, but our victory means precious little while our world still lies in ruins. Where do we begin from there?

speaker: Lewyn
text: There’s only one way to rebuild all the sacred lands. Everyone needs to come together and share the work among you. And for that, you’ll need a good leader. The crusaders’ heirs will be returning home to assume their rightful thrones. And with the proper leadership, they can pool their strengths again to build a new world, one where all can live in happiness.

speaker: Seliph
text: A new world, you say…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah, Seliph.. A new world. And your role is the most crucial of all. You’ll remain here in Belhalla, and you’ll guide the rise of this new world as the King of Grannvale.

speaker: Seliph
text: Hold on. I’M to be the king?!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Mm-hmm. After all that’s happened, you and Julia are the last living heirs of the blood of Grannvale’s kings. The two of you have inherited the last will of all who lost their lives on this path. These souls watch over you, even now. You mustn’t forget the light for which they strove.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm… I understand, Lewyn. So long as I have the power, I’ll do all I can.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Now, Julia. What do you say?

speaker: Julia
text: I agree, of course. I wish to aid Lord Seliph… No, my lord brother, every step of the way. I know this path will be a gruelling one, but that’s all the more reason to give it my all…

speaker: Julia
text: Lady Lover, you’ll do all you can to aid my brother as well, won’t you?

speaker: Lover
text: Yes, and gladly so! But, er… Lady Julia, what about…

speaker: Julia
text: I… I must atone for the fate of Lord Sigurd… I know that’s what my mother, Lady Deirdre, would wish of me…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Mm-hmm. You and Julia were the last surviving heirs of the blood of Grannvale’s kings. But we lost Julia in today’s battle…

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia… I swore I would always protect her… And I failed. Her death is my fault…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Whatever you do, you can’t let Julia’s death be in vain, Seliph. She bore the weight of her awful fate on her shoulders, but still she never gave up. I guess she got that from her mother in a way. Deirdre, too, was always haunted by her mistakes and failures. I’m sure you understand, Seliph, that you inherited the last will on all those who lost their lives on this path. These souls watch over you, even now. You mustn’t forget the light for which they strove.

speaker: Seliph
text: Of course… I understand, Lewyn. I’ll guide this world with all I have, so long as I draw breath. In Julia’s name…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Well, then! Looks like everyone is making their way here from the front lines. Seliph, this’ll be your first task as king. I’m sure they’d all love some words of thanks.

speaker: Shannan
text: Well, that’s it. I’m going home, Seliph. I’ve left the Isaachian people to wait long enough.

speaker: Seliph
text: I doubt I could ever thank you enough for all you’ve done for me, Shannan. All my life, you’ve been here to protect me at every turn. I owe you so dearly.

speaker: Shannan
text: Your father, Lord Sigurd, was always there for me when I was a child, as was the Lady Deirdre. But when we lost Lady Deirdre, I couldn’t do a thing to stop it… I failed Lord Sigurd. Even now, I’ll never forget that day.... You don’t owe me a thing, Seliph. Not when I’ve caused you so much pain…

speaker: Seliph
text: No, Shannan. If it weren’t for you and the people of Isaach, I wouldn’t be here today. To me, Isaach will always be home. Nothing will ever change that.

speaker: Shannan
text: I’m sure everyone back in Isaach will be heartened to hear such kind words.

speaker: Lover
text: Come on, Shannan. Lord Seliph is the king of Grannvale-to-be yet here you are, talking to him as if he’s but your younger brother.

speaker: Shannan
text: Lover… Yeah, I suppose you’re right. I ought to put on proper airs! “King Seliph”.... No, that’s not quite right. Perhaps “Your Imperial Majesty, the King” then?

speaker: Lover
text: I’m sorry… I shouldn’t have said that. Bidding farewell to Lord Seliph must be hard enough without my commentary! My apologies, to both of you. I shouldn’t have said something so crass…

speaker: Shannan
text: Heh, it’s fine. You did speak honestly, after all.

speaker: Lover
text: Shannan…

speaker: Lover
text: C’mon, Shannan! This is Grannvale’s new king you’re talking to here. I’m not sure you should be this brotherly to him.

speaker: Shannan
text: Lover… Yeah, I suppose you’re right. I ought to put on proper airs! “King Seliph”.... No, that’s not quite right. Perhaps “Your Imperial Majesty, the King” then?

speaker: Lover
text: Oh! I didn’t mean to anger you, Shannan. You’re right… Parting ways like this has to be so painful for you already. I’m really sorry. That was just horrid of me.

speaker: Shannan
text: Heh, it’s fine. You did speak honestly, after all.

speaker: Lover
text: Shannan…

speaker: Seliph
text: I’ve always thought of you as a brother, Shannan. I pray we never forget that bond.

speaker: Shannan
text: My blade will always be yours, King Seliph. I’ll never forget that so long as I live.

speaker: Scáthach
text: Lord Seliph, I’m headed home with the king. I’ve got a country to help King Shannan rebuild. That’s all I really want.

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, of course, Scáthach. I know King Shannan will depend on your support. And I know your mother, Lady Ayra, would love nothing more than for you to devote your life to the Isaachian people.

speaker: Scáthach
text: Yes, sir. My life is theirs!

speaker: Lana
text: I’ve never seen you so happy, Scáthach. But then again, knowing we’re finally about to go home, I feel the same way!

speaker: Scáthach
text: Oh, you too? I almost forgot. We both grew up in Isaach, didn’t we?

speaker: Lana
text: Mm…

speaker: Scáthach
text: We’re going back together, right?

speaker: Lana
text: Yes… I’ve always hoped we would.

speaker: Scáthach
text: Whew! I’m relieved to hear you say it.

speaker: Lover
text: I’ve never seen you this happy, Scáthach! It must be nice to finally be going home!

speaker: Scáthach
text: It’s only natural, Lover. I did spend most of my life there, after all!

speaker: Lover
text: So, er…

speaker: Scáthach
text: Yeah...?

speaker: Lover
text: Say, Scáthach… Is it okay if I come with you?

speaker: Scáthach
text: What, you want to come? To Isaach? With me?

speaker: Lover
text: I do…

speaker: Scáthach
text: Wow… Thanks, Lover!

speaker: Scáthach
text: I’m heading home now, King Seliph. With King Shannan’s death, it’s up to me to protect Isaach in his place.

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, of course, Scáthach. You’re next in line for the Isaachian throne, are you not? I know you’ll take good care of the people.

speaker: Scáthach
text: Yes, sir. My life is theirs!

speaker: Lover
text: Still glum, huh, Scáthach… Lord Shannan’s death is really hurting you…

speaker: Scáthach
text: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Larcei and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

speaker: Lover
text: Huh… You think I can help you at all by staying by your side?

speaker: Scáthach
text: Huh… You’re not serious, Lover?

speaker: Lover
text: Yep! If that’s what you want, Lover…

speaker: Lover
text: You still look so sad, Scáthach. Lord Shannan’s death still weighs heavily on you, doesn’t it?

speaker: Scáthach
text: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Larcei and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

speaker: Lover
text: Perhaps… Do you think having me around will do you any good?

speaker: Scáthach
text: Huh… You’re not serious, Lover?

speaker: Lover
text: If that’s what you want, Scáthach, then I am…

speaker: Lover
text: You look awfully sad, Scáthach… Lord Shannan’s death is still troubling you, right?

speaker: Scáthach
text: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Larcei and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

speaker: Lover
text: Huh… Do you think having me by your side will do you any good?

speaker: Scáthach
text: Huh? ...You’re not serious, Lover?

speaker: Lover
text: If you want me there, Scáthach, then I am…

speaker: Larcei
text: I’m going home with Scáthach, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Larcei… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care....

speaker: Larcei
text: I’m going home with the king, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: You still feel lonesome, yes? After what happened to Scáthach, I mean… I pray you’ll still work your hardest for Isaach.

speaker: Larcei
text: I know, I know! I’m fine. I… I’m so proud of my brother.

speaker: Seliph
text: Larcei… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care....

speaker: Larcei
text: I’m going home, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Larcei, I… I beg your forgiveness for what happened to Lover.

speaker: Larcei
text: No, sir. It’s my fault that he’s… I failed to protect him. I’ll never forget the time we had together, no matter what…

speaker: Seliph
text: Larcei… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care…

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Okay, Lord Seliph, I’m headed home with King Shannan. I’ve got a country to help them rebuild. That’s all I really want.

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, of course, Rodolbahn. I know he’ll depend on your support. I pray your combined might will bring peace to the people of Isaach.

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Yes, sir. My life is theirs!

speaker: Lana
text: I’ve never seen you so happy, Rodolbahn. But then again, knowing we’re finally about to go home, I feel the same way!

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Oh, you too? I almost forgot. We both grew up in Isaach, didn’t we?

speaker: Lana
text: Mm…

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: We’re going back together, right?

speaker: Lana
text: Yes… I’ve always hoped we would.

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Whew! I’m relieved to hear you say it.

speaker: Lover
text: I’ve never seen you this happy, Rodolbahn! It must be nice to finally be going home!

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: It’s only natural, Lover. I did spend most of my life there, after all!

speaker: Lover
text: So, er…

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Yeah...?

speaker: Lover
text: Say, Rodolbahn… Is it okay if I come with you?

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: What, you want to come? To Isaach? With me?

speaker: Lover
text: I do…

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Wow… Thanks, Lover!

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Okay, Lord Seliph, I’m headed home. Now that King Shannan’s dead, Isaach needs someone like me to watch over it in his place.

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, of course, Rodolbahn. King Shannan’s demise brought an end to the royal Isaachian bloodline, yes? I promise you Grannvale will do all it can to aid you, but the welfare and defense of Isaach will depend on you.

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Yes, sir. My life is theirs!

speaker: Lover
text: Still glum, huh, Rodolbahn… Lord Shannan’s death is really hurting you…

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Radney and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

speaker: Lover
text: Huh… You think I can help you at all by staying by your side?

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Huh… You’re not serious, Lover?

speaker: Lover
text: Yep! If that’s what you want, Lover…

speaker: Lover
text: You still look so sad, Rodolbahn. Lord Shannan’s death still weighs heavily on you, doesn’t it?

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Radney and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

speaker: Lover
text: Perhaps… Do you think having me around will do you any good?

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Huh… You’re not serious, Lover?

speaker: Lover
text: If that’s what you want, Rodolbahn, then I am…

speaker: Radney
text: I’m going home with Rodolbahn, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Radney… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care…

speaker: Radney
text: I’m going home with the king, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Radney, I… I beg your forgiveness for what happened to Rodolbahn.

speaker: Radney
text: No, sir. I believe he died a happy man. I… I’m proud of him, I guess…

speaker: Seliph
text: Radney… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care…

speaker: Radney
text: I’m going home, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Radney, I… I beg your forgiveness for what happened to Lover.

speaker: Radney
text: No, sir. It’s my fault that he’s… I failed to protect him. I’ll never forget the time we had together, no matter what…

speaker: Seliph
text: Radney… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care…

speaker: Dimna
text: Lord Seliph…

speaker: Seliph
text: You’re bound for Isaach as well, Dimna?

speaker: Dimna
text: I am. Thanks for everything, sir.

speaker: Seliph
text: Oh, no. It is I who owes you thanks! Thank you, Dimna.

speaker: Dimna
text: Take care of yourself, sir!

speaker: Lover
text: Going back to Isaach, Dimna?

speaker: Dimna
text: Yeah, that’s the plan…

speaker: Lover
text: Huh… Really?

speaker: Dimna
text: Yeah… And I really want you to come with me, Lover.

speaker: Lover
text: Wait, really?! You REALLY want me to take you along?

speaker: Dimna
text: Yeah! I mean, if you want to come, of course.

speaker: Lover
text: Are you going back to Isaach, Dimna?

speaker: Dimna
text: Yeah, that’s the plan…

speaker: Lover
text: Hm… Is that so…

speaker: Dimna
text: Yeah… And I really want you to come with me, Lover.

speaker: Lover
text: Eh? Really?! You… You really want me with you…

speaker: Dimna
text: Yeah! I mean, if you want to come, of course.

speaker: Larcei
text: You’re going back to Isaach, right, Dimna?

speaker: Dimna
text: Yeah, that’s the plan… Are you?

speaker: Larcei
text: I, er… I’m not sure I should…

speaker: Dimna
text: ...I want to go home with you, Larcei.

speaker: Larcei
text: Er, why?

speaker: Dimna
text: Because I love you, silly!

speaker: Larcei
text: Wh- You can’t just say this stuff out loud, you moron! Eh, doesn’t matter. We’ll go home… together.

speaker: Mana
text: Thank you so much for all you’ve done for me, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mana… So even you…

speaker: Mana
text: Isaach is the only place I could ever call home. I need to work with Dimna and the others to restore Isaach.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mana…

speaker: Mana
text: Thank you so much for all you’ve done for me, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mana…. I’m so, so sorry.

speaker: Mana
text: Why?

speaker: Seliph
text: I let Lover die… I couldn’t do a thing to save him. But he still keeps watch over you, even now… I know it.

speaker: Mana
text: Y-yes, Lord Seliph…

speaker: Mana
text: Thank you so much for all you’ve done for me, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mana… So even you…

speaker: Mana
text: Isaach is the only place I could ever call home. I know it’ll be lonesome, but there’s nothing I can do now...

speaker: Seliph
text: I’m so sorry, Mana...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Well, it’s time to say goodbye. Best of luck!

speaker: Leif
text: I couldn’t possibly thank you enough for everything, Lord Seliph. I’ll be departing for Leonster shortly. The Thracian peninsula has suffered from war long enough, and it’s high time that we rebuilt.

speaker: Leif
text: I know my sister, Altena, wishes dearly for a restored Thracia as well.

speaker: Seliph
text: Indeed. This war has lain waste upon Thracia, and I cannot imagine the burden laid upon you, the king-to-be of a united peninsula… I pray that you give it your best, no matter what happens.

speaker: Leif
text: I will. You take care as well, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Long ago, our fathers Sigurd and Quan were bound by the closest of friendships, sharing their deaths as they did their lives. Prince Leif, I’d love nothing more than for us to follow their example and remain lifelong friends.

speaker: Leif
text: As do I, Lord Seliph!

speaker: Lover
text: You’re about to leave, aren’t you, Leif?

speaker: Leif
text: Do you wish to accompany me, Lover?

speaker: Lover
text: Huh? Would that really be alright with you?

speaker: Leif
text: But of course! All I want is to have you and your might by my side.

speaker: Lover
text: Th-thank you!

speaker: Lover
text: So you’re off, Leif?

speaker: Leif
text: Do you wish to accompany me, Lover?

speaker: Lover
text: Huh? You’d be fine with me coming!?

speaker: Leif
text: But of course! All I want is to have you and your might by my side.

speaker: Lover
text: Hwaaah! Thank you, Leif!

speaker: Larcei
text: Leif… You’re off soon, aren’t you?

speaker: Leif
text: Do you want to accompany me, Larcei?

speaker: Larcei
text: Huh? You really want me to come?

speaker: Leif
text: But of course!

speaker: Seliph
text: So you’re destined for Thracia as well, Princess Altena…

speaker: Altena
text: I am, sir. I’ve got to help the new king in his quest to give rise to a unified Thracia… At the very least, I ought to atone for the legacy of my adopted family… Travant and Arion.

speaker: Seliph
text: How wonderful it would be, if Arion were to work together with you…

speaker: Altena
text: I… I don’t believe that could happen for the time being, sir. But perhaps someday, he’ll feel the time is right…

speaker: Finn
text: I shall be bound for home as well, milord. I wish you the best of health.

speaker: Seliph
text: Sir Finn, you’ve come to my family’s aid time and again, and for twenty years played a crucial part in both my cause and Father’s. I couldn’t possibly thank you enough…

speaker: Finn
text: No, I am a servant of House Leonster. As a knight, I have but followed where my lieges have led. No more, no less.

speaker: Seliph
text: Thracia is in your hands, Sir Finn. I hope you’ll assist Prince Leif in granting Thracia its hard-won peace.

speaker: Finn
text: Yes, sir. A peaceful Thracia was my Lord Quan’s lifelong dream as well, and I’ll do all that I can to bring that dream to life.

speaker: Hannibal
text: Many thanks, King Seliph! I shall excuse myself now.

speaker: Seliph
text: Are you headed for Thracia as well, General Hannibal?

speaker: Hannibal
text: Indeed. Thracia yet hangs in the balance, and the people await my return.

speaker: Seliph
text: Who better to lead the reconstruction of Thracia than a mighty war hero? Do your best for the youths of Thracia.

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, Cairpre. I presume you’ll be departing with the general?

speaker: Cairpre
text: I am, sir. I will be going with Papa to work to rebuild Thracia.

speaker: Seliph
text: I see… You know, Cairpre, I’ve seldom seen anyone as happy as you are now. I confess I’m a bit envious!

speaker: Cairpre
text: I’m so proud of Papa, sir. I may just be adopted, but I’m still the son of the great General Hannibal!

speaker: Lover
text: Aww, how adorable. Good thing you’ve now got me to be like a big sister for you!

speaker: Cairpre
text: Huh, Lover? ...What exactly are you talking about?

speaker: Lover
text: Hee hee! You really are still just a kid! Relax, it’ll all make total sense one day.

speaker: Lover
text: You really are the cutest, Cairpre. And from now on, you’ll have me around to be your older sister!

speaker: Cairpre
text: Huh, Lover? ...What exactly are you talking about?

speaker: Lover
text: You really are still a child. Don’t worry. Someday you’ll understand everything.

speaker: Lover
text: You’re adorable, Cairpre, y’know that? I guess from now on, you’ll need me to look after you like a big sister should.

speaker: Cairpre
text: Huh, Lover? ...What exactly are you talking about?

speaker: Lover
text: Eh, I guess you’re still just a kid. Don’t worry, you’ll get it someday.

speaker: Lover
text: C’mon, Cairpre. Cheer up! You’re a man now, right? It’ll all work out. I’ve got your back from now on.

speaker: Cairpre
text: Huh, Lover? ...What exactly are you talking about?

speaker: Lover
text: Eh, I guess you’re still just a kid. Don’t worry, you’ll get it someday.

speaker: Asaello
text: I’m going home as well, Seliph. I owe you real big.

speaker: Seliph
text: You’re a Connaught native, yes?

speaker: Asaello
text: Yeah. My folks were hunters workin’ in Connaught. They were pretty poor, then they got caught up in the war and got killed.

speaker: Seliph
text: Is that so…

speaker: Asaello
text: Guess that’s why I hate kings and nobles. Well, most of em. I mean, you’re actually alright, Seliph. Good luck out there, okay?

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank you, Asaello.

speaker: Lover
text: You’re sad, aren’t you, Asaello? Sad that you need to part with Lord Seliph…

speaker: Asaello
text: W-what? No, not even close!

speaker: Lover
text: And being with me wouldn’t help? You’d still be lonely?

speaker: Asaello
text: No, that’s not it at all! You being here means so much to me. You could never not be a help!

speaker: Lover
text: Heh… Oh, Asaello…

speaker: Lover
text: You’re sad, aren’t you, Asaello? Sad that you need to part with Lord Seliph…

speaker: Asaello
text: W-what? No, not even close!

speaker: Lover
text: And being with me wouldn’t help? Even then you’d still be lonely?

speaker: Asaello
text: No, that’s not it at all! You being here means so much to me. You could never not be a help!

speaker: Lover
text: Asaello, I know it’s going to be hard for you to leave Seliph. But don’t worry! I’ll always be here for you!

speaker: Asaello
text: Lover… Thanks, I guess. Having you around is better than nobody.

speaker: Lover
text: Tee hee! You’re so cute when you’re shy! That’s why I like you.

speaker: Asaello
text: Oh, come on, you don’t have to put that in words.

speaker: Larcei
text: Asaello… Leaving Seliph now’s gotta be pretty painful, huh? I know you’ll tough it out.

speaker: Asaello
text: I know that, Larcei. I’m not weak.

speaker: Larcei
text: What’s with the attitude? I’m just worried about you!

speaker: Asaello
text: Don’t worry about me. I told you, I’m not weak. You couldn’t possibly understand how I feel!

speaker: Larcei
text: Fine, then. I’m leaving you. You can go home by yourself!

speaker: Asaello
text: Hold on, I didn’t mean it… I’m sorry! Just don’t leave me!

speaker: Larcei
text: Hmph…

speaker: Asaello
text: Larcei… Come on. I need you.

speaker: Larcei
text: Okay, but I need you to promise one thing: don’t talk back to me ever again.

speaker: Asaello
text: F-Fine… I promise…

speaker: Larcei
text: Then all is forgiven. Let’s go.

speaker: Asaello
text: Sigh… Can’t live with her, can’t live without her…

speaker: Seliph
text: And you as well, Daisy?

speaker: Daisy
text: Yep. No offense, but I can’t say I want to sit around here twiddling my thumbs. Besides, my brother’ll need my help!

speaker: Seliph
text: Remember, there’s plenty to keep you busy in Connaught which doesn’t involve stealing.

speaker: Daisy
text: Oh! How could you SAY that, sir?! I gave the thief thing up ages ago!

speaker: Seliph
text: Heh, my apologies. Well, Daisy, take care.

speaker: Daisy
text: You too, sir…

speaker: Lewyn
text: The job awaiting you, the heroes of Thracia, certainly won’t be easy. It’s up to you to unite two peoples divided by bitter hatred, and build for them all a new, powerful land.

speaker: Ares
text: Seliph… I dearly owe you for all you’ve done to assist me. I’ll never forget so long as I live.

speaker: Seliph
text: Oh, no, Prince Ares. The joy chancing upon you brought is thanks enough! It was such an honor to meet the son of my father’s dearest friend. As tragic as their lives were, their faith in each other was unshakable to the very end. Our fathers, Prince Ares, were united by a single dream that their deaths left unfulfilled. Let us fulfill their dream where they cannot. Let the two of us, hand in hand, guide all Jugdral towards bringing the dream to life.

speaker: Ares
text: Well spoken, King Seliph! My father so dearly wished to see his beloved Agustria united in a lasting peace. In the name of his dying wish, I’ll carve up for Agustria a new, prosperous future.

speaker: Ares
text: But my might alone shall not suffice. To this end, my dearest Lover, I pray I’ll have your strength ever by my side.

speaker: Lover
text: Yep, of course! I’m gonna do everything I can to help rebuild Agustria as well. Let’s all work together to build an Agustria where anyone can live happily.

speaker: Ares
text: Indeed! So long as you remain, I know I’ll never give up.

speaker: Ares
text: But my might alone shall not suffice. To this end, my dearest Lover, I pray I’ll have your strength ever by my side.

speaker: Lover
text: But of course. I’ll dedicate my life to helping restore Agustria as well. All these years of war have burnt deep scars in Agustria. All I want is to ensure all Agustrians can live peaceful lives.

speaker: Ares
text: Indeed! So long as you remain, I know I’ll never give up.

speaker: Seliph
text: And what of you, Lene…

speaker: Lene
text: I don’t exactly have a home to go to, so I thought I’d give Agustria a try.

speaker: Seliph
text: I see… Don’t worry too much. Somebody wonderful, I know, will be graced with your charm one day, Lene.

speaker: Lene
text: Hee hee… Oh, Lord Seliph! I know you’re just trying to perk me up. But it’s okay! I’ve always got dancing… I’ve been alone my whole life. Staying alone for the rest of it won’t be that bad.

speaker: Seliph
text: Lene…

speaker: Dermott
text: I’m going with Prince Ares to Agustria, Lord Seliph. I’ll lend the prince my strength and help rebuild the country.

speaker: Seliph
text: Dermott? Ah, of course. Your mother was a noblewoman of Nordion, yes?

speaker: Dermott
text: Lord Eldigan’s sister, Lachesis, to be exact, sir. Nobody was closer to him than she was. I’ll give my entire life to fulfilling the last wishes of my mother and Eldigan, and to creating a united Agustria.

speaker: Nanna
text: Lord Seliph, I’m going to Agustria with my brother.

speaker: Seliph
text: I admit this is a surprise, Nanna. I assumed you would go to Leonster…

speaker: Nanna
text: I know… But my work in Leonster’s done. I’ve got no regrets…

speaker: Seliph
text: I see… Take care, Nanna. You deserve nothing but happiness.

speaker: Nanna
text: And you too, Lord Seliph...

speaker: Seliph
text: My apologies, Tristan, but I’d like for you to go to Agustria. Agustria is still in the midst of an agonizing war, and Prince Ares will need your help to save it.

speaker: Tristan
text: No, sir, I’m glad you asked. Agustria’s my home, and it’s an honor to be allowed to return there by my king!

speaker: Seliph
text: And of course, Lover, you may go with Tristan. I’d hate to part the two of you even briefly.

speaker: Lover
text: Huh? You know about us, sir?! Kyaaaah! How embarrassing!

speaker: Seliph
text: Heh… It isn’t exactly hard to see, Lover. I wish you two naught but happiness.

speaker: Lover
text: Thanks so much, Lord Seliph!

speaker: Seliph
text: And of course, Lover, you may go with Tristan. I’d hate to part the two of you even briefly.

speaker: Lover
text: Hm? You already know about us, Lord Seliph?

speaker: Seliph
text: It isn’t exactly hard to see, Lover. I wish you two naught but happiness.

speaker: Lover
text: Thank you so much, Lord Seliph!

speaker: Jeanne
text: Lord Seliph, I’m going to Agustria with my brother.

speaker: Seliph
text: I admit this is a surprise, Jeanne. I assumed you would go to Leonster…

speaker: Jeanne
text: I know… But my work in Leonster’s done. I’ve got no regrets…

speaker: Seliph
text: I see… Take care, Jeanne. You deserve nothing but happiness.

speaker: Jeanne
text: And you too, Lord Seliph...

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: I’ll be leaving for Verdane, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Verdane, you say? Ah, of course. Your father was Prince Jamke. I understand. From what I’ve heard, Verdane has been naught but ruins dominated by brigand clans, ever since the royal family collapsed.

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: So I’ve heard, sir. I don’t know how much good I can do by myself, but I have to try. Those bandits have run rampant long enough.

speaker: Seliph
text: Indeed! Verdane was my mother’s home, and my parents first met there as well. Jamke’s son, I entrust this task to you. Do all you can to save Verdane’s people.

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: Yes, Lord Seliph!

speaker: Lover
text: I’m ready to go when you are, Jamke’s son!

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: I don’t think so, Lover. It’ll be far too dangerous to take you along. Don’t worry. I’ll be back for you, no matter what, once it’s all over.

speaker: Lover
text: Oh, no, I don’t think so! I’m going with you, and just try and stop me!

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: I’m sorry, Lover… You’re right. We’ll both save Verdane, together.

speaker: Larcei
text: Wait up, Jamke’s son! I’m coming, too!

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: I don’t think so, Larcei. It’ll be far too dangerous to take you along. Don’t worry. I’ll be back for you, no matter what, once it’s all over.

speaker: Larcei
text: You’re joking, right? I’m Larcei of Isaach, and I’m just as much of a warrior as you are! I don’t care how much you want to. I’m not gonna let you go alone!

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: Hahaha… Yeah, you’re right. You’ll never have anything to fear from simple bandits, will you? Sorry about that. We’ll go together! Having you by my side’s all the courage I need!

speaker: Lover
text: And I’ll be right by your side, Jamke’s son.

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: I don’t think so, Lover. It’ll be far too dangerous to take you along. Don’t worry. I’ll be back for you, no matter what, once it’s all over.

speaker: Lover
text: But I can’t stand to sit back and wait for a return which may never come… What happens if you leave me behind and I never get to see you again…? I don’t want our love to end the same way Lord Sigurd’s and Lady Deirdre’s did!

speaker: Jamke’S Son
text: I’m sorry, Lover… You’re right. We’ll both save Verdane, together.

speaker: Jamke’S Daughter
text: I’ll be going to Verdane with Jamke’s son as well, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: You will, Jamke’s daughter?

speaker: Jamke’S Daughter
text: Yes. I want to help him restore our father’s beloved kingdom. There won’t be a single bandit left in Verdane once we’re through!

speaker: Faval
text: Well, Lord Seliph, I’m off to Jungby.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. Knowing Jungby is in your most capable hands will put my mind at ease.

speaker: Faval
text: ...I admit, sir, I couldn’t have seen all this coming in a thousand years. But finding out that my mom was Jungby’s Lady Bridget helped me find myself a purpose in life, and I know now what needs to be done. On this blessed bow of mine, Lord Seliph, I swear I’ll be with you every step of the way!

speaker: Lover
text: Don’t forget what you swore to me!

speaker: Faval
text: Huh? What did I promise you again?

speaker: Lover
text: Oh, come on… You ALREADY forgot?!

speaker: Faval
text: Kidding, kidding! It was a joke! Sorry… Wow, that’s a terrifying look you’re giving me.

speaker: Lover
text: How was I supposed to know you’re joking?!

speaker: Larcei
text: So what about what you swore to me?

speaker: Faval
text: Huh? What did I promise you again?

speaker: Larcei
text: You’re kidding… You forgot ALREADY?

speaker: Faval
text: Kidding, kidding! It was a joke! Sorry… Wow, that’s a terrifying look you’re giving me.

speaker: Larcei
text: Can you blame me for not being sure?

speaker: Lover
text: And what about what you swore to me?

speaker: Faval
text: Huh? What did I promise you again?

speaker: Lover
text: You can’t be serious… You’ve already forgotten?

speaker: Faval
text: Kidding, kidding! It was a joke! Sorry… Wow, that’s a terrifying look you’re giving me.

speaker: Lover
text: I didn’t think you were joking. What else was I supposed to do?

speaker: Lover
text: And what about what you swore to me?

speaker: Faval
text: Huh? What did I promise you again?

speaker: Lover
text: You can’t be serious… You’ve already forgotten?

speaker: Faval
text: Kidding, kidding! It was a joke! Sorry… Wow, that’s a terrifying look you’re giving me.

speaker: Lover
text: There’s a good reason I wasn’t sure!

speaker: Seliph
text: And you as well, Patty?

speaker: Patty
text: Yep. No offense, but I can’t say I want to sit around her twiddling my thumbs. Besides, my brother’ll need my help!

speaker: Seliph
text: Once you’ve settled in, there’ll surely be no shortage of tasks to keep you busy. But I assure you, none of it will involve theft. A noble has no place robbing others.

speaker: Patty
text: Oh! How could you SAY that, sir?! I gave the thief thing up ages ago!

speaker: Seliph
text: Heh, my apologies. Well, Patty, take care.

speaker: Patty
text: You too, sir…

speaker: Patty
text: I’m off to Jungby now, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, of course. You’re the heir to Jungby. ...Will you be okay?

speaker: Patty
text: Huh? Why, Lord Seliph, you’re not saying you think I’m nervous about this, are you?

speaker: Seliph
text: Er, no. That isn’t what I meant! I just-

speaker: Patty
text: I’ll be just fine, sir. I’m the daughter of the great Lady Bridget, after all! Sure, I don’t look the part, but when the going needs doing, I’ll go and do it! Just watch me go, sir!

speaker: Lester
text: Well, Lord Seliph, I’m off to Jungby.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. Knowing Jungby is in your most capable hands will put my mind at ease.

speaker: Lester
text: Jungby should’ve gone to Lady Bridget’s kids, but there’s not much choice now. I’ll do everything to restore Jungby where my mother, Aideen, couldn’t. And of course, Lord Seliph, I’ll promise that you, Grannvale’s new king, will always have my loyalty.

speaker: Lover
text: Don’t forget your promise to me!

speaker: Faval
text: I haven’t, of course!

speaker: Lover
text: Just checking!

speaker: Faval
text: Lover, you’re kinda scaring me here.

speaker: Lover
text: Oh, that’s just mean! And if you say much more of it, I don’t know WHAT I’ll do! Heh heh heh…

speaker: Lover
text: And what of your promise to me?

speaker: Lester
text: I haven’t forgotten, of course!

speaker: Lover
text: Good. I thought you wouldn’t, Lester.

speaker: Lester
text: Lover, you’re kinda scaring me here.

speaker: Lover
text: Heh heh… Am I now?

speaker: Lester
text: I’m going back to Jungby as well, sir.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. I know Jungby will need your might in the years to come, as will I.

speaker: Lester
text: Yes, sir. I want to help my cousin, just as my mother once helped my aunt, and I hope I can for the rest of my life.

speaker: Seliph
text: And you as well, Lover. You’re as close as him as they come, aren’t you?

speaker: Lover
text: Yep! I guess this means we’ll be around to visit you quite a bit, sir!

speaker: Seliph
text: And you as well, Lover. You’re as close as him as they come, aren’t you?

speaker: Lover
text: So I am, Lord Seliph. I’m glad we get the chance to keep working with you.

speaker: Seliph
text: Lana… My apologies…

speaker: Seliph
text: I know you’re mad at me, Lana. Lester’s told me as much.

speaker: Lana
text: That’s because you’ve… No, it’s fine. I’ll be fine. I’m going home to Jungby now. Farewell, Lord Seliph…

speaker: Seliph
text: Lana….

speaker: Seliph
text: Lana… You’ll be inheriting the Jungby throne, will you not?

speaker: Lana
text: I will… I’ll admit I never even thought Jungby’s rule would be left to me. But… I’ll get to stay by your side and help you… And I’m so glad I can.

speaker: Seliph
text: We’ve always been together, haven’t we, Lana? ...Fate is an odd thing, I suppose.

speaker: Lana
text: It truly is…

speaker: Seliph
text: Headed for Freege, are you, Arthur?

speaker: Arthur
text: Yes, sir. Reptor and Blume’s crimes are beyond forgiveness, but Freege’s citizens can’t be blamed for their liege’s actions. I’ve got a duty to fill my mother’s shoes and guide the people where she no longer can.

speaker: Seliph
text: If anyone can do it, Arthur, it’ll be you. I’m glad you see peace is never born of hatred. I pray we’ll always be friends.

speaker: Arthur
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Lover
text: C’mon, Arthur, let’s go already! I’ve never been this bored in my life.

speaker: Arthur
text: Heh. Thought you’d say that, Lover. Okay, let’s get going.

speaker: Lover
text: Bye-bye, Lord Seliph! We’ll see you later…

speaker: Lover

speaker: Seliph
text: You two are awfully close, aren’t you?

speaker: Tine
text: Mm, we are. I couldn’t possibly ask for a better brother…

speaker: Seliph
text: You’re Freege’s heir, are you not, Tine? I’m sorry. I know returning to Freege couldn’t possibly be easy for you…

speaker: Tine
text: No, it won’t… But for Mother’s sake, I mustn’t run away. I hope I’ll have your help in this as well, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: But of course. We’ll be with you every step of the way.

speaker: Seliph
text: Headed for Freege, are you, Amid?

speaker: Amid
text: Yes, sir. Reptor and Blume’s crimes are beyond forgiveness, but Freege’s citizens can’t be blamed for their liege’s actions. I’ve got a duty to fill my mother’s shoes and guide the people where she no longer can.

speaker: Seliph
text: If anyone can do it, Amid, it’ll be you. I’m glad you see peace is never born of hatred. I pray we’ll always be friends.

speaker: Amid
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Lover
text: C’mon, Amid, let’s go already! I’ve never been this bored in my life.

speaker: Amid
text: Heh. Thought you’d say that, Lover. Okay, let’s get going.

speaker: Lover
text: Bye-bye, Lord Seliph! We’ll see you later…

speaker: Lover
text: I think you’ve chatted long enough, Amid. Lord Seliph has work to do as well, you know!

speaker: Amid
text: Yeah, you’re right, Lover. Shall we head off, then?
