text: Lene! Where are you? Answer me!

speaker: Lene
text: Ares...

speaker: Ares
text: Oh! Is everything okay, Lene?

speaker: Lene
text: N-no... It's not... But someone from the liberation army rescued me... And I... I knew you'd come, Ares...

speaker: Ares
text: Lene, I... I beg your forgiveness... I was a fool! So very, very foolish... I should have heeded your word...

speaker: Lene
text: It's okay... After all, you're here now...

speaker: Ares
text: I swear to you, I'll never let this happen again...

speaker: Lene
text: And I swear I'll try to keep my big mouth to myself from now on! Don't ever leave me again, Ares…

speaker: Lene
text: Mister Seliph, right? Nice to meet ya!

speaker: Seliph
text: Er… Hello. And who are you?

speaker: Lene
text: I’m Lene, the dancer!

speaker: Seliph
text: You… You’re Lene?

speaker: Lene
text: Ohh… Mister Seliph, is this the first time you’ve ever seen a dancer?

speaker: Seliph
text: Y-yes, miss…

speaker: Lene
text: Hee hee… That’s adorable!
Hey, Shannan! Guess whoooo!

speaker: Shannan
text: GAH!

speaker: Daisy
text: Ha-haaa! Bet I scared you real good!

speaker: Shannan
text: Argh, Daisy! For heaven's sake, I nearly took your head clean off! Would you mind cutting it out?

speaker: Daisy
text: But I'm sooooo booooored! And I'm not strong enough to fight, either!

speaker: Shannan
text: Then I suppose I'll help you patch that up, then. I don't have enough time to give you a proper lesson, but it'll be better than nothing.

speaker: Daisy
text: Eeeeeeee! I'm getting my very own private lesson with Prince Shannan himself!

speaker: Shannan
text: If you don't take this seriously, there won't be a lesson. Are we clear?

speaker: Daisy
text: Yep! I'm being completely serious!

speaker: Shannan
text: ...Very well. The first and most important step is posture... Hold on, are you even listening?

speaker: Daisy
text: Siiiiiiiigh...!

speaker: Ctuzof
text: You rebel worms... How dare you defile the sanctity of the Yied Shrine! Come! Embrace the darkness, as it entombs you forevermore!

speaker: Ctuzof
text: G-glory to... The Lopt... Empire

speaker: Liza
text: So you're the rebel army... This is where your insurrection ends! So long as I, General Liza, draw breath, you shall never reach Fort Melgen!

speaker: Liza
text: Ahh... Ish... tore…

speaker: Ishtore
text: So you've come this far? Heh... You're made of sterner stuff than I thought.

speaker: Ishtore
text: You... You vermin! How dare you slaughter Liza like that! You'll have no mercy!

speaker: Ishtore
text: Liza, I... I must leave the rest... in your hands…

speaker: Ishtore
text: Liza... I…

speaker: Jabarro
text: Heh... Welcome to your deaths!

speaker: Jabarro
text: Ares! I've found you, you ungrateful sod! You're not gonna get away with this!

speaker: Ares
text: I regret it's come to this, but so be it. Farewell, Jabarro.

speaker: Jabarro
text: Ugh... Ares, you dastard…

speaker: Bramsel
text: What?! Jabarro bungled it, did he? Darna is my city! Mine! Nobody will ever take it from me!

speaker: Bramsel
text: ...Ares?! What are you... I should've known you were a filthy traitor!

speaker: Ares
text: Enough, Bramsel! Return Lene to me! NOW!

speaker: Bramsel
text: Oh, you're far too late! By now, that stubborn strumpet is... Heh heh heh...

speaker: Ares
text: D-damn you! You'll regret your words!

speaker: Bramsel
text: Nngh... No... Darna is mine... All... mine…

speaker: Eliu
text: Taste the wrath of thunder, rebel!

speaker: Fetra
text: Taste the howling gale, traitor!

speaker: Banba
text: Taste ragin flames, brigand!

speaker: Tine
text: I... I'm sorry…

speaker: Tine
text: I... I'm sorry... I wish we didn't need to fight...

speaker: Arthur
text: H-hold on a moment! Are you... could it be...?

speaker: Tine
text: Aah…

speaker: Blume
text: Ha! So long as I wield the Book of Mjölnir, what reason would I ever have to fear the likes of you?

speaker: Blume
text: And what are you? Wait... could it be...?

speaker: Arthur
text: Blume! I've waited years for this moment! You took my mother and sister from me, and today you'll finally pay!

speaker: Blume
text: Gah... Impudent whelp! Just try me!

speaker: Blume
text: Oho! Quan's son, I presume? You somehow still live on... I'm almost impressed.

speaker: Leif
text: King Blume! You've tortured my people for long enough! Prepare to die at last!

speaker: Blume
text: Hmph! A likely retort, but only one of us will die this day, and it will never be me!

speaker: Blume
text: W-wait... Tine?! How dare you betray my many kindnesses...

speaker: Tine
text: I-I'm sorry, Uncle…

speaker: Blume
text: Nngh... How? How could I lose... I've no choice... For now, I must retreat to Connaught…

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, Queen Rahna is here to see you.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Queen Rahna?

speaker: Rahna
text: Good evening, Lord Sigurd. Are you comfortable settling into Sailane yet? Is there anything at all that you need?

speaker: Sigurd
text: As much as I appreciate the offer, we're fine. I can't thank you enough for your hospitality, Your Highness.

speaker: Rahna
text: I know Sailane is perhaps too small to house all of you adequately, and I'm sorry, but please, bear with me for a while longer... I'm doing all I can to hasten your liberty. I've sent letter after letter to Belhalla to advocate for your innocence. As of yet, however, I've still heard nothing at all from King Azmur.

speaker: Sigurd
text: This... This has to be Reptor's doing! First he betrays my father, and now he's stopping all of your letters! He must be!

speaker: Rahna
text: Calm yourself, Lord Sigurd! I know well the pain you're feeling, but you cannot let your grudges rule you. Your anger will not save your father. Hatred will only destroy you from within. I swear to you, I can and I will find a way to set this to rights, but you must be patient.

speaker: Sigurd
text: You're right... I'm sorry, Your Highness. I really appreciate all you've done for me.

speaker: Rahna
text: It's alright, Lord Sigurd. Oh, before I forget... There actually has been some good news from Grannvale of late.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Good news, you say?

speaker: Rahna
text: Mm. A previously unknown daughter of Prince Kurth has been discovered. All of Grannvale is rejoicing at the news.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Huh?! Is that even possible?

speaker: Rahna
text: It took King Azmur only a glance to recognize her true heritage. She bears the brand of Naga, the proof of a true heir to House Belhalla. There is no doubt. She is Kurth's child.

speaker: Sigurd
text: I see... Thank goodness. At the very least, this means the royal lineage won't go extinct.

speaker: Rahna
text: That's not all. The princess and Duke Arvis are in a relationship. King Azmur has given his blessing, and a magnificent wedding will soon be held.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Arvis? Really?

speaker: Rahna
text: All who've seen the happy couple eagerly attest that this beautiful princess and Duke Arvis are perfectly matched together. To say nothing of how happy the couple is said to be! Young love is wonderful, isn't it? ...Oh. Lord Sigurd, I'm so sorry. I forgot. Your wife is still-

speaker: Sigurd
text: Deirdre... My wife's still gone, yes... It's been over a year since she vanished. She's missed an entire year of watching Seliph grow up.

speaker: Rahna
text: I'm so sorry, Lord Sigurd, but cheer up. I know you'll reunite someday.

speaker: Sigurd
text: You're right. I feel it, too. I can't give in to sorry just yet. I can't give up on finding her.

speaker: Annand
text: Pardon me, milady, but the hour is late. We should be on our way soon.

speaker: Rahna
text: Ah, of course. I'll be with you in a moment. Lord Sigurd, one last thing... Beware of Duke Maios of Thove. I regret to say that my brother-in-law has long hungered to claim Sailane for himself. It's only a matter of time till he goes so far as to attack you. I wish I could provide you with reinforcements, but...

speaker: Sigurd
text: ...I know. The capital is under the very same threat from Duke Daccar of Zaxon. You cannot afford to weaken your own guard. Daccar will pounce upon you given even a hint of weakness. Don't worry about it, Your Highness. There's nothing the Thove army can throw at us that we can't handle.

speaker: Rahna
text: Ah, of course. I should be more confident in such veteran heroes as yourselves. Oh! I've been talking for so long, I lost track of the time. Take care, Lord Sigurd.

speaker: Sigurd
text: You, too, Your Highness. Thank you.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Mother! Aren't you forgetting somebody? You've just chatted for hours and hours with Sigurd, yet you can't even acknowledge your own son?

speaker: Rahna
text: My son? The one who abandoned me two years ago, going gods know where? How do I talk to someone who's clearly not here?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Heh heh... So this is how it's going to be, is it? You're still mad at me, then?

speaker: Rahna
text: Of course I am! Do you have any idea how hard it was without you, and how worried I've been after you? That my own son could be so cold-hearted... I thought I knew you better than this.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Look, I know you're upset, but I had my reasons for all this. But come on, I'm home safely! Surely that counts for something and you can forgive me? I swear I'll make up for it and be the very picture of a good son. Hey, how about I give you a shoulder massage to start?

speaker: Rahna
text: Oh! What nerve! Treating me as if I'm an old crone... Look, Lewyn, there are more pressing matters which we need to talk about, and soon. Come to Silesse as soon as possible. Do not forget! Do I make myself clear?

speaker: Lewyn
text: ...Sigh. I thought she'd never stop.

speaker: Annand
text: Don't be fooled by your mother's outward behavior, milord. She's actually very happy, now you've returned. Indeed, she hasn't been anything as cheerful as this since before you left.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Thanks, Annand. Knowing you're at her side is a big relief. Look after her, okay?

speaker: Annand
text: Yes, sir! Rest assured, I will protect the queen with my life, on my honor as the captain of the Silessian pegasus knights.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Thanks. Oh, one more thing... Are you gonna leave Erinys here with Sigurd?

speaker: Annand
text: I am... Milord, I'd like you to keep my sister at your side. She-

speaker: Erinys
text: Annand!

speaker: Annand
text: Oh. Eavesdropping, were you, Erinys?

speaker: Erinys
text: You were about to tell him too much, so...

speaker: Annand
text: Ah. My apologies, Erinys. There are things he shouldn't know just yet, of course... Erinys, I'll be leaving with Queen Rahna and returning to Silesse Castle shortly. You'll stay here and keep and eye on Prince Lewyn. Best of luck.

speaker: Erinys
text: Thank you, Annand.

speaker: Quan
text: Sigurd, we'll now be taking our leave. It's high time we returned to Leonster. Rest assured, we'll be back, this time leading the full military might of Leonster to your aid. May that day come soon, my friend.

speaker: Ethlyn
text: I'm going with Quan, Sigurd. Don't worry, though. We'll be back before you know it! Take care of yourself.

speaker: Finn
text: By your leave, sir, I'll be departing with my lord. Thank you for all you've done for us. Don't give up, sir. One day, I know, the charges against you will be cleared and your good name restored. I know you can do this.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Thank you. You've got quite the journey back to Leonster ahead of you. I wish I could do more to help you on your way. May your journey be a safe one!

speaker: Maios
text: Díthorba! Is the army ready to deploy yet?

speaker: Díthorba
text: Yes, sir. Bishop Cuvuli's wind mage unit has infiltrated the forests near Sailane. They await your command, sir.

speaker: Maios
text: Very well. Relay my orders to Cuvuli: move in on Sailane! Díthorba, I trust your pegasus corps are already briefed on your mission?

speaker: Díthorba
text: Yes, sir. Our task is clear. My squadron is to raid the enemy from above, disrupting their tactics.

speaker: Maios
text: Good. Now get to work! Grannvale will owe us a handsome reward for bringing them the heads of their infamous traitors! Heh heh heh…

speaker: Cuvuli
text: There's the signal to assault Sailane, as planned. I trust you're all ready? Move in! Teach the traitorous scum the terror of a wind mage's wrath!

speaker: Daccar
text: The Thove army's attacking? Looks like Maios has finally made his move. Heh heh... Why, this little drama is finally getting interesting. Wouldn't you say, Pamela?

speaker: Pamela
text: Indeed, sir. However, as I recall we didn't account for Sigurd's fugitives being here. Their strength poses a real risk to the plan. If Maios at least succeeds in weakening them, perhaps Silesse's fall will still go smoothly?

speaker: Daccar
text: Even if he fails, I still have my private deal with Grannvale in my favor. Their Lord André should arrive shortly with a battalion of reinforcements. Heh heh... My victory is certain, Pamela! I'll be sitting on the Silessian throne by the end of the week!

speaker: Pamela
text: Without a doubt, sir.

speaker: Maios
text: Hm? I'd say those traitors are drawing perhaps a bit too close for comfort. You there! Raise the Thove River drawbridge! Without this key, there's no way they'll ever get over here. Heh heh... I almost wish I could see the looks on their faces!

speaker: Dew
text: What, just one of these locks? C'mon, at least gimme a challenge... Ta-da!

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, the Thove village elder would like a word with you.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Of course. Actually, I'd imagine we need to talk this situation over. Bring him in.

speaker: Old Man
text: Lord Sigurd, I presume? We can't thank you enough for getting rid of Lord Maios. The entire population of Thove is rejoicing at his downfall!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Hm? Are you sure? I mean, I just conquered you. Am I not the enemy here?

speaker: Old Man
text: Lord Maios was nothing but a tyrant. All he ever did was bleed us dry. You fight in the name of Queen Rahna, and there isn't a Silessian alive who doesn't bear the utmost adoration for our queen.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Is that so? Thank you. Anyway, in the interim I think I'll leave governing Thove to you, sir. Once the crisis has settled, the queen will be in touch to arrange a proper successor. Until then, I'm sure you'll be a just governor to help heal Thove's wounds.

speaker: Old Man
text: Very well. Please, Lord Sigurd, do all you can to protect the queen. She is a treasure to us, and a beacon of peace and kindness.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Rest assured, my good man. So long as I live, I swear that I'll let no harm come to Queen Rahna. You have my word.

speaker: Daccar
text: Thove has fallen, has it... I almost feel bad for my brother: little more than a pawn in my dreams who'd outlived his usefulness. Pamela, it's your turn. Lead your pegasus knights into battle at once! Sigurd is well clear of the capital. Seize it while he has no chance of aiding them!

speaker: Pamela
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Annand
text: Dire news, milady! Zaxon has deployed Pamela's pegasus unit and they're closing in on the capital.

speaker: Rahna
text: What?! This can't be happening! ...So, at long last, Daccar has put to rest his tired old façade of innocence.

speaker: Annand
text: Be at ease, milady. My squad will keep Pamela's at bay.

speaker: Rahna
text: Annand, are you sure you can do this? I've heard stories of the sheer terror of Pamela's might as a warrior.

speaker: Annand
text: Of course... I know better than to take lightly such a formidable foe. But remember, I am one of the Four Falcon Knights of Silesse. I never enter a battle ill prepared.

speaker: Rahna
text: Ah... I'm so sorry, Annand. I already know well how you feel about all this, but... I...

speaker: Annand
text: To fight in your name is the only life I know... Milady, please. Don't worry about me so much. If that's all, then, I'll be going. Knights, to me! Move out!

speaker: Daccar
text: Ah. Duke André, I presume? You certainly took your time getting here... And... Oh! How magnificent! So this is Jungby's renowned bow knight legion!

speaker: André
text: Hmhmhm... Alas, my father is dead, and my sister is a fugitive among the traitors. This leaves me, and me alone, as the Duke of Jungby and the leader of our legion! Against the might of the Beige Ritter, these winged ponies stand no chance at all! Now, sit back and watch them drop like flies!

speaker: Annand
text: It's been a while, Pamela... I've known you for years, ever since we trained side by side to become knights. But not once did I ever suspect we would someday find ourselves as enemies.

speaker: Pamela
text: Annand... Only you would be so foolish as to insist on following your queen to her inevitable grave! Why should I complain, though? After all, once you're out of the way, that leaves me as the greatest knight of Silesse!

speaker: Annand
text: The only fool here is you, Pamela! No... It's too late to change your mind. You're so set on your fate... Very well. All I can do for you now is give you a last honorable duel befitting a Silessian knight.

speaker: Pamela
text: Heh... Saccharine as ever, aren't you?

speaker: Rahna
text: Annand has been killed?! Ahh... How could this happen... I'm so sorry, Annand... Forgive me…

speaker: Lewyn
text: What? Annand's dead?! ...Y-you're joking!!

speaker: Erinys
text: Huh? Annand was... No! Th... this can't be happening! How... how could anyone have killed her? This can't be…

speaker: André
text: Heh... I expected so much more from Silesse's famous pegasus knights... No matter. I suppose we might as well bring down the capital while we're here. Pamela, your unit will cross the mountains. Besiege and capture Thove immediately.

speaker: Pamela
text: Very well.

speaker: André
text: The capital is under our control? Good. Mission accomplished. We ride for Grannvale at once!

speaker: Daccar
text: Heh... At long last. The capital is mine, and mine alone! Now, I want a wind mage unit deployed south of Silesse River. Fortify our defensive line there. Furthermore... Donovan! You and your axemen are to occupy the capital and maintain its defenses. But don't even think about killing the queen. We can't waste a hostage of such high value.

speaker: Donovan
text: Got it, sir!

speaker: Rahna
text: Hurry! You need to flee as fast as you can!

speaker: Young Woman
text: But, Your Highness...

speaker: Rahna
text: I'll be okay! Look after yourselves, please!

speaker: Young Man
text: People, please! The queen wants us to run, so come on! Run!

speaker: Donovan
text: Huh? Where the hell are all the townsfolk?! Ugh... they scarpered, didn't they? Damn it! They took all the fun outta this! Boys, it's up to you now! Get out there and butcher those little pigs! No survivors! Understand!

speaker: Rahna
text: No! Please, stop! My citizens are as innocent as they come! It matters not what happens to me, but please, don't harm my people!

speaker: Donovan
text: I don't think so. You've been screwin' up Lord Daccar's will long enough, missy. 'Bout time you learned your lesson!

speaker: Rahna
text: Ahh…

speaker: Daccar
text: Heh... It appears leaving this to Donovan was a good idea after all.

speaker: Lamia
text: Well, now! It's been a long time since I've seen such darling villainy anywhere! It's almost enough to turn a weaker stomach.

speaker: Daccar
text: Coming from someone like you, willing to kill anyone, anywhere, anytime so long as you're handsomely paid, that's quite a claim. High praise indeed, if it's from the infamous "Lamia the Infernal".

speaker: Lamia
text: Ohoho! Quite the flatterer, aren't you? Now, where do we begin with our mayhem?

speaker: Daccar
text: For now, your group will guard the castle. Be ready to roll out your traditional welcome in case Sigurd's thugs try causing us grief.

speaker: Lamia
text: Guard duty? Really? Where's the fun in that? Eh, no matter. It's your money. Oi, ladies! Listen up! We're on guard duty. Stick to the castle, and pick off the enemy's leftovers if they come!

speaker: Donovan
text: Huh? So the Sailane army's finally comin'? Good! It's 'bout time I gave those damned rebels the axe! Boys, get off yer sorry hinds! Guard the castle no matter what. Don't let 'em get anywhere near it!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Your Highness! I'm so glad you're unharmed. My sincerest apologies for not coming to your aid sooner.

speaker: Rahna
text: It's fine, Lord Sigurd. That you've made it here is more than enough. I... I'm sorry I couldn't do more. Too many people have died, and I could only stand by and watch... I can't bear it. And... and Annand…

speaker: Sigurd
text: Don't worry, Your Highness. Annand's killers will die this day by my hand. Daccar's crimes are beyond forgiveness. I promise you: he will not escape me. With this in mind, I humbly request your authorization to assault Zaxon Castle.

speaker: Rahna
text: Lord Daccar's petty greed has condemned my people to utter agony long enough. He is a murderer. Nothing more, nothing less. You may visit justice upon him, Lord Sigurd.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Understood. I'll mobilize my army to capture Zaxon immediately. For now, Your Highness, please get some rest.

speaker: Rahna
text: Do take care of yourself, Lord Sigurd. As soon as Zaxon is under your control, I'll be coming by for a word with you.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Don't worry, Your Highness. We've already put an end to Annand's killers. That said, in our haste we neglected to get your consent to do so. My apologies.

speaker: Rahna
text: It's alright, Lord Sigurd. I couldn't possibly thank you enough for all of your help today. I'll come by Zaxon Castle later, once everything has settled here. May we meet again then, Lord Sigurd.

speaker: Daccar
text: Oh, you must be joking! Those accursed rebels have already re-captured Silesse?! What in the blazes is Donovan even doing out there?

speaker: Daccar
text: Instruct Pamela to lead her squad in pursuit of Sigurd’s army! Throw everything we have at him!

speaker: Daccar
text: Blast... We've no choice. Instruct Lamia to move out and attack at once! They mustn't be allowed near my castle!

speaker: Lamia
text: Wow, even something so tiny gets Daccar panicking... No matter. Let's go, ladies! We've got quite the feast ahead of us!

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, Queen Rahna has arrived.

speaker: Rahna
text: Lord Sigurd, that was quite the fierce battle, wasn't it? Are you unharmed?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Yeah. Somehow, I'm okay.

speaker: Rahna
text: I know I've asked so much of you already, Lord Sigurd, but would you and your army please station yourselves here at Zaxon? Grannvale's Lord Langbalt has already swept in with an immense army and conquered Lubeck Castle, to our east. The people of Silesse are terrified that this will prove to be but a prelude to a full-scale war with Grannvale.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Your Highness, I believe Langbalt's army is here only for me. I've no desire to needlessly endanger you or your citizens, after all you've done for us. My men and I are leaving. Now. I have a score to settle with Langbalt.

speaker: Rahna
text: What recklessness! How could you possibly prevail like this?

speaker: Sigurd
text: They're coming for me no matter what. If we remain here, then they'll just invade. We can't afford to waste time debating this.

speaker: Rahna
text: Is that so... How sad...

speaker: Sigurd
text: Your Highness... Thank you so much. You've given me the most wonderful year here, and you've done so much to put my mind at ease. My mother died when I was still very young, so as I grew up, I never knew the unconditional love of a mother.. But thanks to you, here in Silesse, I've come to know that very same warmth. You're like a second mother to me now... Take care of yourself, Your Highness. I hope that someday, once this is all over, we'll have a chance to meet again.

speaker: Rahna
text: As do I, Lord Sigurd. Please, stay vigilant out there, and keep yourself safe. From the bottom of my heart, I pray that you and Deirdre will soon be reunited.

speaker: Old Man
text: Magic is governed by a hierarchy of power, just like weapons. Fire magic bests wind, wind bests thunder, and thunder bests fire. However, dark and light magic have an advantage over all of the others. Think your strategies through with care.

speaker: Old Man
text: Bein' of holy ancestry can bestow a number of powers onto ya. Divine heirs can wield even the most advanced weapons with ease, and'll have an easier time growin' stronger. 'Course, it's not every day you meet someone blessed with that sorta blood.

speaker: Old Man
text: The Silesse royal family wields the power of wind, as bestowed by the wind god, Forseti. House Velthomer wields the power of fire, as bestowed by the fire goddess, Vala. And House Friege wields thunder powers, as bestowed by the thunder god, Tordo.

speaker: Old Man
text: The sinister powers of the dark god Loptyr can be fought only with the glorious powers of Naga, our great god. Only Grannvale's House Belhalla, the heirs to Saint Heim, inherit Naga's power.

speaker: Old Man
text: Only a direct holy descendant can inherit the full breadth of the power of the gods. And only they'll be able to wield their family's divine heirlooms. However, if kin intersect, their offspring'll have their exalted blood enriched and'll reap almighty powers. Needless to say, mind, doin' that is condemned and forbidden…

speaker: Old Man
text: Should Prince Kurth's daughter bear a son, that son would be heir to Grannvale's throne. I daresay this makes Lord Arvis, husband to the princess, quite the influential figure.

speaker: Old Man
text: Legend has it that all direct heirs to the Crusaders bear exalted brands on their bodies, which appear on them in their infancy. Prince Kurth's daughter has her Naga brand on her forehead. Actually, that was how they recognized her as a direct heiress to Saint Heim.

speaker: Man
text: Oh! Lord Sigurd's army is here to save us all! Hang on... Aren't you a dancer, miss? If you don't mind, perhaps you could do a little dance for us? It's been so long since we've had time for respite or fun...

speaker: Silvia
text: Yep not a problem! If you think it'll help everyone cheer up a bit, then I'm gonna dance my feet off! ...Okay! Heeeere we go!

speaker: Silvia
text: Hah!

speaker: Silvia
text: Yeah!

speaker: Silvia
text: Hyaaah!

speaker: Silvia
text: Whew... Well, how 'bout that? Everyone feelin' a little better?

speaker: Man
text: Oh! What fantastic dancin'! I dunno how, but now I feel like I'm ready to give life my all! I can't thank you enough, miss. Here, perhaps this magic sword'll help ya out. It oughta do a fine job of keeping ya safe.

speaker: Man
text: Y'know how there's a drawbridge over the Thove River? Yeah, that's under the control of Duke Maios, too. If it's still drawn and you don't have the key, you're not getting across. Mind you, if you have a thief's sticky fingers at your service, that might not be a problem…

speaker: Man
text: What's that? You got the drawbridge lowered? How'd ya know to do that?

speaker: Sigurd
text: I'm so sorry I dragged you into this mess as well, Father Claude.

speaker: Claude
text: It's fine. If anything, I'm sorry that my efforts to aid you simply weren't enough. I did return to Grannvale, and I was about to relate the truth to His Majesty. But Reptor interfered before I could do anything, and now I, too, am branded a traitor to the motherland.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Ugh. I've had enough of just sitting here and letting Reptor have his sorry way! I swear, I've half a mind to storm straight into Grannvale and end this once and for all!

speaker: Claude
text: No. You know better than to rely on brute force or risk the common folk's safety. For now, Lord Sigurd, we must endure.

speaker: Sigurd
text: But, Father Claude-

speaker: Claude
text: Make no mistake. I feel your pain, too, but this crisis's end now lies in fate's hands. There is nothing any of us can do to save ourselves anymore.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Hey, Azelle? Wait up a sec.

speaker: Azelle
text: Tailtiu? Is something wrong?

speaker: Tailtiu
text: I need to ask you something quick.

speaker: Azelle
text: Hm? Me?

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Yeah. That okay? I mean, we've been friends for years. And I don't think there's anyone else who I can ask about this.

speaker: Azelle
text: Huh. You look downright grim and serious... If you really think I can help, then sure. What seems to be the problem?

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Well... I, er... I'm only with you lot because I was just following Claud around, but I'm starting to think I shouldn't have done that...

speaker: Azelle
text: What makes you think so?

speaker: Tailtiu
text: It's because people are acting kinda like they're treading carefully 'round me. And when I'm around, people stop talking about my father...

speaker: Azelle
text: Ah... That certainly doesn't sound fun. But I'd say people really do like you. It's more that they honestly aren't sure how they should treat you, and that they're worried they'll cause you grief. Don't worry too much. It'll all be fine once they get to know you better.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Yeah... Guess you're right. Thanks, Azelle. Think I might be feeling a bit better 'bout this now.

speaker: Azelle
text: Hah! Glad you're back to normal, Tailtiu. If you're ever feeling like this again, I'll always be here to help you through it, no matter what happens.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Okay. Thanks!

speaker: Aideen
text: Take care of yourself out here, Azelle.

speaker: Azelle
text: Right. And you as well, Aideen.

speaker: Aideen
text: This still feels so odd... Not once did I ever think that one day we would be together like this.

speaker: Azelle
text: It's because I'm younger than you, right?

speaker: Aideen
text: Oh, no. I'm still not sure why...

speaker: Azelle
text: I still can't quite believe it, either! That you're now my wife... It all still feels like I'm living in some kind of dream!

speaker: Aideen
text: Hm? How so? Don't you believe our marriage feels right?

speaker: Azelle
text: It's not that. It's because, er... Well, you're so beautiful... Even though I was still very young, when I saw you for the first time years ago, my heart just wouldn't stop pounding! Ever since that day, you were the only one for whom I've ever felt this way.

speaker: Aideen
text: Oh, Azelle...

speaker: Azelle
text: It's still pretty embarrassing to admit... Oh, I almost forgot! This is for you. This is a Rescue staff. You can use it to bring people far away back to your side instantly. I know you'll put it to good use.

speaker: Aideen
text: I'm so happy to be with you, Azelle. I'll always treasure having such a kind and gentle soul as you by my side…

speaker: Aideen
text: Midir, please accept this bow.

speaker: Midir
text: Isn’t this a brave bow? Are you sure you want to give away something so rare?

speaker: Aideen
text: I am. I bought it for you, after all. Silesse’s pegasus knights are a formidable foe to face. With a bow of this caliber in hand, I know you’ll be better prepared to fight them.

speaker: Midir
text: Milady… I still can’t believe this isn’t a dream! I can’t believe we’re actually married... I’ve dreamed of this for so long.

speaker: Aideen
text: I’ve long dreamt of the same myself. I wanted to act upon it for many years, but I couldn’t, even at my loneliest… But.. I think by now you can just call me Aideen. I’ll always look out for you, Midir. I’ll always pray for your safety.

speaker: Aideen
text: Jamke, I’d like for you to have this bow.

speaker: Jamke
text: This is a brave bow, isn’t it… You sure it’s okay for me to take it?

speaker: Aideen
text: Yes. Please, accept it. As formidable as the Silessian pegasus knights are, so long as you have this bow, I know you’ll have the upper hand.

speaker: Jamke
text: Thanks, Aideen. I know I’ll be able to keep you safe with a bow like this. I guess I’ll see you later, once this is all over.

speaker: Aideen
text: Jamke… I’ll be praying for your safety.

speaker: Sylvia
text: Hey! Hey, Erinys! You totally like Lewyn, don't ya? Like, do ya really like him?

speaker: Erinys
text: Huh? I... that's... Er, no. Prince Lewyn is beloved and respected by all the people of Silesse, myself included.

speaker: Sylvia
text: Oh? Okay, then. Then I guess you'd be okay with me and Lewyn getting together, right?

speaker: Erinys
text: Er... Yes. I wouldn't really mind...

speaker: Sylvia
text: Reeeeally? That wouldn't but ya at all?

speaker: Erinys
text: No, I'm sure I'd have no issue. Why do you ask? Am I supposed to object?

speaker: Sylvia
text: I dunno! But if it's all fine by ya, then I guess it's time for me to go work my magic on Lewyn...

speaker: Erinys
text: Er... The thing is, a prospective queen of Silesse ought to possess the same grace and dignity as our Queen Rahna.

speaker: Sylvia
text: Oh, so you're sayin' I'm not cut out for it? How rude!

speaker: Erinys
text: Er, no... That isn't-

speaker: Sylvia
text: Hrmph! Fine then! I'll show you!

speaker: Silvia
text: Hello there, mister Father!

speaker: Claud
text: Hm? And who are you?

speaker: Silvia
text: I'm Silviiiiiiiia!

speaker: Claud
text: Well then, Miss Silvia, how can I help? Have you, perchance, recently run afoul of bandits?

speaker: Silvia
text: What's that?

speaker: Claud
text: Well, er... I'm not sure how to put this... You're wearing nothing but smallclothes.

speaker: Silvia
text: Eh?! Watch your mouth, mister Father! Haven't you seen dancers like me before? This is just a dancer's clothes. It's just like you wearin' your churchy cloak!

speaker: Claud
text: Is that so... Hm. Surely you're chilled to the bone, wearing as little as you are, though?

speaker: Silvia
text: Oh, no! Even 'round here I'm never cold, 'cause my heart's ablaze!

speaker: Claud
text: Is dancing truly so fun for you?

speaker: Silvia
text: Yeah! I just love it!

speaker: Claud
text: Is that so... What of your parents? Do they agree with this career of yours?

speaker: Silvia
text: Actually, I'm an orphan. When I was really little, my master took me in and helped me become a dancer. But he... he was an awful, awful man. He'd always beat me outta nowhere. 'Bout a year ago I couldn't stand any more of it all, so I ran away.

speaker: Claud
text: I see... What a horrible tale. I believe I know your pain. I once had a sister, who would likely be around your age if she's still alive.

speaker: Silvia
text: A sister?

speaker: Claud
text: Yes. Alas, she was abducted while she was still an infant. I've searched for her ever since, but to this day I've yet to find any sign of her.

speaker: Silvia
text: Ohh... I bet she's just like a princess! She's gotta be all pretty and classy... And nothin' like me...

speaker: Claud
text: I disagree. I assure you, I do find you to be utterly charming. In your own way, you possess a unique grace and beauty.

speaker: Silvia
text: Oh... mister Father... really?

speaker: Claud
text: Of course. I could never lie.

speaker: Silvia
text: Th-thank you... Nobody's ever told me somethin' like that... This feels kinda funny somehow... Oh... Oh, great, now I'm cryin'... What is this...?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Hey, Sigurd? Could I have a word?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Ah, Lewyn. I'm so sorry about what happened to Annand. I had no idea Jungby's bow knights would get involved in this mess.

speaker: Lewyn
text: No, it's not your fault. Just mine... I just haven't been thinking right lately. I should've been here all along, looking after Mother and the country. But nope, I just ran away! That's why Annand died... She just took my place in all this.

speaker: Sigurd
text: There's no need to blame yourself. The best you can do now is care for the queen, and ensure that Annand didn't die in vain.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah, I know. No use pointing out the obvious, huh?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Very well. Oh, Lewyn, before I forget... Don't forget to go see your mother at the capital as soon as possible. She said it's of the utmost importance!

speaker: Erinys
text: Lord Lewyn...

speaker: Lewyn
text: ...Oh, Erinys. I'm so sorry. Forgive me. Please...

speaker: Erinys
text: Oh, you mean about Annand...

speaker: Lewyn
text: ...Yeah.

speaker: Erinys
text: Oh, so she... you really did... I'm so sorry. I had no idea.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Whoa, Erinys! You've got it all wrong. I guess when I was younger, I did sorta have a thing for Annand... But that was then. This is now, and the now is you.

speaker: Erinys
text: C-come again?!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Erinys, I... I love you…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Mother! You're not hurt, are you? When I heard that Silesse had fallen, I... I was pretty worried there.

speaker: Rahna
text: Thank you so much for coming, Lewyn. Perhaps at last, you've matured into a young man who honors his promises. Perhaps Lord Sigurd has had quite the positive influence on you after all.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Oh, come on, Mother! You don't need to act like I'm still a child. Besides, Sigurd is hardly all that much older than I am.

speaker: Rahna
text: Dear, compared to the likes of Lord Sigurd, you may as well still be a screaming infant. You've still much to learn from him, and quickly. Nothing would be more reassuring than having a son as fine as he by my side. Especially now that Annand is... Oh...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Annand... I should've been the one to die out there. Not her. If only I'd gotten here sooner! Mother, I'll be here to protect you from now on. I won't let Annand's death go to waste. I swear, I will never, ever leave you again.

speaker: Rahna
text: Oh, Lewyn... I never thought you were capable of saying anything so kind. But your word is more than enough. For now, at least, I believe you should remain at Lord Sigurd's side. He has a greater need of your strength.

speaker: Lewyn
text: But if I do that, what about you...?

speaker: Rahna
text: There's nothing to worry about, Lewyn. You are the heir of the wind crusader. Your place is with the rest of the world, to lead and guide it on its true path. The time has come for me to confer upon you your true birthright... The exalted wind tome, Forseti. Here, Lewyn. It's yours.

speaker: Lewyn
text: This... So this is the royal family's ancestral tome... The Book of Forseti... Oh! This power... What's this... warmth?

speaker: Rahna
text: Lewyn, never forget: the Wind Crusader flows as the gentlest breeze. His way is to guide all the peoples of the world on the path of peace. Hate and violence is never his answer.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yes, of course. I don't think I could live my life any other way.

speaker: Rahna
text: Indeed. Perhaps you truly are a child of the wind... Lewyn... It's time for you to go. Take care out there, and... And don't do anything too rash.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Mother...

speaker: Rahna
text: Go on! ...For heaven's sake, go...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Okay, mother please take care of yourself.

speaker: Rahna
text: Oh... Lewyn…

speaker: Young Woman
text: Ah! Are you here to help me? I couldn't possibly thank you enough!

speaker: Young Man
text: Oh! You're here to save me? Thank you so, so much!

speaker: Cuvuli
text: Hmhmhm... I'm surprised you've made it this far.

speaker: Cuvuli
text: Díthorba... The rest... is up to you…

speaker: Díthorba
text: Behold: You now face Díthorba, one of the Four Falcon Knights of Silesse! This is where your journey ends!

speaker: Díthorba
text: Ohohoho! Erinys, is it? Fancy seeing you here! Your head will make a fine gift for Lord Maios' mantelpiece!

speaker: Erinys
text: I'll never let you win here, Díthorba! I've come a long way from the Erinys you once knew!

speaker: Díthorba
text: Pfeh. Don't make me laugh! Once a weakling, always a weakling! Some things will never change!

speaker: Díthorba
text: N-no... What have I…

speaker: Maios
text: Come on, traitors! Grannvale's bounty on your heads is mine for the plucking!

speaker: Maios
text: Keh... Look who's come crawling back. My dear sister-in-law's idiot son has returned at last.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Hello, Uncle. Time for you to die. After all, Silesse needs its future.

speaker: Maios
text: Oof! This can't... be…

speaker: Pamela
text: Heh... Begone weakling!

speaker: Pamela
text: Oh. Prince Lewyn. It's been a while, hasn't it? I've some news for you. I've now surpassed Annand. Permanently. Ha ha ha...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Gah! Pamela! How dare you!

speaker: Pamela
text: I could say the same of you. After all, all of this is your fault!

speaker: Pamela
text: Oh. It's just you, Erinys. You came back, did you?

speaker: Erinys
text: P-Pamela... PAMELA!! What you did to Annand is unforgivable!

speaker: Pamela
text: Hmph. That's rich, coming from a fledgling knight like you! Prepare yourself. You're about to join your dear, departed sister!

speaker: Pamela
text: I-impossible…

speaker: Daccar
text: The throne of Silesse is mine, and mine alone! It is my birthright! Stand aside, loathsome gnats!

speaker: Daccar
text: Keh... Lewyn... Damn you!

speaker: Lewyn
text: How dare you, Daccar! How dare you murder Annand! Death is too good for the likes of you!

speaker: Daccar
text: What nerve! You die here and now, Lewyn!

speaker: Daccar
text: Nngh... My... My dreams... They're…

speaker: Lamia
text: Hah! What a clumsy mistake, trying to fight me!

speaker: Lamia
text: N-no... How…

speaker: Donovan
text: Hahaha! Time for ya to die!

speaker: Donovan
text: Gah... You're... You're too strong…

speaker: Annand
text: I'm sorry. I know you're not to blame, but this must be done…

speaker: Annand
text: Aah... Erinys... Prince... Lewyn...

speaker: Blume
text: Nngh... Curses! Never did I imagine that the rebels could pose such a threat. Banba! How could the three of you let yourselves be cowed into fleeing? What a disgrace!

speaker: Banba
text: A thousand apologies, milord. However, you've nothing to worry about anymore. Even as we speak, General Muhammad prepares his brigade to lay siege to Alster, and General Ovo's cavalry are en route to Leonster. We, too, shall rejoin the fray shortly.

speaker: Blume
text: Hrm... Don't you dare fail me this time. And what of King Travant? Why are the promised Thracian reinforcements nowhere to be seen?

speaker: Banba
text: We've yet to receive any response to any of our messengers so far.

speaker: Blume
text: Gah... What in blazes is that snake thinking?

speaker: Banba
text: King Travant is an ambitious man. To blindly trust him would be foolish.

speaker: Blume
text: No matter. Even without his forces, we've more than enough power to stop the rebels cold. Banba! Fotla! Eriu! Move out at once. This time, leave not a single rebel alive!

speaker: Banba
text: Yes, milord. We will not fail.

speaker: Man
text: Sir Ced, please! We all can't take much more of King Blume's abuses! How long... How long will it be until Manster is free from the Empire?

speaker: Ced
text: Don't lose hope now! Even as we speak, Lord Seliph and his liberators are out there fighting for the District. They'll be here before long. Go! Tell your friends and family that your freedom is so very nearly in reach! Please, my friends, believe me. Manster's freedom is fast approaching!

speaker: Arion
text: Pardon me, Father, but King Blume is requesting our aid yet again. The Empire has already lost both Alster and Leonster to the Isaach rebels. He wishes to use us to help reclaim them.

speaker: Travant
text: The Isaach rebels are led by that Seliph brat... Sigurd's spawn, correct? Heh... Poor, poor Blume. He's getting so old, even little children are a thorn in his side! Pay Blume no heed, Arion. The Empire and the rebels are best left to break themselves on each other for now. We'll mop up the leftovers once they're nice and weak.

speaker: Arion
text: I should have known, Father... All along, you've been waiting out Blume's little storm, haven't you?

speaker: Travant
text: But of course! It'd make no sense to bend over backward for the man who snatched our hard-won north out from under our noses, would it? Leonster's downfall should have meant a peninsula unified under our rule... I'll neither forgive nor forget Blume's craven conquest.

speaker: Arion
text: Even now, we still lack the power to truly match Grannvale on an even battlefield... I can only imagine your frustration, Father.

speaker: Travant
text: Thracia's fate depends on a unified peninsula. The verdant northern soils are the perfect cure for the famine and poverty wracking our south. We've been shunned and vilified for centuries, dismissed as ravenous hyenas... Yet what choice did we ever have? If not for our answer to this world's craving for sellswords, Thracia would never have had the funds to barely survive as we do. We've toiled in poverty long enough, Arion. It's high time Thracia carved itself a future! A future, I might add, which depends on the outcome of the game laid before us...

speaker: Arion
text: Mm.

speaker: Lewyn
text: I have a bad feeling about this, Seliph... Is Leonster well guarded?

speaker: Seliph
text: I believe so, but then again, reinforcing it further certainly wouldn't hurt. Should I send them some support?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Do it. With Blume still on the loose in Conote, there's no sense in skimping on the defenses. Oh, and also, we've received a plea for help from the people of Manster Castle. The sooner our forces reach them, the better.

speaker: Seliph
text: Very well. We shall make the first move!

speaker: Muhammad
text: Move in on Alster Castle! We've nothing to fear from these rebels! If anyone dares to question my command, come forth and allow me to relieve your neck of your head! ...No volunteers? Good. Attack!

speaker: Ovo
text: Good, everything's ready. Men, we tear through Leonster's defenses in one fell swoop! We'll not let Muhammad's men put us to shame!

speaker: Banba
text: It is time, then... Fotla, Eriu, shall we proceed? We've no room for error this time.

speaker: Faval
text: What do you want, Blume?

speaker: Blume
text: Ah, Faval. So you came after all. I've been waiting for you.

speaker: Faval
text: Look, Blume. I'm a busy man. Tell me what you want, or I'm leaving.

speaker: Blume
text: Tch... Listen carefully. I've an employment opportunity for you.

speaker: Faval
text: ...An employment opportunity?

speaker: Blume
text: Yes, Faval. I require your services in putting down the rebel army.

speaker: Faval
text: Pass. I might be a mercenary, but I'm certainly not about to do your dirty work.

speaker: Blume
text: Oh, really? Then what will become of all those orphans in your care? Rumor has it your dear sister has taken to stealing the money you need to take care of them. Are you content with such a life?

speaker: Faval
text: I guess you're right... I dunno if I can take Patty risking her life like this much longer. And we do sorely need the gold...

speaker: Blume
text: Bring me Seliph's head, Faval, and you'll have all the gold your orphans will ever need and more. Your dear sister would approve.

speaker: Faval
text: ...Deal. I know this'll come back to bite me, but if it means saving the kids... You have my bow... just this once.

speaker: Ishtar
text: You summoned me, Father? How might I be of assistance?

speaker: Blume
text: Ishtar! What kept you so long? The rebels are preparing to launch another attack on me any moment now! I-I need you to protect me!

speaker: Ishtar
text: What's happened, Father? How could a pack of simple rebels get to you of all people? This is so very unlike you...

speaker: Blume
text: These are no mere rebels! They've already slaughtered Ishtore, and Tine is lost to us as well because of them... They've already defeated Banba and her sister... I can't leave this task to them again. You're all I have left to depend upon!

speaker: Ishtar
text: Understood, but I have one condition. I need the Book of Mjölnir. If I'm wielding Mjölnir, I won't need an army with me. I alone will be more than enough.

speaker: Blume
text: W-what?! You... want me to hand it over... Fine. Very well... You can take Mjölnir... But don't you dare fail me now!

speaker: Ishtar
text: You can trust me, Father. By your leave.

speaker: Julius
text: Ishtar. Return with me to Belhalla. You've no business dying in a place like this.

speaker: Ishtar
text: Oh! Lord Julius... ...But why are you-

speaker: Julius
text: Come, Ishtar. I need you.

speaker: Ishtar
text: Y-yes, milord! Anything you wish!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Looks like we just dealt a critical blow to the Empire's control of the area, Seliph. Their survivors are fleeing in droves!

speaker: Seliph
text: Excellent! I suspect liberating Manster has become far simpler than we'd hoped.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Don't get too excited just yet. The real problem here is still Thracia.

speaker: Seliph
text: What makes you think so? What would cause Thracia to break neutrality now, of all times?

speaker: Lewyn
text: You've never had to deal with King Travant before, have you? Just ask Prince Leif. If not for Travant, he would still have his parents. Travant's murder of them was a cruel ambush, an insult to the honor of a knight like Quan. Who knows what dirty game he's planning now…

speaker: Travant
text: Blume's gone and died, has he? Heh heh... At last! Thracia has been scrubbed clean of the Imperial taint! Now's our chance to help ourselves to the north, starting with Manster! Altena! I leave the capture of Manster to you. I'll send General Coulter with you. If anyone stands in your way, suppress them without a second thought. I don't care if it's a little kid with a wooden stick. Cut them down!

speaker: Altena
text: Hold on a moment, Father! I'm as eager to challenge the Empire as you are, but killing innocents makes no sense at all! We'd be much better served forging an alliance with the liberators. We're already surrounded by enemies. Why make more?

speaker: Travant
text: Altena! I have no interest in one of your little lectures. Keep your mouth shut and do as you're told!

speaker: Altena
text: But, Father-

speaker: Arion
text: Please, Altena. Just listen to him. Father and I must return to the capital. We've some further preparations to make. Best of luck holding our border, Altena.

speaker: Altena
text: Arion... Very well, I'll do it...

speaker: Travant
text: Then don't waste your time dawdling! Go!

speaker: Travant
text: She's finally gone? Good... Stubborn little thing, isn't she? I haven't seen a woman so brash since her mother... Quite the family resemblance there!

speaker: Arion
text: Father, surely you must realize that Altena means you no ill will. You needn't be so harsh on her.

speaker: Travant
text: Yes, that much is obvious, thank you! ...Let's head back to the capital, Arion. We need to ready the army to claim this peninsula as ours, once and for all! Maykov! Meath Castle is in your hands. Work with Altena's unit and defend the border, no matter what happens!

speaker: Maykov
text: Understood, milord!

speaker: Man
text: Dire news, Sir Ced! Thracia's dispatched a dracoknight unit from Meath, and they're coming our way!

speaker: Ced
text: Just our luck... We've only just finally cleared the Empire out of Manster, and now we've got Thracia to grapple with as well?! I suppose it was only a matter of time before Travant showed his true colors...

speaker: Man
text: The liberation army's sure to want to aid us, but they still haven't crossed the river! What do we do?

speaker: Ced
text: Everyone! Get out of here and run for Connaught! I'll stay here and fend off the wyvern knights for as long as I can.

speaker: Young Woman
text: B-but that's impossible, Sir Ced! Not even you could survive a dracoknight assault by yourself!

speaker: Ced
text: I know, but I won't risk any lives but my own. Don't worry. I won't go down without bringing a few Thracians with me! Go on, please! We've no time to waste!

speaker: Young Woman
text: Sir Ced…

speaker: Maykov
text: The rebels have made it to Manster? What in the blazes is Princess Altena doing? Men! Bolster our defensive line! Until His Majesty the King returns, we must protect the border at all costs!

speaker: Coulter
text: Is everything ready, my liege? We'll be closing in on Manster shortly. Let's waste no time in besieging them!

speaker: Altena
text: Hold, Coulter! Those are nothing more than common citizens standing in our way. Killing them would be the foulest of crimes. Wait here with the squad. I'll see if I can negotiate a surrender.

speaker: Coulter
text: You know I can't do that. My orders come from over your head. You may spout all the lovely nonsense you wish, but the king forbids me to stay my hand.

speaker: Altena
text: Are you questioning a direct order from your commander and your princess, General?!

speaker: Coulter
text: These are my men, princess! If you don't wish to partake yourself, then stand aside, make yourself useful and watch our backs! Now, then... Is everyone ready? All hands, prepare to strike Manster! Leave no survivors!

speaker: Altena
text: C-Coulter! Get back here at once!

speaker: Leif
text: Hold on a moment. Over there... Is that a dracoknight dame? She has such a sad look in her eyes…

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia?! You’re safe! Oh, thank heavens…

speaker: Julia
text: Mm… The enemy seized and imprisoned me here, but I knew… I knew you would rescue me, no matter what.

speaker: Seliph
text: The Thracians are on such a different level to anybody we've fought before, Lewyn. It almost feels as if each blow is fueled by pure desperation...

speaker: Lewyn
text: See, Thracia's always had a bad lot in life. Much of its land is consumed by mountains. Farming its own food is a near impossible task, so they struggle to keep themselves fed. Thracia's men seek mercenary work to find the money to stay alive, while its women are stuck in whatever dreary jobs they can dig up. Don't get me wrong, Seliph. King Travant is still an awful man, but there's far more than his own petty gain at stake in his schemes. The Thracian army is as loyal to Travant as they come. They ardently believe it's Travant who'll guide Thracia out of its endless famine.

speaker: Seliph
text: I see... That does make sense...

speaker: Lewyn
text: The thing is, no amount of poverty will ever justify Thracia's aggression. Travant's brand of nobility and justice would never be accepted anywhere else in the world. All the peninsula's north can see are rowdy aggressors, who threaten their peaceful lives. As harsh as it may seem, Seliph, I trust you know you can't afford to stay your hand here. The Thracian royal family is the enemy, and a grave threat to the north's peace. Stripping them of power is the only choice. That task falls to us, and we can't fail now.

speaker: Altena
text: The liberators have seized Meath?! Could I have been wrong about them? Oh, Arion.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Ohh, thank you so much! I've heard all the stories about your army, and I've been praying that you'd come someday. Lord Seliph is our beacon of hope! Here, take this power ring. It's not much, but it's all we have to show our gratitude.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Long ago, Thracia and the states of the Manster District were a single nation. 'Course, you'd never know that from how they've hated each other so for as long as anyone can recall! I wish they could just try to make peace…

speaker: Young Man
text: Gaah! I-I don't believe it... The Connaught Hitman's back for more blood! Run, everyone! Run for it!

speaker: Asaello
text: Er... Shouldn't you be running, too?

speaker: Girl
text: But you look so sad, mister...

speaker: Asaello
text: ...I do?

speaker: Girl
text: Take these! We picked up all these fruits in the woods. Eat 'em! They'll make you grow up big and strong! I hope you feel better soon!

speaker: Asaello
text: Thanks, kid…

speaker: Man
text: I've heard tell that over in Manster, people're planning a revolt against the Imperial rule. Apparently the ringleader there's some Silessian mage called Ced... The people there are so sure that he's the man for the job. Of course, the real problem for Manster is that Thracia's got their grubby eyes on the city... I hope they'll be alright.

speaker: Woman
text: For as long as anyone can recall, Thracia's wanted to claim this region as their own. And for just as long, House Leonster always stood in their way, wielding their holy lance Gáe Bolg to defend our lands. At least, until Gáe Bolg was lost a decade ago in the Yied Desert... The Thracians ambushed and murdered Prince Quan, his wife Ethlyn, and their daughter Altena as they crossed Yied, and the lance vanished…

speaker: Old Man
text: It was the legendary dracoknight Dain who founded Thracia all those years ago… With his heavenly lance, Gungnir, in hand, he dared to challenge the king of demons himself! Rumor has it that Nova of the crusaders, ancestor of the lords of House Leonster, was in fact a sister to Lord Dain…

speaker: Old Woman
text: Hoo hoo! What brings you all the way out here? You must be quite the curious one! Either way, I want to thank you for coming all this way for such a small and remote town. This here trinket's a thief's band. She's an odd little thing: slip her on and you'll soon find yourself stealing like you've done it all your life. Hoo hoo hoo! Take care of yourself, dearie.

speaker: Julia
text: Lord Seliph...

speaker: Seliph
text: Oh, Julia. Is something the matter?

speaker: Julia
text: I... I'm scared... I sense an evil presence... Something dark... And it's closing in...

speaker: Seliph
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Julia
text: (slowly) ...Seliph... Be on your guard... Ishtar is a fierce foe... You cannot fight her... You must not...

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia! What's happening to you?!

speaker: Julia
text: Ahh... I... W-what in the world just...?

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia... You're…

speaker: Arthur
text: You need to be careful, Fee. I know you can fly and all, but that doesn't mean you should just take off by yourself.

speaker: Fee
text: Oh? Are my ears playing tricks on me? Could it be you're actually worried about me, Arthur?

speaker: Arthur
text: Er... Yeah, I suppose so.

speaker: Fee
text: Hmmm! Who knew you had it in you? I never would've guessed that you're even able to worry about anyone but yourself! I might have to rethink everything just a bit!

speaker: Arthur
text: Well, er, you're something of a special case...

speaker: Fee
text: Huh?

speaker: Arthur
text: Er, never mind! Anyway, just don't do anything too rash, alright? See you...

speaker: Fee
text: Arthur…

speaker: Finn
text: Lord Leif, the protection of the peninsula realm is our duty as House Leonster's remnants. We aren't in for an easy battle, but no matter what happens, we must persevere.

speaker: Leif
text: I know, Finn. I've always dreamed that this day, the day of Leonster's freedom, would come... I'll do all I can to bring peace to the peninsula and save the people from King Blume's tyranny. To fulfill Father's final wishes at last... And if I need to lay down my life to make our dream a reality, then so be it...

speaker: Finn
text: Please, my lord! It ill befits a future king to do something so rash! You mustn't say such things!

speaker: Leif
text: Er, you're right... Sorry, Finn. I know how hard you had to work to protect me from the Empire's pursuit in my youth. I recall how often you'd let yourself starve, just so I wouldn't have to go without food... All my life you've made sacrifice after sacrifice for my sake, and only now do I understand this... I'll always be grateful for all you've done, Finn.

speaker: Finn
text: My lord, the Thracian region has been plagued by strife for generations, but your father dared to dream of uniting it under a lasting peace. He may be gone, but you still yet live, and so too does the hope of fulfilling his dream. Only you stand a chance of uniting Thracia.

speaker: Patty
text: Hang on... Faval?! What d'you think you're doing? Ugh... Don't tell me you actually let Blume buy out your bow arm!

speaker: Faval
text: Patty? Wait... Why are you with the rebels?

speaker: Patty
text: To protect people, of course! We've come this far working together, and I know we're gonna stop Blume for good! I don't get it. Did you just go and forget everything? That if it wasn't for the Empire's cruelty, none of the kids would be orphans? But no, here you are, kissing up to the very same man who ruined all our friends' lives! What the heck were you thinking, Faval?

speaker: Faval
text: You're absolutely right... I'm so sorry, Patty. I guess I just wasn't thinking at all.

speaker: Patty
text: Any scumbag can apologize till their blue in the face! If you're really sorry, then get over here! Come help us fight for peace!

speaker: Faval
text: Alright, Patty. I'm with you. You've certainly come a long way lately...

speaker: Patty
text: Hee hee... I guess I have!

speaker: Faval
text: Prince Seliph? Please, sir, forgive my foolishness!

speaker: Seliph
text: Faval, yes? Patty has already told me your story. Relax! I understand why you did what you did. You've nothing to worry about.

speaker: Faval
text: I don't think so, sir. Letting myself work for the very same Empire I've supposedly been opposing? That was shamefully half-witted of me... Sir, I swear I'll make up for my bad choices. I'll do everything I can to aid you!

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank you, Faval. I'm glad to have you.

speaker: Seliph
text: Pardon me, Tine. I don't suppose you're acquainted with Princess Ishtar?

speaker: Tine
text: I am... When I was growing up, Ishtar was like a sister to me. She was one of the few who treated me well...

speaker: Seliph
text: Would you have any idea who the man who came to collect her was, then?

speaker: Tine
text: That... was most likely Prince Julius.

speaker: Seliph
text: The crown prince himself?! Are you certain?

speaker: Tine
text: I think so, yes. The two are a couple. That would be why he...

speaker: Seliph
text: Have you met Prince Julius before, then?

speaker: Tine
text: Once or twice, when I visited Belhalla. He... How can I put this... He has this odd charm which draws people to him... only for them to find that he's colder than ice. He's terrifying! If I didn't know better, I would swear he isn't even human…

speaker: Nanna
text: Hey! You’re Ares, right?

speaker: Ares
text: I am. What do you want?

speaker: Nanna
text: I’ve been hearing how you’re the son of Eldigan. Is there any truth to that?

speaker: Ares
text: There is. Of what concern is it yours?

speaker: Nanna
text: Oh, I knew it was true! I’m Nanna. I’m the daughter of Lachesis, Lord Eldigan’s sister!

speaker: Ares
text: C-can this be?! Are you truly my aunt’s child?

speaker: Nanna
text: Of course I am! You know, my mother was really worried about what happened to you. It must’ve been her search for you that brought us to Leonster all those years ago.

speaker: Ares
text: My father knew well that the stormclouds of a brutal civil war lurked over Agustria. I was a mere infant and my mother was in poor health, so he bade her to seek refuge with her parents in Leonster. Alas, Leonster too fell afoul of a war of its own, and my mother lost her life to the Empire’s invasion.

speaker: Nanna
text: That’s where Jabarro comes in, right?

speaker: Ares
text: Indeed. Jabarro found me and took me in as his own, and with his mercenary corps, I travelled the world and learned the art of war.

speaker: Nanna
text: So that’s why I’ve never found you before… Listen, Ares. My mother left me something to give to you if we ever met.

speaker: Ares
text: Oh? ...What is this? Is this... Is this Father’s?!

speaker: Nanna
text: It is! It’s a letter from Lord Eldigan, and it’s addressed to you, Ares.

speaker: Ares
text: I can’t believe it…

speaker: Nanna
text: This should sort everything out! It says your father and Sigurd were the closest of friends and held each other’s deepest trust. This never changed, no matter what…

speaker: Ares
text: So it says… Wow, I… I’ve been so, so wrong for all this time…

speaker: Nanna
text: I hope you’ll look after Lord Seliph, Ares. He really is depending on you!

speaker: Ares
text: I will, I promise you… Say, Nanna. How would you like a quick lesson in swordplay? Here, pay close attention…

speaker: Mana
text: Milord…

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, Mana. Is something the matter?

speaker: Mana
text: Er, see… I’m scared, milord. I mean, when we first left Isaach I was excited as anybody, but now… I watch everyone risking their lives over and over, and I...I know that sooner or later, it’ll be one of us who dies next.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mana…

speaker: Mana
text: You saw what the thunder mage did when we defeated her, didn’t you, milord? She just vanished in the blink of an eye! There’s something else at work here… An evil power beyond anything we know!

speaker: Seliph
text: ...You aren’t alone, Mana. I’ve tried to hide it, but to be frank, I’m terrified as well. Often I find myself too fearful to sleep… Sometimes, the fear is so overwhelming that I wish I could run away… Just leave Jugdral and its troubles behind me. But I cannot… I will not. You saw the faces of the people when we freed Alster and Connaught, did you not? The very instant that we’d won, they were so overjoyed that they burst into tears! That’s how much freedom from the Empire means to them. We are the ones with the power to save Jugdral, Mana, and we must not shirk from that duty.

speaker: Mana
text: ...I’m so sorry, milord. I shouldn’t have made you worry like that. I’ll always give your cause all I have. I promise. But please, milord… Please be careful! I don’t know what we’d do without you…

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank you, Mana. And I… I don’t know what I’d do without you.

speaker: Mana
text: Oh… Milord…

speaker: Seliph
text: Ced the Brave, I presume? I couldn't possibly thank you enough for all you've done for the people of Manster.

speaker: Ced
text: Lord Seliph... I'm so glad you're here at last. Sire, I implore you! Save this world! Too many of us have already given into despair... The city of Manster has been robbed by the Empire of countless young children. All were sent to the shrines in Miletos... I... I couldn't save even a single child. Me, brave? Hah! I hardly deserve such a lofty label. I'm just another coward...

speaker: Seliph
text: That isn't true, Ced! If I were to fight alone, I know that there'd be precious little that I could do. It was uniting the strength of my friends, a team effort, which brought us this far! And I believe that your strength could be a valuable part of our cause. Please, Ced the Brave. Grant us your power!

speaker: Ced
text: Thank you, sire... You'll have my loyalty, no matter what!

speaker: Ced
text: Huh?! Er, pardon me, Lord Seliph, but... ...That man standing by your side...

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, Ced. I'd like you to meet Lewyn, my tactician.

speaker: Ced
text: Lewyn? I knew it. That's my father...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Oh, Ced. I guess you've found me. Been a while, huh? How's things?

speaker: Ced
text: How's things? HOW'S THINGS?! Father, don't you realize? I've been searching for you for all this time! Do you even realize how long it's been since you ran away from home?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Oh, yeah. I guess it has been a few years... Hey, how's Erinys doing these days?

speaker: Ced
text: How dare you... Mother is DEAD! All we ever wanted was for her to see you one last time before she died... That's why I've been looking for you!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Huh... Erinys... Such a shame, too...

speaker: Ced
text: Are you capable of any emotion at all, Father?! You just heard your wife's dead, and you won't so much as shed a tear... And what about Fee? You've hurt her so much! It still pains her... She's adamant that she won't speak to you. You've known she was here all along, Father. Why didn't you try to fix this?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Look, Ced. I left my old life behind long ago for a reason. That goes for my wife and kids, too. End of story. That's all there is to it.

speaker: Ced
text: ...Father?!

speaker: Fee
text: Ced...? Cedsy! It IS you!

speaker: Ced
text: Fee?! What are you doing here? Is something the matter?

speaker: Fee
text: I've been looking for you, of course! I mean, you've been gone from Silesse for so long, and we had no idea where you were!

speaker: Ced
text: I know, Fee, and I'm sorry... See, what happened was I was passing through Manster in my search for Father. I would've moved on, but the people's plight was nothing short of heartbreaking. I couldn't just leave Manster to waste away...

speaker: Fee
text: I should've known. That is so like you, Cedsy! And here I was, almost starting to forget why you're so incredible.

speaker: Ced
text: You're with the liberation army, then?

speaker: Fee
text: Yep! I just knew I had to help Lord Seliph.

speaker: Ced
text: Is that so... You're even more like Mother than I thought! Not once in her life did she ever turn her back on someone in need.

speaker: Fee
text: You're just like her, too, Cedsy... Poor Mom, though. Just thinking about how Dad left her... It makes me so mad!

speaker: Ced
text: Mm... I still can't make sense of his actions. What could he have possibly been thinking…

speaker: Femina
text: Hawke...? Hawkesy! It IS you!

speaker: Hawke
text: Femina?! What are you doing here? Is something the matter?

speaker: Femina
text: I've been looking for you, of course! I mean, you've been gone from Silesse for so long, and we had no idea where you were!

speaker: Hawke
text: I know, Femina, and I'm sorry... See, what happened was I was passing through Manster in my search for Father. I would've moved on, but the people's plight was nothing short of heartbreaking. I couldn't just leave Manster to waste away…

speaker: Femina
text: I should've known. That is so like you, Hawkesy! And here I was, almost starting to forget why you're so incredible.

speaker: Hawke
text: You're with the liberation army, then?

speaker: Femina
text: Yep! I just knew I had to help Lord Seliph.

speaker: Hawke
text: Is that so… I should have known. After all these years you’ve spent admiring Sigurd, it was inevitable you’d want to aid his son.

speaker: Femina
text: Yep! I’ve always dreamed of being a pegasus knight as great as the legendary Lady Erin. Just watch me, Hawkesy. I’ll get there someday!

speaker: Fee
text: Whew! What a view, huh? I wonder if I can spot Cedsy from here... Hey, you alright, Mahnya? Ready to fly yet? Y'know, Mahnya, you're named for my aunt... She was one of the greatest Silessian heroines. I bet that name's why you just don't give up. Don't you worry. The very instant everything's peaceful again, We'll be going right back home to Silesse! And once it's all done... Hee hee! Maybe I'll find someone really cute, and we'll spend the rest of our lives together! But I guess we've got a little more work to do before the guys or girls come along! Come on, Mahnya!

speaker: Jake
text: A human! Oh, I’m saved!

speaker: Linda
text: What’s the matter?

speaker: Jake
text: See, I was on my way to join the liberation army, but all I’ve managed to do is get myself lost… What brings you to this gods-forsaken place?

speaker: Linda
text: I’m with Lord Seliph’s army, fighting to bring peace to the land.

speaker: Jake
text: Really? Hah! What are the odds? I get lost trying to find the liberators, only to find one of ‘em here, of all places… I, er, was actually headed home now. It’s embarrassing, I know, but all this has scared the life out of me. I bet my dear, sweet Anna is worried sick too…

speaker: Linda
text: That’s a pity… I would have liked to have had you on our side…

speaker: Jake
text: Y’know, the real problem is those ballistae. One glimpse of those, and I freeze right up! I can’t say I’d have been much use to you at all, had I joined you. Oh, right! What’s your name, anyway?

speaker: Linda
text: I’m Linda…

speaker: Jake
text: Linda? That sounds awfully familiar… Though, are you sure you’re spelling it right? Never mind, I suppose. Here, take this talisman for your trouble. I certainly won’t be needing it anymore!

speaker: Linda
text: Thank you…

speaker: Jake
text: Well, best of luck out there. Naga bless you, miss!

speaker: Jake
text: A human! Oh, I’m saved!

speaker: Amid
text: Is everything alright?

speaker: Jake
text: It’s kind of a long story… A very, very long story. See, I got myself kind of lost around these parts, but this kid from the liberators called Linda helped me get back on my way. But then, pathetic as I am, I went and got myself lost all over again!

speaker: Amid
text: Is that right? Linda’s my sister. The name’s Amid, and don’t worry. I’ll do what I can to get you out of here.

speaker: Jake
text: Wait, really? You’re seriously Linda’s brother? Ahahaha! What are the odds of that? ...Gods, I’m hopeless…

speaker: Amid
text: Listen, don’t worry about it. Everything’ll be fine. Just follow me. If we’re attacked, get down and I’ll take care of everything.

speaker: Jake
text: ...Wow. What a great guy. Like brother, like sister, huh…

speaker: Amid
text: Hey, I’m sure you’d do the same.

speaker: Jake
text: Trust me, you really are a good person… Here, I want you to take this talisman with you. Heh… I gave one to your sister, but I actually had a spare just in case!

speaker: Amid
text: Oh, thanks. I really appreciate this.

speaker: Jake
text: Right! I’m going to make it home, and then I’m going to see to it that Anna and I have a kid who’s every bit as kind as you!

speaker: Amid
text: You’ll never get to do that if you don’t make it out of these mountains, huh? Follow me!

speaker: Jake
text: H-hey! Could you slow down a bit?! I can’t keep up with you like this!

speaker: Muhammad
text: Keh... You rebel scum…

speaker: Muhammad
text: We... We've been defeated so easily...? King Blume... I beg your forgiveness…

speaker: Ovo
text: I'm impressed you've come so far... But this is the end for you!

speaker: Ovo
text: I-impossible…

speaker: Eriu
text: Taste the wrath of thunder, rebel!

speaker: Eriu
text: Banba... Fotla... Is this.... the end?

speaker: Fotla
text: Taste the howling gale, traitor!

speaker: Fotla
text: Nngh... Blasted rebels…

speaker: Banba
text: Taste raging flames, brigand!

speaker: Banba
text: Ahh... What a shame... Fotla... Eriu…

speaker: Eriu
text: Banba! Fotla! Ready? This time, no mistakes! ...Triangle Attack!!

speaker: Fotla
text: Banba! Eriu! This time, without fail! ...Triangle Attack!!

speaker: Banba
text: Fotla! Eriu! This time, we're ready! ...Triangle Attack!!

speaker: Blume
text: What in the blazes is happening out there?! You rebel scum... You'll have no mercy from me!

speaker: Blume
text: Y-you! You're Sigurd's whelp... You won't leave here alive!

speaker: Seliph
text: I believe that's my line, King Blume. You've nowhere to run this time!

speaker: Blume
text: Curses... I'll drag you down to the grave with me, whelp!

speaker: Blume
text: Tine... How dare you, you spoiled, ungrateful brat!

speaker: Tine
text: Spoiled? If it weren't for you, my mother wouldn't have been driven to her death... Don't you dare claim to have forgotten!

speaker: Blume
text: Gah…

speaker: Blume
text: Faval! What in the blazes do you think you're doing?! You traitorous slime!

speaker: Faval
text: Yeah, sorry about that, but I realize that I'd much rather die than help you. Too bad it's you who'll die instead.

speaker: Blume
text: Gah... I'm surrounded by buffoons…

speaker: Blume
text: Nngh... How... regrettable…

speaker: Faval
text: I'm so sorry... But we sorely need the gold…

speaker: Faval
text: Oh, Patty… Forgive your… fool of a brother…

speaker: Faval
text: Wait... Patty?! No, this... It's not what it looks like!

speaker: Ishtar
text: I wish I didn't have to do this... But you shall go no further!

speaker: Ishtar
text: Ahh! Lord Julius…

speaker: Ishtar
text: Wait... Tine? What do you think you're doing?!

speaker: Tine
text: Ishtar... I... I'm so sorry...

speaker: Ishtar
text: You've turned traitor, then? I'm disappointed in you, Tine!

speaker: Young Woman
text: Please, we beg of you... Do all you can to help sir Ced!

speaker: Young Woman
text: Thank you so much, noble warrior!

speaker: Young Woman
text: Thracia's wyvern knights are still on the prowl 'round these parts. Be careful, won't you…

speaker: Young Man
text: You're with Lord Seliph's liberators? Gods be praised! You've come at last.

speaker: Young Man
text: Three cheers for Lord Seliph!

speaker: Young Man
text: We're saved! Oh, thank you!

speaker: Coulter
text: Heh heh... What a pity it is for you, that this is where you die!

speaker: Coulter
text: Gaaah! May Thracia... rise in glory…

speaker: Maykov
text: This land is the rightful land of the Kingdom of Thracia! You will never take it from us!

speaker: Maykov
text: Guh... Glory... to Thracia...

speaker: Midir
text: Milady, the castle is completely surrounded! We've failed you... We couldn't do a thing to save you from them...

speaker: Aideen
text: It's alright, Midir. ...Every one of you did the best you could do. Please, you needn't worry about me. You must ensure that as many of you survive this as possible.

speaker: Midir
text: No, milady. We might not stand a chance, but every last one of us will give our lives to protect you, right to the very end.

speaker: Aideen
text: Thank you, Midir. ...I'm so sorry.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Gandolf's army already has Jungby surrounded. Aideen is in grave danger! Noish, I'm going to help her. I'm leaving Chalphy in your hands.

speaker: Noish
text: Hold, milord. Surely you don't intend to go alone?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Nearly all of our forces are already on the march to Isaach with Father. There's hardly anybody left to call upon. They may be simple savages, but Verdane's army is still huge. I can't risk your lives by forcing you to face them.

speaker: Noish
text: Perish the thought, milord! I was born a knight, and I will gladly risk dying a knight's death in your name. To allow our lord to die alone in battle would be an unspeakable disgrace. We shall be by your side, every step of the way. Alec, I trust you're of the same mind?

speaker: Alec
text: Yeah, of course! But there's more than just Jungby at stake. We've got to stop by the nearby villages first. Those thugs'll try to beat us to them, and they'll loot, massacre, and burn them all down if they do. We've gotta get there first, and lend the locals a hand in locking the villages down and fortifying their defenses.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Absolutely. We mustn't neglect our knightly duties to the people, especially not at a time like this. Good point, Alec.

speaker: Alec
text: Actually, that was all Oifey's idea. That kid's every bit the tactician they say he is. Give him a few years and he'll be a match for his old grandpa, Lord Sesar!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Oifey's still around the castle, huh... Oifey! I know you're here. You can come out now!

speaker: Oifey
text: My apologies for still being here, sire. Still, if you would allow it, I'd like to join you in battle. I can't just sit back while you risk your lives.

speaker: Sigurd
text: I don't know... You're still so young. Are you sure you're ready for this?

speaker: Oifey
text: I'm already fourteen, sire. I may not be battle-ready just yet, but there's still so much I can do to support you. Please, allow me to accompany you. I swear I won't let you down.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Fair enough, Oifey. After all, you've already spent two years training as my squire. Real battlefield experience would be fantastic for your training, but you're still definitely not up to actual combat duty for now. How about you ride with me as my advisor instead?
