speaker: Oifey
text: Y-yes! Thank you, sire! Thank you!

speaker: Noish
text: Milord, what of the the defense of Chalphy itself in our absence? Leaving the castle unattended is risky. Should the enemy slip past us, an unguarded castle will fall easily and spell us a swift end.

speaker: Alec
text: Noish, I'd say there's only one man who we can depend upon for that... Eh, Arden?

speaker: Arden
text: Hold on a moment! Why me, Alec?

speaker: Alec
text: Sturdy as a brick wall! Strong as an ox! Slow as a turtle! Face it, Arden, you were born for guard duty! Haha!

speaker: Arden
text: Pah... I'm strong and tough, I know, but you really don't need to call me slow!

speaker: Sigurd
text: He has a point, Arden. Would you? You're the most apt at guard duty.

speaker: Arden
text: Sigh... Fine, I'll do it. But you have to bring me with you at least once! I don't want to be left out of the action.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Right, men, it's time to set out. Let's start by assisting the villages, and then it's onward to Jungby!

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, might I recommend stopping by the castle town once you're rested? To see you unharmed should help to calm and reassure your citizens.

speaker: Gandolf
text: You curs seriously haven't seized this puny castle yet? Useless, the lot of you... Outta my way! I'll do it myself!

speaker: Gandolf
text: Kehehe... You! Not bad for being here all on your lonesome, but I've had enough of your struggling!

speaker: Midir
text: Urgh... Milady, I... Forgive me…

speaker: Aideen
text: Ah! Midir, I…

speaker: Gandolf
text: Well, well, looks like we have quite the gem here, and Jungby's princess to boot! You're coming home with me, dearie. Listen up, DiMaggio. I'm heading back. You and Gerrard are in charge.

speaker: Dimaggio
text: Er, yes, sir…

speaker: Gandolf
text: Hah, relax! Won't be long, and I'll be bringing Kinbois's lot along for the fun. When I do, all Grannvale's our oyster. Even Belhalla ought to be easy pickings, what with nobody around to stop us! The kingdom's all ours, boys!

speaker: Dimaggio
text: Leave it to us, sir!

speaker: Gandolf
text: Oi, quit your dawdling! We don't have all day, y'know!

speaker: Gandolf
text: Cut the bridge! I'll have none of those Grannvale worms crossing over here!

speaker: Barbarian
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Gandolf
text: Oi, Gerrard. I'm going back to Marpha for now. You're in charge of the border. Stay sharp, we clear?

speaker: Gerrard
text: Yes, sir. But, er, your lordship... Who's that there dame you have?

speaker: Gandolf
text: The spoils of war, m'boy! She's coming back to Marpha to marry me. Whaddya think? A real keeper, eh?

speaker: Gerrard
text: I'll say! Just looking at her's makin' me mouth water.

speaker: Gandolf
text: Back off! This one's mine. You'll have your pick of all Grannvale once we're done here. Keep it in your pants a little longer, yeah?

speaker: Aideen
text: What animals... ...Gods above, I implore you, bestow upon these men a hint of human decency…

speaker: Gandolf
text: Oi, what're you mumbling about now? We're outta here. No dawdling, y'hear?

speaker: Dimaggio
text: Get to work, boys! Our next stop's Chalphy. Don't forget to milk the villages for all they got!

speaker: Azelle
text: It looks like we made it just in time, Lex.

speaker: Lex
text: Mm. And by the look of it, Sigurd's staring down the entire Verdane army with just a handful of men! Bet he'll be glad for the help! But geez, Azelle, I can't believe I let you drag me into yet another mess like this.

speaker: Azelle
text: With the war in Isaach going on, there's hardly anyone left to defend Grannvale. Sigurd's few knights are all we have, and they're out here risking their lives on behalf of the entire country. I couldn't just leave them to die...

speaker: Lex
text: Heh... We both know there's more to it than that. Come on, Azelle. What's the real reason we're here?

speaker: Azelle
text: Er... I... I have no idea what you mean!

speaker: Lex
text: It's that Lady Aideen of Jungby, isn't it? Come on, everybody knows you like her. You just came for her sake, didn't you?

speaker: Azelle
text: N-no! Of course not, you dolt!

speaker: Lex
text: Really? Then why's your face beet-red? Looks like somebody's got a giiiiiiirlfriend!

speaker: Azelle
text: L-Lex, knock it off! Come on, we've wasted enough time.

speaker: Lex
text: Hahaha, got it. Time to teach these Verdanite thugs a lesson or two!

speaker: Quan
text: Good, we aren't too late. I pray Sigurd is still unhurt.

speaker: Ethlyn
text: Mm. I'm sure my brother's doing just fine out here, but it won't be easy without a magic user in his ranks. I want to do all I can as a healer to help out and save lives... Quan, I'm sorry I dragged you into this mess as well... I know Chalphy isn't my family anymore, now that we're married, but I couldn't just sit back and do nothing. Thank you so much for coming. Not just from me, but from Sigurd.

speaker: Quan
text: There's no need for thanks, Ethlyn. Sigurd is every bit as important to me as he is you, remember? He is my brother-in-law now, after all. ...And I couldn't possibly leave you to fight all alone.

speaker: Ethlyn
text: Thank you, dear... Thank you so much...

speaker: Finn
text: Milord, milady, we should hurry. Lord Sigurd still awaits us on the battlefield just ahead.

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, there's a young knight collapsed over there!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Oh? ...That's Midir! Midir, hold on! What happened here?

speaker: Midir
text: Uh... You... ...Lord... Sigurd?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Are you alright, Midir? Where's Aideen?!

speaker: Midir
text: I... don't know. But Gandolf...

speaker: Sigurd
text: Gandolf... That's all I need to hear. Midir, I'll do all I can to rescue her. You stay here and rest up.

speaker: Midir
text: I can't, sir. I've got to help! I can't stand staying here, knowing those thugs still have her!

speaker: Gerrard
text: DiMaggio stuffed up, huh? Shoulda known he was worthless! Prince Gandolf's not gonna like this. Put the bridge back up, boys! We ain't gonna blow it like DiMaggio!

speaker: Arvis
text: When His Majesty asked me to observe the battle, I hardly expected to see Chalphy struggle so against simple barbarians. Sigurd... So this is all you've amounted to…

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, we've completed our search of the castle. Lady Aideen is nowhere to be found.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Blast... Where could she be?

speaker: Oifey
text: She was most likely taken deeper into Verdane before we arrived. ...I hope she's alright.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Gah... I won't let them get away with this... They can run, but until they surrender Aideen, they won't escape me!

speaker: Oifey
text: Sire, an envoy from His Majesty is seeking an audience with you.

speaker: Filat
text: Lord Sigurd, your performance in this battle was outstanding. His Majesty is highly pleased, and has thus proclaimed your ordination as a paladin of the realm.

speaker: Sigurd
text: I hardly deserve such an honor, sir! I pledge my undying fealty to His Majesty.

speaker: Filat
text: From here, it is imperative that you hold Evans. We can ill afford to lose such a valuable defensive point to the enemy. You and your men shall be handsomely paid for your service. Provided, of course, that our territory survives unscathed. Best of luck, Lord Sigurd. Grannvale expects every man to do his duty.

speaker: Man
text: Oh, thank the gods! We're saved! We can't thank you enough! Here - the whole village did their bit to raise some money for you. It's not much, but we hope it helps out there. Be sure to lend the other villagese a hand, too. I bet they'll be happy to help you our right back.

speaker: Old Man
text: Pay attention, kid! Weapons aren't created equal. See, swords best axes, axes best lances, and lances best swords. This right here's why you've gotta use your head before you blunder into battle. Speaking of battle, if you ever find yourself hurting out there, a chapel is the best place to go. It ain't free, mind. Every bit of health you regain there'll cost five gold pieces. But you can't put a price on your health.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Oh? You came to save us? I was so sure this was the end! Take this little trinket. It's the least I can do. They call it a speed ring. Slip this magic band on and you'll be as nimble as a feather! Go on, try her out! Your enemies'll be too slow to hit you!

speaker: Old Man
text: The master archers of House Jungby all bear descent from the archery god, Ulir. Our noble duke, Lord Ring, has twin daughters as well as a younger son. Alas, the duke lost one of the girls to pirates, years and years ago... She was just a little lass... Lady Aideen's still here, but the son Lord Andorey is away with his lord father on the Isaach campaign. Rumor has it, though, that the two aren't getting along well now that the boy's grown...

speaker: Woman
text: The lords of this land, House Chalphy, have been revered as most magnificent swordsmen for generations. It's no wonder, being that they bear the bloodline of Baldr, the god of light of old. Those Verdane thugs are lucky Lord Byron isn't around with his holy sword, Tyrfing. They wouldn't stand a chance!

speaker: Azelle
text: Lord Sigurd! I'm so relieved to see you're unharmed.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Azelle? Azelle of Velthomer? What are you doing here?

speaker: Azelle
text: I'm here with Lex. We want to do whatever we can to fight the Verdanite invasion. Please, allow us to fight by your side. We won't let you down!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Of course! I couldn't ask for better help. But what of your brother, Lord Arvis? Is he alright with you helping out?

speaker: Azelle
text: No... He's been tasked with command of the Royal Guard. He made it clear that I wasn't supposed to leave Belhalla at all.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Did he, now? I can only imagine the scolding that you'll be in for later!

speaker: Azelle
text: I know this is a dreadful thing to say, but to be honest, I'm terrified of Arvis... Sometimes, when I'm around him, I... I feel as if I'm only a nuisance to him.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Is that right... Well, whatever your reasons, I'm just glad that you're here, Azelle. You're more than welcome to stay for as long as you want.

speaker: Azelle
text: Thank you, sir!

speaker: Azelle
text: Wow, he's just like all the rumors say! He's nothing like Arvis…

speaker: Lex
text: It's been a while, huh, Lord Sigurd?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Lex! I take it you're here to help as well?

speaker: Lex
text: Yeah, Azelle dragged me into it. I swear, I can't say no to that twerp!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Hahaha... You haven't changed a bit, have you, Lex? But what about your father, Lord Langobalt? Does he know you've come here?

speaker: Lex
text: Oh, hell no! You know as well as I how much my father loathes yours. There's no way he'd ever let me help House Chalphy, even if his life depended on it. I had to slip out behind his back. Just so we're clear, Sigurd, I'm not here for you. Azelle's my best friend, and he really wanted to help. That's all.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Heh. A bit harsh, but thanks for coming all the same. Any help is greatly appreciated.

speaker: Lex
text: Well, I'll do what I can. Those Verdane dogs have had their run of our land for long enough!

speaker: Quan
text: Sigurd! Glad to see you in one piece.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Quan? What are you-

speaker: Quan
text: We heard about the Verdane attack and couldn't just leave you be. We're here to do what we can.

speaker: Sigurd
text: But what about Leonster? Aren't your hands full there, keeping an eye on Thracia?

speaker: Quan
text: Indeed. That's why Finn is the only knight here with me. The Lanceritter are all back at home, under Father's command.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Is that so... Quan, I'm sorry for pulling you into this mess, too. I know you're-

speaker: Quan
text: Sorry? Surely you jest, Sigurd? Don't you recall our old pledge?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Hm?

speaker: Quan
text: Come now! How could you forget? All those years ago, when we were students at the Belhalla academy? You, me, and Eldigan. Dear friends and fierce rivals in equal measure? Surely you recall that night, talking late about our hopes and dreams, and pledging our aid to one another in times of need?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Ah, of course! I remember it well.

speaker: Quan
text: Excellent. Now shall we? With both of us here, what hope could those Verdanite savages possibly have? Never forget, Sigurd. I'm here for you, now and forever. I'll not let you lose to these lowlives!

speaker: Ethlyn
text: Sigurd! Oh, you're unharmed!

speaker: Sigurd
text: It's great to see you, too, Ethlyn. Thanks so much for coming.

speaker: Ethlyn
text: I just couldn't stay away when I heard of Verdane's attacks... It's such a relief to know you're okay.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Oh, come now. Did you really think I was about to lose to Verdane?

speaker: Ethlyn
text: I'd heard that Chalphy barely has any soldiers left behind, given that most of the army is away in Isaach. And let's face it, I can't remember the last time you didn't just leap straight into a crisis without thinking. With father away at war... I knew I had to come. Someone has to save you from yourself, after all.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Heh heh. Wow, it feels as if I was getting this very lecture only yesterday! I swear, after Mother passed away, it was you who single-handedly kept us in check. Once you went off to marry Quan, we could've sworn that Father finally had a proper little lady for a daughter... But no, nothing's changed at all! I feel so sorry for Quan... Ahahaha!

speaker: Ethlyn
text: Sigurd, I'm only what you and Father made me! If I'm a fusspot, then it's squarely your fault! Perhaps if the two of you hadn't been so unkempt...

speaker: Sigurd
text: Heh, perhaps you're right. Listen, Ethlyn... We might not act like it, but everything you've done means the world to us. I'm so sorry for all the trouble I've always caused you... And thank you so much for coming.

speaker: Ethlyn
text: Sigurd…

speaker: Arvis
text: It has been too long, Master Sigurd.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Lord Arvis?! Why are you-

speaker: Arvis
text: His Majesty is concerned, and he bade me to come and observe. He also entrusted me with this - a gift for you.

speaker: Sigurd
text: This is... a silver sword! A gift from His Majesty? Oh, what an honor! Lord Arvis, be sure to pass my deepest gratitude for this onto the king!

speaker: Arvis
text: Very well. Incidentally, Sigurd, rumor has it that my brother, Azelle, is among your forces. I presume this is true?

speaker: Sigurd
text: Mm, sorry about that. It sounded as if he came behind your back, but I couldn't turn him away. If at all possible, would you mind if he remained with me for a while longer?

speaker: Arvis
text: I see... So long as you keep him safe, then. He and I may have different mothers, but Azelle is still my only brother. I'd prefer if he remained by my side, but perhaps this is how it must be... I'll entrust Azelle to you, Sigurd. Be sure that he learns from this experience.

speaker: Sigurd
text: You can leave it to me, Lord Arvis. Once we're done here, I'll do what I can to convince him to go home.

speaker: Arvis
text: Good to hear it. Now, I must return to His Majesty's side in the capital. I'm entrusting this crisis to you, Sigurd.

speaker: Sigurd
text: Oh, gods... Azelle... He...

speaker: Arvis
text: He's dead isn't he?

speaker: Sigurd
text: I'm so sorry, Arvis... I couldn't do a thing to save him...

speaker: Arvis
text: Oh, Azelle... You careless fool…

speaker: Dimaggio
text: C'mon, you Grannvale cowards! Come at me! I'll crush the lot of you!

speaker: Dimaggio
text: No... This ain't right…

speaker: Gerrard
text: Go to hell, you Grannvale dogs!

speaker: Gerrard
text: Oi, wait a sec! No bows, you coward! That ain't a fair fight!

speaker: Midir
text: Oh, shut up! Let Lady Aideen go! NOW!

speaker: Gerrard
text: Ahahaha... Too bad for you... Killing me ain't gonna free your dame... Prince Gandolf's already... Urgh...

speaker: Dannan
text: Harold! Have you ferreted out the rebels yet? Or are you content to leave them unchecked for the rest of their days?! Shannan and his rebel ilk are growing stronger by the day, now they hamper us at every turn! And as if that wasn't enough, they harbor the spawn of Sigurd the Traitor! The very existence of this scum utterly defiles the authority of the Isaachian throne! How do you expect me to explain this sorry state to His Imperial Majesty?

speaker: Harold
text: A thousand apologies, Your Highness, but everything is already under control. The rebel hideout has been found, and even as we speak an army is on its way to crush them. Those vile mice have nowhere else to run! By sundown, not a single rebel will still be breathing.

speaker: Dannan
text: Hm. Very well. But be warned, Harold. Don't even think of underestimating them. Most of the rebels are too young to pose a threat, but they still have Oifey and Shannan. Those two alone are extremely dangerous. Dismissing them would be a fatal mistake.

speaker: Harold
text: Yes, sir. I'm aware. But I've already had Tirnanog, the rebel hideout, surveyed in secret, and it appears that neither are anywhere in sight. It's safe to assume them to be currently absent, sir.

speaker: Dannan
text: What?! Then why are we still talking about this? Send the order to move in on Tirnanog immediately! The people of Isaach are treating these rebels like some kind of heroes of freedom... But it's high time they learned the error of their ways! Kill them! All of them! I'll be waiting back at Rivough. I expect nothing but good news!

speaker: Scáthach
text: We have a problem, Lord Seliph! Looks like the Empire's finally caught onto our whereabouts... A brigade's set out from Ganeishire, and they seem to be headed our way!

speaker: Larcei
text: Ugh, Scáthach! Why so surprised? Did you really think our little hideout wouldn't be found out sooner or later? Let them come, I say! It only makes the battle easier for us! It's the easiest thing to just walk right over Ganeishire and pick them off as we go!

speaker: Scáthach
text: You've gotta be kidding! Prince Shannan's still off trying to find the Yied Shrine, and Oifey and the others aren't back yet. It's just us two against an entire army! Surely, even you can't think this'll end well!

speaker: Larcei
text: I don't care! You can sit here and be as scared witless as you want, but I'm not letting a chance like this pass! The prince still treats us like helpless children, but come on! We've had more than enough training! We're ready for real action!

speaker: Scáthach
text: But...

speaker: Larcei
text: I'm... I'm not gonna run away anymore! I'm sick to death of sitting here while those monsters butcher our friends! Or worse... The empire's thugs are still out there, snagging any girl they see... If Prince Shannan hadn't come for me that day, I'd be just another one of 'em: dead, or wishing I was... I won't forgive or forget their plan!

speaker: Scáthach
text: No, that's not it, Larcei... You're right, it's horrible and all, but...

speaker: Seliph
text: You're wary of engaging the enemy out of concern for my safety, aren't you Scáthach? Most likely, I presume Shannan would have given you strict orders to keep me safe. After all, if Shannan had not given such an order, you'd already be out there in the fray! To not be thirsting for a good battle just isn't the Scáthach I know.

speaker: Larcei
text: Oh... That's... That's right. Sorry, sir. I was hoping we didn't have to involve you...

speaker: Seliph
text: I'm no child anymore, either, Larcei! If you two plan to fight, then I plan to fight by your side. There's more at stake today than only the resistance. What of Tirnanog? We owe so much to its people. I refuse to abandon them at such a critical hour!

speaker: Scáthach
text: But-

speaker: Seliph
text: We've no time to waste debating this! Lana, stay behind and help the citizens. We'll engage the foe in the western gully.

speaker: Lana
text: Wait, milord! I'm coming, too!

speaker: Seliph
text: I cannot permit that, Lana! A cleric such as yourself is ill suited for such a battlefield.

speaker: Lana
text: This is my fight, too! You won't convince me any more than you could convince Larcei! Every day I think the Empire can't get any more cruel, and every day I'm proven wrong. They prey on the weak and vulnerable as if snuffing out their lives is a sport to them... I can't sit quietly and accept this! I may not be able to fight, but I've my own way of defending everyone!

speaker: Seliph
text: Hm... My apologies, Lana. You are absolutely right: the battle for Isaach's freedom rests upon all of us. Very well. We shall all go together! How this will turn out, I cannot say... But we owe it to all of Isaach to give this battle no less than our best.

speaker: Lana
text: Yes, milord! And er... Sorry. I shouldn't have spoken so brashly.

speaker: Seliph
text: Ha! You've nothing to apologize for. Now, Scáthach, Larcei, Lana... The time has come! Move out!

speaker: Oifey
text: We're too late! The battle has already begun...

speaker: Lester
text: I guess news of Tirnanog, Seliph and all that must've leaked while we were off scouting. I hope everyone's doing alright...

speaker: Dermott
text: Most of them'll be fine, Lester, but what about your sister? What if Lana's gone and gotten herself mixed up in the fighting? She can't defend herself at all if she's out in the open like this. Sir, we should hurry back. The sooner get back to Lord Seliph's side, the better.

speaker: Oifey
text: Indeed. Come, Dermott! Lester! The battlefield awaits us!

speaker: Seliph
text: By the gods! I've never seen such ruin. It's as if Ganeishire never even existed...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Been a while, hasn't it, Seliph?

speaker: Seliph
text: Hm? Oh, Lewyn! Er, pardon me... Your Majesty, King Lewyn of Silesse...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Just Lewyn, Seliph... like I've always been. Silesse is just another Imperial conquest now... That's all it's been since the mess in Belhalla. And meanwhile, here I am, still living a pathetic, shameful life for all to see. At least my mother faced Silesse's demise, and her own, with pride and dignity! But me? Nope! I'm still just an idiot bard... Don't listen to what Oifey says of me, Seliph. Just, please... don't call me a king ever again!

speaker: Seliph
text: I... My apologies, Lewyn...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Heh, it's fine. Don't worry about it. More importantly, looks like you've finally got this revolution thing started! There's no place more fitting than Isaach to start fighting back against the Empire.

speaker: Seliph
text: Indeed! The courage of Isaach's people is matched only by the pain and anger the Empire has inflicted upon them. All we're missing now is for Prince Shannan to return and join the fray himself.

speaker: Lewyn
text: He ran off to follow some rumor, didn't he?

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. Rumor has it his birthright as heir to the Isaach throne, the holy sword Balmung, is being kept in a shrine in the Aed Desert. As I understand it, the entire desert region is ruled by an evil priest. I trust Shannan's might, but I cannot help but worry for his safety...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Eh, if anyone can do it, it'll be Shannan. Actually, Seliph, I've a favor to ask of you.

speaker: Seliph
text: Oh? If it is within my power, I'll gladly help. What is it?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Julia, could you come over here?

speaker: Lewyn
text: See, I found her years ago in Belhalla when she was just a little girl, hurt pretty badly. Since then I've been looking after her in a hidden little corner of Silesse, at least until we had to get out a while back as the Empire set about tightening its grip. The thing is, I've got things that need doing over in Leonster, and at this point, she's just slowing me down.

speaker: Lewyn
text: I hate to impose on you, Seliph, but I don't have much of a choice. Could I just leave her with your group for a while? I still don't know what happened to her, but it must've been pretty awful. Poor thing. Back when I first found her, she couldn't remember a thing about what happened. It looks like she still can't...

speaker: Seliph
text: I see... Very well. You can trust me with her, Lewyn. However, I must ask that you return for her as soon as possible. She likely won't feel too comfortable in an army of strangers.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Deal. Heh, I'll probably be back here by the time you've finished freeing Isaach. Good luck, Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: May the gods be with you as well, Lewyn!

speaker: Seliph
text: Listen, Julia... I know it'll be hard for you without Lewyn here, but I promise you'll be alright. Until Lewyn returns, I swear I'll let no harm come to you... I know I've still much to learn, and as yet I'm not all that strong... But one day... Someday, I know I'll be strong enough to protect us all! Someday, I'll have the strength to defend all the world's people from the Empire's wrath! Someday I'll be strong, as my father once was...

speaker: Julia
text: Seliph…

speaker: Dannan
text: The rebels have taken over Ganeishire? Gah! Harold, you moron! What in the blazes are my sons doing? Somebody tell them to take the rebels down! Now!

speaker: Johalvier
text: Dad's ordering us to attack, huh? Isn't Larcei in that army?! Damn... What do I do? How can I fight her…

speaker: Johan
text: We're to strike Ganeisire, are we? My, my... Father's got quite the temper. But I could never lay so much as a finger on Larcei, even if she is among my foes... Ahh... What a dilemma standing before me…

speaker: Fee
text: Phew! Sorry, Mahnya! I know a load like this isn't easy on you.

speaker: Arthur
text: Hah! Mahnya? Is that really what you call your pegasus?

speaker: Fee
text: Oh, pipe down, Arthur. I don't care if we're nearly there, 'cause I'll still just dump you if you don't shut it!

speaker: Arthur
text: Er, right. Sorry about that. Say, Fee, I don't have too far to go. If you want, I can just walk from here.

speaker: Fee
text: Where are you off to, anyway?

speaker: Arthur
text: Oh, just Alster.

speaker: Fee
text: A-Alster?! Geez, you're dumber than I thought! Alster's waaay south of here. There's an entire sea in the way, for crying out loud! I dunno what you're thinking, but you haven't got a hope in heck of walking the rest of the way there!

speaker: Arthur
text: Eh, it's fine. I'm hardly in a hurry.

speaker: Fee
text: So, er, why do you need to go to Alster?

speaker: Arthur
text: Oh, see, I've got a sister I haven't seen in years who might be there. She and my mom were taken away when I was just a kid. I was sort of left alone in some far corner of Silesse or another. I just heard a rumor, but at this point even a rumor's enough if it means I might find her.

speaker: Fee
text: Huh, really? Y'know just what that's like. My big brother's been missing for ages.

speaker: Arthur
text: Did you get separated from him as well?

speaker: Fee
text: Oh no, nothing that bad. We've always lived together in Silesse, but a while back he ran off to try and find our dad.

speaker: Arthur
text: Your father, huh?

speaker: Fee
text: Yeah, he's been missing for years. Mom spent the rest of her life waiting for him to come back, but he never did...

speaker: Arthur
text: What happened to her?

speaker: Fee
text: She... She's dead. Illness...

speaker: Arthur
text: Oh, er... Sorry about that. I shouldn't have brought it up...

speaker: Fee
text: It's okay! I mean, you've already brought up lots of things that you shouldn't have. Heh, kidding. You're actually not that bad.

speaker: Arthur
text: Heh heh, thanks. And thanks for giving me a chance and letting me come along.

speaker: Fee
text: No problem! So was the sister thing real? Is that actually why you're travelling?

speaker: Arthur
text: Yeah, it's real. But what about you? What's your deal?

speaker: Fee
text: Actually, I kinda want to join that Isaachian rebel army. When I was little, mom told me stories about the paladin Sigurd and his brave allies, and those have always meant a lot to me. Lately I've been hearing about how Sigurd's son's somewhere in Isaach, raising a revolution. And it all just sort of clicked, y'know? I knew that's where I need to be, so I just ran right out of home to try and find him.

speaker: Arthur
text: Wow... That's pretty great of you. Y'know, I think I'll help you out here for a while. It's the least I can do for you putting up with me.

speaker: Fee
text: Okay! Partners it is, then! Good luck out there... partner!

speaker: Arthur
text: Heh! Upbeat as ever, aren't you?

speaker: Dannan
text: What in the blazes was that?! Just when I thought my son can't get any more useless, he goes and forgets how to fight! Schmidt! Get out there! Take back my castles, now!

speaker: Schmidt
text: Yes, sir! You can depend on me.

speaker: Old Man
text: Oh, gods bless you, Lord Seliph! Sophara is free once more, thanks to you!

speaker: Seliph
text: Is everyone unharmed, sir?

speaker: Old Man
text: Indeed, and overjoyed to see you to boot!

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank you. I swear to you, before this day is done, King Dannan will be no more and Isaach shall belong to its rightful people!

speaker: Old Man
text: Freedom... Oh, the word is tonic to my ears! Please, take care of yourself out there. Lord Seliph, you are the last and greatest hope for the future of this world and all its people. Only you, Lord Seliph, possess the power to free this world from the grip of darkness…

speaker: Old Man
text: Ohh! Lord Seliph, sir! Glad to see you're okay!

speaker: Seliph
text: Is everyone unharmed, sir?

speaker: Old Man
text: Indeed, and ecstatic to see you to boot! Thanks to you, Lord Seliph, we know that at long last, Isaach shall have its freedom!

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank you, sir, but the effort isn't mine alone. I could never have come so far without the support of the common man. You've all supported me from the beginning. I likely wouldn't be here if not for you!

speaker: Old Man
text: Fate is a funny thing, isn't it, sir? Just twenty years ago, our late king had the utmost trust in your grandfather's wisdom. Then your father came to protect Prince Shannan, and now the prince has guided you to adulthood. Perhaps fate has bound Isaach and Chalphy as one...

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. Isaach is the only home I've ever known, and Prince Shannan is like a brother to me. I pray our friendship lasts the rest of our lives.

speaker: Old Man
text: Lord Seliph, you are the rightful heir to House Belhalla and the throne of Grannvale. Not a soul alive in Isaach, nor in the rest of the world, can doubt this. We beg of you! Raise the banner of justice high, march on Belhalla and reclaim your true throne!

speaker: Fighter
text: Lord Johalvier has some weird tastes. Lusting after such a fierce broad? Really? Heh... I prefer my women a little more... Wait, why am I telling you this?!

speaker: Axe Knight
text: Ugh... I don't get Lord Johan. He bends over backwards to please every last bit of skirt, yet here he's so bloody harsh on us!

speaker: Johan
text: Is that a morsel of gossip I hear, soldier?

speaker: Axe Knight
text: N-no, sir! Nothing to report here, sir!

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia?! You’re safe! Oh, thank heavens…

speaker: Julia
text: Mm… The enemy seized and imprisoned me here, but I knew… I knew you would rescue me, no matter what.

speaker: Lewyn
text: A job well done, Seliph! Thanks to you, Isaach is free from the Empire's grip.

speaker: Seliph
text: Lewyn? Are you already finished in Leonster?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah... I only just got back now. Look, Seliph. Are you aware that right now, this world's at a critical turning point?

speaker: Seliph
text: Hm? No... I'm afraid not.

speaker: Lewyn
text: It's been fifteen years since Arvis conquered all of Jugdral and united it as the Grannvale Empire. Honestly, for a while at first it wasn't all that bad. In the empire's dawn, Emperor Arvis sought to bind his nation using only the strictures of law. Sure, it was strict and constraining, but we still got a good few years of peace out of it. But obviously he changed his mind. A few years back, as if by magic, the Empire turned into that oppressive force we all know and love today. Even worse... the ancient heretics of the Loptr Church have arisen from the shadows once more and raised influence across the land. Their murderous rituals have returned with them, and all across Jugdral they abduct children to sacrifice in droves to resurrect their fell god. All attempts to resist the Empire are crushed and met with brutal executions or enslavement. It couldn't be plainer that they seek to return Jugdral to the days of brutal control by that ancient abomination, the Loptyrian Empire.

speaker: Seliph
text: This cannot be happening! I've heard all the rumors saying the same, but... Never did I think they could be more than rumors…

speaker: Lewyn
text: By the look of it, Isaach hasn't had it quite as bad as most. Dannan's two sons, at least, refused to follow through on the child hunts.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Of course, there's always been people trying to rebel against the Empire left, right and center, but they were all scattered and disorganized. Before you, none have ever posed a proper threat to the Empire. They were all swiftly crushed before they could so much as blink. Jugdral desperately needs a savior. It needs a man to unite behind in the name of liberty. And I'm pretty sure that man is you, Seliph. You're the only one who stands a chance.

speaker: Seliph
text: Hold on a moment! Are you sure of this? A savior would require power I sorely lack…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Chalk it up to duty, Seliph. You're the eldest child of Empress Deirdre... That makes you the elder brother to the crown prince Julius. You're the one true heir to Saint Heim. Your destiny is to unite the power of the Crusaders of this era and free the world from this evil grip.

speaker: Seliph
text: But…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Trust me, you really do have what it takes. Your true power and potential sleeps within you: that is, the sacred blood of the Crusader Baldr. Once you get your holy blade, Tyrfing, not even the heavens will be able to stand in your way!

speaker: Seliph
text: But I-

speaker: Lewyn
text: Sorry, Seliph, but that's how the gods will it. You're Sigurd's son: The son of a man who fate led to a brutal end. The fulfillment of his dying wishes and his final quest falls to you. You can't afford to go doubting yourself now. You understand, Seliph?

speaker: Seliph
text: Y-yes... Yes, I do. If this is fate and the will of the gods, then so be it. I will do my duty.

speaker: Lewyn
text: There actually isn't a single absolute fate, nor is there just one person it all hinges upon. As obtuse as that sounds, trust me, one day it'll make sense. Sigurd left behind so much to help you on your quest. Most importantly, the many friendships he forged in his life... Me, for instance. Brave youths from all over are already lining up to join your cause, all guided by Sigurd's kindness.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. My father won the love and trust of so many people, from all walks of life. I can only pray that in time I'll prove my worthiness to his legacy.

speaker: Lewyn
text: You'll be fine. Anyway, to business. Our immediate goal now is to reach Leonster. The son of Quan, your father's closest friend, raised his own rebellion only to suffer severe losses. He's in pretty urgent need of backup. I know you've had no time to rest, but we need to get going as soon as possible. For now, at least, we can leave Isaach in the care of its citizens. Odds are we'll run into Prince Shannan on our way.

speaker: Seliph
text: Understood!

speaker: Old Man
text: King Dannan's got three sons. The oldest, Brian, lives at the old family home in Grannvale. The younger two serve him here in Isaach. Johan controls Isaach Castle, while Johalvier controls Sophara Castle. They're both kind of an odd sort, and they've both got this obsession with someone in your army called Larcei. Always squabbling, they are... I dunno, though. Neither of them are all that bad, really. Heck, I bet they'd want to join forces with you!

speaker: Young Man
text: Prince Shannan is our beacon of hope for Isaach's future. Once he returns with his divine blade, Balmung, in hand... Well, those imperial sods won't stand a chance at all! Every last one of them will be run right out of our great land!

speaker: Man
text: Every last citizen of Isaach believes in and trusts Lord Seliph! We owe his family dearly for how his father, long ago, rescued and helped raise our Prince Shannan!

speaker: Young Woman
text: Y'know the liberation army's leader, Seliph? They say he's the rightful heir to Grannvale. I bet we'd all have a much better time with him on the throne if that were true, huh! Here, take this here skill ring. Go on, do your best! We're all behind you!

speaker: Young Man
text: Ooh, aren't ya from that liberator's army? Glad ta’ see yer makin' a stand now! This is great news! With y'all around, we've finally got a shot at makin' them imperial cowards run outta here with their tails between their legs!

speaker: Old Man
text: Ohhh! If it isn't Lord Seliph himself! We can't thank you enough for all your help! Here, allow me to give you my granddaughter's hand in marriage. We raised her as well as well can be, and she's the kindest, sweetest little thing! Oh, I remember that even as a kid she-

speaker: Young Woman
text: Grandpa, knock it off! Ugh, this is so embarrassing! ...I'm sorry, Lord Seliph. I wouldn't wish seeing that sorry display upon anyone! But, er... if you do like me, milord...

speaker: Seliph
text: Er... Wait a moment... That isn't why I'm here...

speaker: Young Woman
text: Ahahahaha! C'mon, Lord Seliph! It's just a joke! A j-o-k-e! Look, you've gone bright red! How adorable!

speaker: Seliph
text: Er...

speaker: Old Man
text: I'm completely serious, though.

speaker: Seliph
text: Oh. Oh, dear…

speaker: Young Woman
text: I've been hearing a lot about how the Empire's been hunting kids in all those other countries... Thanks to you lot, Isaach's free from the Empire at last, but the rest of the world's still in a really dark place... All across Jugdral, they're all waiting for Lord Seliph to rise up and defeat the Empire! Please, I'm begging you... You've gotta make it to Grannvale soon!

speaker: Scáthach
text: You holding up okay so far, Larcei?

speaker: Larcei
text: Yeah, I'm getting by fine...

speaker: Scáthach
text: Just be careful out here, okay? Your usual brazen antics'll only get you in trouble now.

speaker: Larcei
text: I know, I know, I know! What, do you think I'm still a child?

speaker: Scáthach
text: Heh... Man, that iron will of yours! Guess you're just like Mom was, if what Prince Shannan's told us is true.

speaker: Larcei
text: Yeah... Ayra... I can't remember a thing about her. You?

speaker: Scáthach
text: No, of course not. We're twins, remember? If you were too young to remember, then so was I! We weren't even two years old yet back then... It was Oifey who took us with him when he fled to Isaach with Seliph. We waited and waited, but Mom never followed... I guess she didn't make it out of the Battle of Belhalla alive...

speaker: Larcei
text: Scáthach! You swore you'd never say awful things like that! Mom is alive! ALIVE! I'm sure of it! Don't you dare say otherwise ever again!

speaker: Scáthach
text: ...Er, sorry, Larcei... You're right... I'm sorry.

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: You holding up okay so far, Radney?

speaker: Radney
text: Yeah, I’m getting by fine…

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Just be careful out here, okay? Your usual brazen antics’ll only get you in trouble now.

speaker: Radney
text: I know, I know, I know! What, do you think I’m still a child?

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: So, er… How about Johan and Johalvier, then? I just don’t get either of ‘em.

speaker: Radney
text: Ugh… Them! They’re driving me mad! Creeps like them are why men are the absolute worst! They make me feel sick!

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Hey, easy there! Not all men are like that. You’ve let the imperial soldiers’ treatment of you make you hate all mean for no reason.

speaker: Radney
text: Wow, you don’t say! I know it’s irrational, but for crying out loud, just being near a man’s enough to turn my stomach now.

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Every man?

speaker: Radney
text: Er, I guess you and Lord Seliph are okay.

speaker: Rodolbahn
text: Heh heh… what about Shannan, then?

speaker: Radney
text: Ugh, Rodolbahn!

speaker: Lester
text: Lana?! Don't tell me you're fighting, too!

speaker: Lana
text: I am, Lester. I simply couldn't bear to leave Lord Seliph to fight alone...

speaker: Lester
text: Why am I not surprised... Look, I know I can't get you to leave, but just be careful, okay? It'd break Mother's heart if something happened to you out here.

speaker: Lana
text: I know, but actually, there was something Mother told me... She told me that we owe the greatest of debts to the people of Isaach, and that if we can help them in any way, we owe it to them to do all we can.

speaker: Lester
text: Yeah, I guess she's right. I mean, we wouldn't even be here now if not for the help of the locals... ...So, er, where is Mother, anyway?

speaker: Lana
text: She's back in Tirnanog's abbey, working like always.

speaker: Lester
text: Right... Listen, Lana. We've got to give this battle our all, both in Mother's name and in the name of our lost father... Someday, I know, we'll finally be able to help Mother return to her home, Jungby...

speaker: Lana
text: You're right, Lester.

speaker: Dimna
text: Mana?! Don't tell me you're fighting, too!

speaker: Mana
text: I am, Dimna. I simply couldn't bear to leave Lord Seliph to fight alone…

speaker: Dimna
text: Heh… Why am I not surprised…

speaker: Mana
text: W-what do you mean?

speaker: Dimna
text: Oh, nothing… Just, er, don’t get too invested in him. You know Lord Seliph’s a Grannvale prince, right? He’s as lofty a noble as they come. Let’s face it, peasants like us’d ordinarily have no business being anywhere near him. I just don’t want to see you get hurt…

speaker: Mana
text: You… You’ve got the wrong idea, Dimna! All I want is to protect Lord Seliph and to make sure he survives this war, okay?

speaker: Dimna
text: Oh, er, that’s fine then. Sorry, Mana. I’m just really concerned for you…

speaker: Mana
text: Yes, I know… Thank you, Dimna.

speaker: Oifey
text: Oh, thank the gods, sire! You're safe!

speaker: Seliph
text: Oifey! Glad to see you made it back. What news of the rest of the world?

speaker: Oifey
text: The Empire's grip is tightening still further, as if trying to choke life from the people. It's inciting doomed revolts all across Jugdral.

speaker: Seliph
text: So it's as I thought... It isn't as if the Empire's tyranny would ever be limited to only Isaach... Oifey, is it feasible to assist them?

speaker: Oifey
text: Not as we presently stand, sire. We still lack the strength to properly challenge the Empire.

speaker: Seliph
text: Then what of our present battle? The war for Isaach's freedom has already begun. Turning back now would be impossible...

speaker: Oifey
text: Mm. There's certainly no chance of returning you to hiding, sire, now that your whereabouts have been leaked. Starting the fight now was reckless, but we've no choice but to continue...

speaker: Seliph
text: Oifey, I'm sorry I let all of this happen behind your back, but we had no choice. Even so, I don't think I could have stood letting Isaach suffer under Dannan's thumb any longer. I trust you understand Oifey...

speaker: Oifey
text: I do, sire. Now, our priority is to lay siege to Dannan's capital, Rivough, with all due haste. Dannan must fall before the Empire can send him reinforcements. We cannot afford to wait!

speaker: Lana
text: Julia, right? Hello there! Are you doing okay without Lewyn?

speaker: Julia
text: You're Lana... Yes, thank you. I'm fine...

speaker: Lana
text: You know, Lord Seliph's actually really been worrying about you. If there's anything I can do to help you, just let me know and I'll get right on it.

speaker: Julia
text: Mm. Thank you...

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, and I've got a little something for you.

speaker: Julia
text: This is... A Mend staff?

speaker: Lana
text: You can use these, right?

speaker: Julia
text: For me? Thank you, Lana. With this... I know I can help everyone.

speaker: Lana
text: You're welcome, Julia. Let's give this war our all, together!

speaker: Johalvier
text: Larcei! Heh... I guess you finally realized you want to see me, am I right?

speaker: Larcei
text: Look, Johalvier, I know you try to act like you're cool, tough and uncaring, but I know you're not all that bad. I mean, you've made a point of keeping your hands off the innocent all along. I guess I'd rather avoid fighting you, if I can...

speaker: Johalvier
text: Yeah, I guess... Pushing people around never really sat right with me, y'know? Not like my brothers. And I'm getting real sick of the Loptyrian Order running the show here. All round Isaach they've been stealing kids and, so I hear, killing 'em all as sacrifices! Dad doesn't even so much as ask 'em nicely to stop! I've had it with 'em! Larcei, my men and I want to join your army. Just say the word and we're yours, yeah?

speaker: Larcei
text: Wha- ...Are you serious? Johalvier, this is... Thanks so much! Er, I guess I was wrong to doubt you for all these years. Sorry.

speaker: Johalvier
text: Look, I'm no saint. Way I see it, at least now I can atone for everything I've done. Listen up, men! We're with the liberation army now! We're fightin' in the name of love and justice!

speaker: Johan
text: What manner of nonsense is this? ...Alas, for Johalvier has turned his cloak for the rebels! Oh, how his claim to Larcei pierces my heart! Men, turn your blades on love's foul traitor!

speaker: Johan
text: Oh, Larcei... How the twin hands of love and fate guide us! I've yearned for this day for many, many years, my beloved!

speaker: Larcei
text: Johan?! Oh, for the love of... There's a stomach flu playing with your head, isn't there?

speaker: Johan
text: Larcei... Oh, Larcei! Your words are as the sweetest birdsong! Your eyes are as the most brilliant stars! Oh, without you at my side, what purpose is there in life? What joy could possibly be?

speaker: Larcei
text: Stop it! How revolting! This is a battlefield! Are you out of your right mind?!

speaker: Johan
text: I can deny my heart no longer, Larcei. Believe me when I say I've tried! Alas, love is a maddening beast at times... What else can I do but be at your side? Men, we are joining the liberation army! From this day on, we are men of honor! Fight on, in the name of justice, love, and Larcei!

speaker: Johalvier
text: You've gotta be kidding! Johan beat me to Larcei?! Bet he's gone and sided with her army, too, the weak-willed fool... Hmph... fine by me! Men, attack! Johan's unit is now the enemy!

speaker: Fee
text: Hey there! You're Lord Seliph, right?

speaker: Seliph
text: Indeed I am. And you, miss?

speaker: Fee
text: Call me Fee! I'm from Silesse.

speaker: Seliph
text: Silesse, you say? Are you a pegasus knight, then?

speaker: Fee
text: Er, not just yet. I'm kinda still in training. My mom was one, though! Actually, in that big war years ago, she helped Lord Sigurd out in his army.

speaker: Seliph
text: Is that so? She has my utmost gratitude, on my father's behalf. Now, what brings you here, Fee?

speaker: Fee
text: See, what happened was I was looking for my brother, who ran away ages ago. But then I heard about you, sir, and how you're taking on the Empire yourself! And I just knew I had to be here too. Can I join your army, sir? Please?

speaker: Seliph
text: Certainly! Thank you. What of your brother, though?

speaker: Fee
text: It's silly, sir, but I have this feeling that we're gonna run into him somewhere down the line…

speaker: Femina
text: Hey there! You're Lord Seliph, right?

speaker: Seliph
text: Indeed I am. And you, miss?

speaker: Femina
text: Call me Femina! I'm from Silesse.

speaker: Seliph
text: Silesse, you say? Are you a pegasus knight, then?

speaker: Femina
text: Yeah! Er, actually, I’m just a rookie though.

speaker: Seliph
text: Is that so… So, what brings you to Isaach?

speaker: Femina
text: See, what happened was I was looking for my brother, who ran away ages ago. But then I heard about you, sir, and how you're taking on the Empire yourself! And I just knew I had to be here too. Can I join your army, sir? Please?

speaker: Seliph
text: Certainly! Thank you. What of your brother, though?

speaker: Femina
text: It's silly, sir, but I have this feeling that we're gonna run into him somewhere down the line…

speaker: Arthur
text: Lord Seliph, right? Nice to meet you.

speaker: Seliph
text: Who are you?

speaker: Arthur
text: The name's Arthur. I came here from Silesse.

speaker: Seliph
text: Wait, so you are that Arthur fellow? I've heard of how you have been aiding us so far. Thank you so much!

speaker: Arthur
text: Eh, it was no big deal.

speaker: Seliph
text: You are capable of wielding magic, yes? That's truly impressive. I'm almost envious!

speaker: Arthur
text: My mother was a talented war-mage... But I've still got a lot to learn myself.

speaker: Seliph
text: We all do, do we not? So long as we all fight together, though, perhaps we still truly can change our world. After all, that's what brought us here today.

speaker: Arthur
text: Yeah, you're right... My power's at your disposal, sir. I'll give my all to aid the cause. I'm glad we could finally meet, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Radney
text: Hey, knock it off! I don’t want you hovering around me like a lost pup! It’s irritating!

speaker: Johalvier
text: Oh, uh… I just thought I should protect you…

speaker: Radney
text: Argh…

speaker: Radney
text: Hey, knock it off! I don’t want you hovering around me like a lost pup! It’s irritating!

speaker: Johan
text: Oh, what heartless barbs escape your lips! Must you truly so callously reject this, the purest form of my deepest love? I am yours, Radney, body and soul! Never shall my vigilant guard abandon your side!

speaker: Radney
text: Argh…

speaker: Seliph
text: Lana, I still can't say I feel comfortable having you out here in the field. It's much too dangerous.

speaker: Lana
text: Y-yes, milord, but I'm sure I'll be fine.

speaker: Seliph
text: Please, take the utmost care! If you stray from behind the front lines, you'll be too vulnerable a target.

speaker: Lana
text: But-

speaker: Seliph
text: Lana, please... I'm worried for your sake.

speaker: Lana
text: ...Okay, milord.

speaker: Seliph
text: Are you faring alright so far, Julia?

speaker: Julia
text: Mm. Thank you, Lord Seliph…

speaker: Seliph
text: Actually, I have something for you. I found this in Sophara Castle.

speaker: Julia
text: What is...?

speaker: Seliph
text: It's a light tome called Aura. You can wield these, yes?

speaker: Julia
text: Aura... This... Why does this sound familiar… Thank you, Lord Seliph. Thank you so much…

speaker: Seliph
text: Actually, I have something for you. I found this in Isaach Castle.

speaker: Julia
text: What is...?

speaker: Seliph
text: It's a light tome called Nosferatu. You can wield these, yes?

speaker: Julia
text: Yes, I believe so...

speaker: Seliph
text: Excellent! Hopefully you'll now have an easier time protecting yourself in combat.

speaker: Julia
text: Thank you, Lord Seliph. Thank you so much…

speaker: Corinne
text: Hm? Aren’t you Dimna? ...You are! Dimna, it is you!

speaker: Dimna
text: What? Corinne! Been a while, hasn’t it?

speaker: Corinne
text: A really long while, huh! I’ve lost count on how many years it’s been since you and Mana said farewell to the city… It’s great to see you’re looking so good!

speaker: Dimna
text: Yeah. You’ve heard of Lord Seliph’s work to rebel against the empire’s tyranny, right? Well, I’ve actually been fighting in his army. Even if I’m hardly of much help to them…

speaker: Corinne
text: Heh… That’s amazing, though! Who knew that the little crybaby would someday become a revolutionary hero…

speaker: Dimna
text: Heh heh. But would you mind keeping the crybaby part quiet? …I’ve still a long way to go to become strong. Strong enough that you and the entire world can finally live in peace!

speaker: Corinne
text: Right… I hope you can…

speaker: Dimna
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Corinne
text: Oh, er, it’s nothing… Here, I want you to have this. I’m sure it’ll help you.

speaker: Dimna
text: Huh?

speaker: Corinne
text: This necklace is all I’ve got left of Mom. It makes you stronger when you wear it.

speaker: Dimna
text: I can’t take something like that from you!

speaker: Corinne
text: No, take it! I’m sure it’d make Mom happy for someone like you to finally put its power to good use. ...Please, Dimna.

speaker: Dimna
text: ...Okay. Thanks, Corinne. Don’t worry. I’ll make sure you get it back as soon as this war ends. I promise.

speaker: Corinne
text: Heh, good ‘ol Dimna. That’s just like you…

speaker: Dimna
text: Well, I guess I’ve gotta get back out there. Take care, Corinne!

speaker: Corinne
text: You too, Dimna!

speaker: Corinne
text: Dimna…

speaker: Harold
text: Guh... No, calm down. They're nothing more than petty rebels!

speaker: Harold
text: Oof! How... How could I fall to... a few motley soldiers...?

speaker: Johalvier
text: You'll never take my castle from me, rebels! I'll beat the daylight right outta you!

speaker: Johalvier
text: Urgh... I'm sorry, Larcei…

speaker: Johan
text: Ohoho... What courage, to dare to challenge Johan the Invincible! What honor, to be granted death on my blade!

speaker: Johan
text: Ahh... And so I fall, even to rebels such as these... Larcei... Oh, Larcei... Our love shall endure, even beyond the grave…

speaker: Johalvier
text: Larcei? Wh-what're you doing?! I can't fight you! I won't!

speaker: Johan
text: St-stay your hand, Larcei! Never could I turn my blade on you!

speaker: Johan
text: Sigh... Ah, Johalvier... To think my very own flesh and blood could be so dense...

speaker: Johalvier
text: Dense? Hah! Look who's talking! ...Oh well. This was a long time coming, huh? Let's settle this once and for all!

speaker: Johan
text: As you will, my brother!

speaker: Dannan
text: Pitiful rebel fools... Don't you dare underestimate the glory of the Grannvale Empire!

speaker: Dannan
text: Urgh... Lord Arvis... my liege…

speaker: Dannan
text: I-it's you! The spawn of Sigurd! Blast... My father will be avenged!

speaker: Seliph
text: King Dannan... You've tortured this land, and brought misery and death, for too long. Today, you shall face justice!

speaker: Dannan
text: Johalvier! What do you think you're doing? You would betray your very own flesh and blood?!

speaker: Johalvier
text: Yeah, sorry 'bout that, Dad. I just don't care about helping you do this land wrong anymore. Don't take it personally.

speaker: Dannan
text: Blast... Johalvier!!

speaker: Dannan
text: Johan... Curse you! You've let yourself be deceived by that she-witch!

speaker: Johan
text: Ah, if it were that simple... I live my life now in love's name! Forgive me, Father...

speaker: Dannan
text: Y-you useless little…

speaker: Schmidt
text: Hold, rebel scum! King Dannan has decreed that you shall go no further!

speaker: Schmidt
text: King Dannan... my lord... Forgive me!

speaker: Julius
text: Father died, you say...

speaker: Manfroy
text: The Emperor had long served his purpose, Your Majesty. He was little more than an obstacle to your ambitions. He had to die.

speaker: Julius
text: Pfeh. I almost feel sorry for him. All his life he was your tool, Manfroy, only to be thrown away so casually...

speaker: Manfroy
text: All in your empire's name, Your Majesty. Arvis was a lost cause. To think he, a man of Loptous's blood, dared to challenge the revival of the empire! The righteous heart of the crusader Vala burned too fiercely within him. It was only a matter of time until he turned on you.

speaker: Julius
text: I know, I know... Now, then. I hear those rebels have stumbled as far as Chalphy. Are our defenses really that pathetic?

speaker: Manfroy
text: Rest assured. I've already tasked Edda's Bishop Rodan and Brian of Dozel with purging Chalphy of those vermin. You've no need to worry, Your Majesty.

speaker: Julius
text: Don't I, now... Where's Julia?

speaker: Manfroy
text: She awaits her end in the dungeon... You there! Bring us Princess Julia!

speaker: Julius
text: Ah, Julia. It's been a while, hasn't it? Tell me, do you know who I am?

speaker: Julia
text: Julius... My brother, Julius...

speaker: Julius
text: Oho! So you do still remember! I can hardly believe seven long years have passed since you slipped away.

speaker: Julia
text: I... That night is seared into my memory, clear as if it were only yesterday...

speaker: Julius
text: Fehehe... Good. I trust you remember your mother's final kindness as well?

speaker: Julia
text: Who... No, what are you? That night... The night Manfroy came with that eerie black tome... Nothing was ever the same again. My real brother, the kind and caring boy I once knew and loved so, died that night. In his place stood a demon of terrifying power... My brother in name only. You... You monster... You've taken my mother and my brother from me! Who are you? WHAT are you? Why... Why must you torment us all so?!

speaker: Julius
text: I am the heir of Loptous's kin, and the inheritor of his limitless power. This world belongs rightfully to me. And you, Julia? You are the heiress to the power of Naga, my eternal foe. I cannot allow you to live any longer!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Hold a moment, Your Majesty. I believe I have a use for this girl's power. If I may, spare her and leave her to me.

speaker: Julius
text: Using Naga's power to serve me? Interesting... Very interesting. Very well! I must return to Belhalla. Julia is yours, Manfroy. But be warned. Be extremely careful! Even a single mistake with her could cost me dearly.

speaker: Rodan
text: His Majesty has issued his command. Priest and sellsword units! Defend Edda itself with your very lives! Cavalry unit, move in on Chalphy! Reclaim our land from the rebels!

speaker: Lewyn
text: This is it, Seliph. The final holy war begins now.

speaker: Seliph
text: A holy war?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah, that's what this is. Julius is descended from Loptyrian royalty, and he's been working to revive the dark empire. No matter what it takes, we must stop him.

speaker: Seliph
text: It feels as if you know everything, Lewyn. I'm beginning to feel left out... Please, what in the world are you talking about?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah, sorry about that, Seliph. I know there's a lot I've not been telling you. I've spent over a decade on a journey to figure out the truth behind all this, and I'm finally onto a hidden bigger picture here.

speaker: Seliph
text: ...The bigger picture?

speaker: Lewyn
text: It seems the old Loptyrian Empire's founder, the Bishop Galle, dedicated his youth to a world-exploring voyage across the seas. He desired nothing less than to drink the blood of a legendary beast. Even a single drop, he believed, would bestow upon any human limitless power.

speaker: Seliph
text: Do... do you mean the dragonkin of old? It couldn't be... Is that not a myth?

speaker: Lewyn
text: You'd think so, but... When Galle returned to Jugdral, he bore bizarre powers nobody else understood. With these powers, he set to work swaying youths across the land to aid his ambitions. Before anyone else realized, he'd raised a fell legion unflinchingly loyal to his cause.

speaker: Seliph
text: Where, then, does Loptous enter the tale?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Odds are Loptous was a dragon himself. Every last one of Galle's heirs has borne the blood of the dragonkin. The dark powers Loptous's kin command are nothing more than the dragonkin's powers.

speaker: Seliph
text: And what of the Crusaders?

speaker: Lewyn
text: I'm sure you know how the legend goes. The gods descended upon twelve warriors of the old liberators at the fortress of Darna. But...

speaker: Seliph
text: But?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Sorry, Seliph, but this'll have to wait. The enemy's just about on our doorstep.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Edda, huh... Father Claude would be so happy to know his homeland is finally free...

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm... Father Claude gave his life for my father's cause. But his children…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Oh, of course. Claude's son and Claude’s daughter. They're going to be great rulers for Edda. And after all they've been through, I know that'll bring a smile to the people's faces.

speaker: Brian
text: It's time, Fisher. Your unit will move in on Edda at once! I'll lead the assault on Chalphy personally. Against the full force of Dozel's legendary axe knights, the Grau Ritter, the rebels stand no chance! They'll drop like leaves!

speaker: Fisher
text: At once, milord!

speaker: Lewyn
text: What a bloody disgrace... How could a pack of idiots like House Dozel be of Crusader heritage? If it weren't for Langbalt, the world wouldn't be in such a mess…

speaker: Seliph
text: Lewyn, I cannot wait much longer. Just where did the Crusaders' power come from? What in the world are these gods?

speaker: Lewyn
text: I can't say for sure... But whatever they were, they realized that our land's misery was caused by the power of the dragonkin. And so they came to Jugdral from some other world to save the human race. It was they who suddenly appeared at Darna, just as its doom seemed certain.

speaker: Seliph
text: That would be the legendary descent of Naga and the eleven gods found in scripture, yes?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah. They say the gods took human shapes. Naga, the light god, appeared as a little girl, while the fire god Salamand was an old man. With twelve chosen warriors, the gods bound themselves in a blood covenant.

speaker: Seliph
text: A blood covenant?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Basically, the gods drew their own blood with a scratch to the fingertip and presented it to the warriors.

speaker: Seliph
text: ...I beg your pardon?!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Long story short, they were dragons. The gods we know only from scripture? They were all of the dragonkin, just like Loptous. With a single taste of the blood of dragons, these once humble warriors of the liberation army were reborn as the Twelve Crusaders. Each dragon presented to their crusader a weapon steeped in their own power. And then, with some final parting words of wisdom to the Crusaders, the dragonkin departed Jugdral.

speaker: Seliph
text: I see... So our power is, in truth, that of dragons…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Now, Loptous himself is actually from a dragon clan whose fell power is amongst the mightiest of all dragonkin. The great dragon Naga, strongest of them all, bestowed their own blood upon the leader of the liberation army, the priest Heim. Naga knew only their power could possibly hope to stand against that of Loptous.

speaker: Seliph
text: So nobody else among the dragonkin would be able to prevail against Loptous?

speaker: Lewyn
text: It certainly wouldn't be easy, I think. Even if you had every last dragon fighting together, they'd still need Naga's power. This, of course, means that if we're to win today, we'll need the surviving heir to Saint Heim. In other words, one of Deirdre's three children. Of those three, you didn't inherit the full breadth of Naga's blood, and it's pretty obvious that Julius didn't. Actually, I only recently learned who it is. The inheritor of Naga's power is Julius' twin sister... Princess Julia.

speaker: Seliph
text: E-excuse me?!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah, that was more or less my reaction too at first. Julia is Julius' twin sister... which also makes her your sister, Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: So all this time... Julia was my sister…

speaker: Lewyn
text: I guess now we know why Manfroy took her to begin with. Needless to say, Seliph, we've got to rescue her, no matter what. We absolutely need Julia's powers if we want any hope of stopping Julius!

speaker: Hilda
text: Dozel's fallen to the rebels? What the hell were my men doing out there?! Feh, why'd I ever expect any better? Worthless cowards, the lot of them! It's time I took this into my own hands. All I need is to lure these flies into my web. Then I can crush them, once and for all! Send Scorpius of Jungby a messenger! Pass on to him this plan. The Gelb Ritter will coax the rebels our way, leaving them wide open to a deluge of the Beige Ritter's arrows from behind! They'll have nowhere to run or hide. Kill them all! No survivors this time!

speaker: Scopius
text: Heh, the rebels marched right into the trap. All too easy. Men, cut through the forest and swarm them from the rear! With Freege at their front, we'll choke them like a snake on a rat!

speaker: Seliph
text: Freege is ours, Lewyn. We've finally made it this far. But... I can't help but wonder... Are the children at Belhalla still unharmed? I pray they are...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Funny you should say that! We've got a visitor who's got a bit of news on that front, Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: And who are you?

speaker: Felipe
text: My name is Felipe, sire. I was once an aide to the late Emperor Arvis. On secret orders from His Majesty, the abducted children were moved here to Freege for safe-keeping.

speaker: Seliph
text: What? Is this true? You've saved all of the children?!

speaker: Felipe
text: Rest easy, sire. They're all hiding in the city's abbey, and they're all in good health.

speaker: Seliph
text: And all under Hilda's nose, at that! That you've kept every last child safe in Hilda's own city... Color me impressed.

speaker: Felipe
text: Actually, sire... Princess Ishtar deserves your thanks. Without her generous aid given in secret, we could never have done this. No Imperial soldiers dared come even close to the abbey, on pain of the princess' wrath.

speaker: Seliph
text: Princess Ishtar?! But why... Why would she-

speaker: Felipe
text: Few people in this land are as kind and caring as Princess Ishtar. All along, the princess has toiled behind the scenes to aid our cause. It was Princess Ishtar herself who ensured that every last child escaped from the bowels of Belhalla.

speaker: Seliph
text: I see... At any rate, thank the gods for their safety. I'm certain everyone will be glad to know the children are in good hands. You have my deepest thanks, Lord Felipe.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Well, Seliph, that's one job done. Good to see we're finally getting some results out of this mess.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. And yet, Julia still eludes us... Where could she possibly be?

speaker: Lewyn
text: The only options left now are Belhalla and Velthomer. It's got to be one of those two.

speaker: Seliph
text: And Belhalla is where Julius awaits...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah, we'll have to find Julia first if we want to go anywhere near Belhalla. Without Julia's power on our side, we won't have a hope in hell against Julius.

speaker: Seliph
text: But no matter what's happened, Julius is still her brother. Will she even want to fight him...

speaker: Lewyn
text: ...You'll have to convince her.

speaker: Ishtar
text: If I may, Lord Julius, I'd like to lead the Weissritter to bolster the capital's defense. This will require that I leave your side, even for a while. I beg your forgiveness.

speaker: Julius
text: Feh. Why the rush to get out there so suddenly, Ishtar? All the soldiers they could ever throw at us could never so much as scratch me. Why even bother with those maggots?

speaker: Ishtar
text: Yes, I know... But for me, there is no greater pride than being one of Friege's great mages. My parents and brother lie dead, and I cannot stand to leave their murderers to run amok... Please... All I ask is a chance for vengeance.

speaker: Julius
text: It sounds as if what you really want is to join your family in death on a rebel's blade! Are you so desperate to escape me, Ishtar?

speaker: Ishtar
text: No... Nothing like that, Lord Julius. I love you. Nothing will ever change that.

speaker: Julius
text: Hmhmhmhmhm... I know. Very well! Fight if you must. I won't stop you.

speaker: Ishtar
text: Thank you... Now, I beg your pardon. Meng! Bleg! Mabel! We sortie at once!

speaker: Meng
text: Yes, milady.

speaker: Julius
text: Now, then. I think it's time we put an end to this sorry show. Deadlords, move out! And someone order Arion's unit to attack! The time for games is over. Every last rebel dies, here and now!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Heh heh... The rebels have come to play at last, I hear. Julia, why don't you join them? Purge all those who dare oppose the Empire!

speaker: Julia
text: YES... MY LORD... YOUR EXCELLENCY…

speaker: Arion
text: We have no home to return to, men... But we must keep going nonetheless. Chalphy's fall to our blades shall be the first step to winning back our fatherland. Now, move in! Show these liberators one final defiance from the wyvern knights of Thracia!

speaker: Seliph
text: Are we quite certain the Book of Naga is in fact hidden in Velthomer, Lewyn?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yep. All the evidence we have points to Arvis taking it from Belhalla and keeping it hidden here. That's right, isn't it, Felipe?

speaker: Felipe
text: Indeed, sir. It should still lie in the treasury. That said, it is likely sealed in a locked case.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Huh. Any idea where its key is?

speaker: Felipe
text: My liege concealed the key within his most treasured memento... The circlet once worn by Empress Deirdre. If we can find that circlet, sir, then the Book of Naga is yours.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Deirdre's circlet, huh…

speaker: Old Man
text: Oh, heirs to the courageous! Hear my ode to the crusaders of old.

speaker: Old Man
text: Hear me, brave heirs to the crusaders! In your hands lies the task of proving this war to be a holy war of its own. If wisdom, courage and power be your allies, summon them now and give all you have, should you wish to prevail this day. Trust in yourselves to bring forth our destiny, one born where the two trails of light meet!

speaker: Arthur
text: This is it, Tine. We're getting awfully close to Freege... Mother's old home.

speaker: Tine
text: Mm, but... I have a bad feeling about this. How about you?

speaker: Arthur
text: Yes, I suppose... I've had nothing but hatred for Freege ever since they took you and Mother. All I've ever wanted is to crush them all for all they've done...

speaker: Tine
text: But... What about Uncle Blume, Ishtar and Ishtore? Haven't I told you about them before? They were all decent people. At the very least, they were always nice to Mother and I...

speaker: Arthur
text: Oh, right. It was Hilda who drove Mother to her death, wasn't it?

speaker: Tine
text: It was... Even after all this time, I still hate her so much. All I want is to be the one to put an end to her myself...

speaker: Arthur
text: Don't worry, Tine. As long as I live, you won't have to deal with anything like that ever again. I'll protect you, no matter what!

speaker: Amid
text: This is it, Linda. We're getting awfully close to Freege... Mother's old home.

speaker: Linda
text: Mm, but... I have a bad feeling about this. How about you?

speaker: Amid
text: Yes, I suppose... I've had nothing but hatred for Freege ever since they took you and Mother. All I've ever wanted is to crush them all for all they've done…

speaker: Linda
text: Say, Amid… Mother betrayed her homeland to ally with Sigurd, right? You wouldn’t know why, would you?

speaker: Amid
text: Apparently she was really close to her sister, who died for Sigurd’s cause. That’s why she joined the army too.

speaker: Linda
text: That would be our aunt, right?

speaker: Amid
text: Yeah. That was Aunt Tailtiu.

speaker: Linda
text: Wow… She died fighting for her life… That’s… That’s so sad…

speaker: Patty
text: Here ya go, Seliph!

speaker: Seliph
text: Is this… lunch? You went and made lunch for me, Patty? Why, thank you!

speaker: Patty
text: Oh, and this too!

speaker: Seliph
text: Oh! You’ve prepared a drink as well? I swear you spoil me, Patty.

speaker: Patty
text: Aaaand one more thing…

speaker: Seliph
text: Er… Is this supposed to be a drink?

speaker: Patty
text: It’s Patty’s Super Special Home-Brewed Stamina Tonic! This’ll perk ya riiiiiight up! Don’t spill any, okay?

speaker: Seliph
text: O-of course…

speaker: Patty
text: Here ya go, Lester!

speaker: Lester
text: Oh, Patty! Am I glad to see you. I swear I was about to starve to death!

speaker: Patty
text: I thought you might be, so I packed you second and third helpings! Well? How is it?

speaker: Lester
text: Mmph… Oh, it’s fantastic! You’re the best cook I’ve ever met, Patty!

speaker: Patty
text: Hee hee, I bet I am!

speaker: Daisy
text: What’s going on, Dimna?

speaker: Dimna
text: Oh, Daisy… I dunno. I guess I’m feeling a bit, well, worthless…

speaker: Daisy
text: Why?

speaker: Dimna
text: It’s not just me. It’s like we normal folk may as well not even be here…

speaker: Daisy
text: Actually, yeah, now that you mention it… They don’t really seem to need us.

speaker: Dimna
text: Exactly… Y’know what? I oughta just go back home and find myself a real job.

speaker: Daisy
text: As soon as all this’s finally over, I’ll be right by your side on the way to Isaach. The war thing’s wearing me right out…

speaker: Dimna
text: Gah… We’re hopeless, aren’t we…

speaker: Patty
text: Shannaaaaaaaan!

speaker: Shannan
text: ...Er, yeah?

speaker: Patty
text: Er, yeah? Nice to see you too! Look, it’s lunchtime! Made it all myself!

speaker: Shannan
text: ...What are you doing? This is a battlefield, not a place for a picnic.

speaker: Patty
text: But I’ve got nothing else to do! It’s not like there’s anything around here that needs my, er, light touch!

speaker: Shannan
text: So you thought getting in everyone’s way in the middle of a war was a good idea?

speaker: Patty
text: Oh… Well that was uncalled for… You can’t just throw me aside like some old bag! And to think, I spent all day slaving away in a hot kitchen just to make you lunch… Well, I guess I won’t be doing that again!

speaker: Shannan
text: Oh, Patty… Look, I’m sorry. I went too far. Forgive me...

speaker: Patty
text: Then you’ll be eating my lunch? Really? Oh, that’s a huge relief… I love you sooooo much, Shannan!

speaker: Tine
text: Lord Seliph...

speaker: Seliph
text: Tine?! Stay back, please! You are ill suited for the front lines!

speaker: Tine
text: All I want is to help you, Lord Seliph. Please… My power is yours!

speaker: Seliph
text: But I… I couldn’t bear to lose you...

speaker: Tine
text: I won’t leave your side, Lord Seliph… The thought of meeting the same fate as Lady Deirdre… It’s too painful… Please, Lord Seliph. I’ll fight at your side till the very end!

speaker: Seliph
text: You’re right… My apologies. How could we not be better off fighting as one? Come, Tine. We ride together. Your power will bring us victory. I know it!

speaker: Tine
text: Lord Seliph… Thank you!

speaker: Tine
text: Are you alright, milord?

speaker: Leif
text: I am. You’ve no need to worry about me, Tine, but you ought to take care yourself. Our foes are as fierce as we’ve ever seen!

speaker: Tine
text: They are… But so long as we’re together, we’ll both be fine. I know it.

speaker: Leif
text: Neither of us can afford to die now. After all, the task of uniting Thracia still awaits us once we’re done here.

speaker: Tine
text: Mm. I’m so glad I’ll finally have the chance to help the people of Alster.

speaker: Leif
text: Not only Alster, Tine… The entire kingdom. After all, you’ll be by my side as the Queen of New Thracia!

speaker: Tine
text: That I will be, milord!

speaker: Tine
text: Are you alright, Ced?

speaker: Ced
text: Yeah, I’m fine. Don’t worry. But you ought to be careful yourself! These foes are as tough as they come.

speaker: Tine
text: They are… But so long as we’re together, we’ll both be fine. I know it.

speaker: Ced
text: Tine. I love you so much. You’re the most important part of my life…

speaker: Tine
text: Ced! We’re in the middle of the battle. This is hardly the time for things like that…

speaker: Ced
text: Heh, sorry about that. I just wanted to say it while I still can. I’d hate to leave it unsaid should something happen…

speaker: Tine
text: Ced… Please, be careful…

speaker: Mana
text: Are you alright, Asaello? Listen, I know how frustrated you are right now, but please, you mustn’t do anything too rash.

speaker: Asaello
text: Gah… If only I had a bit of crusader power, too, I wouldn’t be so bloody useless. I can’t take this!

speaker: Mana
text: I know… I’ve often thought the same. But crusader blood wouldn’t be the answer to everything. Think of it this way. We’ve made it so far with them with nothing but our best work. We might be common folk, but we’re bold and determined, and that’s what matters.

speaker: Asaello
text: Commoners… And to think, everyone around us is Lord This or Lady That or King The Other! Life’s so unfair.

speaker: Mana
text: I suppose… but come on, cheer up! Lord or not, there’s a whole orphanage eagerly awaiting your triumphant return!

speaker: Asaello
text: Yeah, you’re right. Things really aren’t all that bad. How could they be with you around?

speaker: Mana
text: Heh… Oh, Asaello…

speaker: Nanna
text: Lord Seliph…

speaker: Seliph
text: Nanna, the battle before us is as brutal as they come. Please, do take extra care.

speaker: Nanna
text: I know, but I’m actually a bit worried for you, Lord Seliph. Don’t forget that you’ve got to take extra care as well.

speaker: Seliph
text: You are right, of course, but after all this time we’re finally nearing the end. I mustn’t give this any less than I have.

speaker: Nanna
text: Then I’ll do everything I can to protect you, Lord Seliph. I’ll pray for you, just as I always have…

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank you, Nanna… I’m so grateful to have you always watching over me… I admit I can even feel your power!

speaker: Nanna
text: You’re welcome, Lord Seliph…

speaker: Nanna
text: Say, Lord Leif… How soon do you think this fight will be over?

speaker: Leif
text: I cannot say for sure... And yet I cannot help but feel our triumph is drawing ever closer.

speaker: Nanna
text: And once this is over, I take it we’ll be headed for Leonster?

speaker: Leif
text: Indeed we are. The Thracian peninsula has known naught but strife for decades, and to unify it was my father’s dream. I’ll pledge my life to fulfill his grand vision, and I’d have nothing more than to have you by my side every step of the way, Nanna.

speaker: Nanna
text: Of course Lord Leif! I’ll be by your side forevermore, wherever your path leads. Even to the very ends of the earth...

speaker: Jeanne
text: Lord Leif!

speaker: Leif
text: Jeanne? Didn't I ask you to remain in the castle?

speaker: Jeanne
text: But-

speaker: Leif
text: I'm sorry, but this battle is far too dangerous for anybody who's not of crusader descent. I don't want you fighting today!

speaker: Jeanne
text: I know I'd be a burden if I fought, but I've still got my staves, remember? Surely having a cleric would be a good idea?

speaker: Leif
text: I suppose... But stay clear of any danger. Do I make myself clear? New Thracia still needs you... I still need you. I couldn't live with myself if I let you die...

speaker: Jeanne
text: Yes, Lord Leif…

speaker: Nanna
text: You need to be careful, Ares! With a task as great as Agustria’s restoration awaiting you, you can’t afford to die now.

speaker: Ares
