text: Trust me, I know. I’ll never let this battle claim my life. So long as I still draw breath, I’ll toil till Father’s dying dream of a glorious Agustria is at last realized.

speaker: Nanna
text: That’s the Ares I know and love! Both Lord Eldigan and my mother would be so very of you. I’m sure of it.

speaker: Ares
text: But even one such as I could never do it alone. I’ll always need you, Nanna.

speaker: Nanna
text: And I’ll always be with you, Ares. I refuse to make the same mistake Mother made all those years ago…

speaker: Ares
text: Mistake? Was… Was Aunt Lachesis in love with my father?

speaker: Nanna
text: She was. Then again, I suppose he was only her half-brother.

speaker: Ares
text: And come to think of it, we are only cousins, are we not?

speaker: Nanna
text: Heh… It’s no wonder we’re together.

speaker: Larcei
text: Hey, Seliph! Wait up!

speaker: Seliph
text: ...Hm? Larcei?

speaker: Larcei
text: I’m coming with you on this one!

speaker: Seliph
text: You’re certainly welcome to…But why?

speaker: Larcei
text: It’s odd… I’m actually a little scared…

speaker: Seliph
text: Odd, indeed! If there’s one thing you’ve never been known for, Larcei, it’s fear.

speaker: Larcei
text: It’s… I just…

speaker: Seliph
text: I understand completely. Now, come! After all, what could ever inspire courage quite like having your blade at my side?

speaker: Larcei
text: Seliph…

speaker: Larcei
text: Everything alright, Johalvier?

speaker: Johalvier
text: Nngh… I gotta admit even I’m havin’ a hard time keepin’ up… But hey, Dozel’s in our hands, right? Gotta keep going! Just a little longer…

speaker: Larcei
text: Don’t do anything too dumb, okay? Dozel’ll still need you around to rebuild.

speaker: Johalvier
text: Yeah, you got it. I can’t just die now and leave behind my father and brothers’ now, can I? I’ll be needin’ your help too, Larcei.

speaker: Larcei
text: Sure. You’ve helped me an awful lot, you know. I ought to return the favor.

speaker: Johalvier
text: Whoa, thanks! I love ya so much, Larcei.

speaker: Larcei
text: Wh- Johalvier! What’d I say about doing dumb things!

speaker: Larcei
text: Everything alright, Johan?

speaker: Johan
text: At long last, the day is upon us: a battle so fierce to test even the mettle of Johan! I know at last the stinging kiss of fatigue... But all hope is not lost! Your love is as the mightiest shield, and with it I shall endure!

speaker: Larcei
text: Oh, geez... I guess I deserve every stupid word of that for letting myself fall for you, huh...

speaker: Johan
text: Love's hand is beyond reproach, my dear. Come, Larcei! Bless us all with a laugh!

speaker: Larcei
text: Heh... Don't slack off now, Johan.

speaker: Johan
text: Ah! Oh, Larcei, my dear…

speaker: Larcei
text: We’ve come quite a long way, haven’t we, Shannan?

speaker: Shannan
text: Yeah, I guess we have.

speaker: Larcei
text: I can’t stop thinking about everyone back in Isaach… I hope they’re all alright.

speaker: Shannan
text: Getting a bit homesick, are we, Larcei?

speaker: Larcei
text: Wh… No, not even close! What, do you think I’m still some kind of child?!

speaker: Shannan
text: Maybe. You’ve got quite a convincing child act going on there!

speaker: Larcei
text: Shannan!!

speaker: Shannan
text: Heh, I’m kidding! Come on. That terrifying glare you’ve got on there hardly befits a face as beautiful as yours.

speaker: Larcei
text: S-Shannan…

speaker: Lana
text: We're finally nearing the end, aren't we, Lord Seliph?

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. You know, Lana, you've done so much to help our cause from the very beginning. I couldn't possibly thank you enough.

speaker: Lana
text: Thank you, but I'm not so sure. I've hardly done anything special, have I? But I don't mind. All I really need to be happy is to be by your side, Lord Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Come to think of it, Lana, we've been together our entire lives, haven't we?

speaker: Lana
text: We have! I have so many great memories of afternoons we spent playing together. But not once did I suspect we'd end up, er...

speaker: Seliph
text: But I've always loved you, Lana. Even when we were children.

speaker: Lana
text: I'm sorry, Lord Seliph... But I can't stop thinking about this... Something feels amiss. It's as if being with you will hurt Miss Julia...

speaker: Seliph
text: Lana…

speaker: Lana
text: Scáthach…

speaker: Scáthach
text: Yeah?

speaker: Lana
text: I’m so proud of you.

speaker: Scáthach
text: Whoa, back up. Where’d THAT come from?

speaker: Lana
text: Please… Please don’t die in this battle.

speaker: Scáthach
text: Oh. Listen, you’ve got nothing to worry about. I’m not about to let myself die just yet.

speaker: Lana
text: Scáthach, I…

speaker: Scáthach
text: Yeah?

speaker: Lana
text: ...I love you, Scáthach.

speaker: Lana
text: Faval…

speaker: Faval
text: Yeah?

speaker: Lana
text: I’m so very proud of you.

speaker: Faval
text: Hey, hey, hey! What brought on the mushy stuff here?

speaker: Lana
text: Please… Please don’t die in this battle.

speaker: Faval
text: Ah, right. Don’t worry. I’m not gonna let death do us part just yet.

speaker: Lana
text: Faval, I…

speaker: Faval
text: Yeah?

speaker: Lana
text: ...I love you, Faval.

speaker: Altena
text: That's enough Arion! Why? Why in the world do you still refuse to see reason?!

speaker: Arion
text: Altena?!

speaker: Altena
text: How could you be so craven?! How dare you place your own vanity and pride over what truly matters!

speaker: Arion
text: What do you want from me, then?

speaker: Altena
text: Take a good, hard look at Prince Seliph! Ask yourself this: why is he still fighting? For whom is he out here day after day, setting his own suffering to the side?

speaker: Arion
text: So Seliph fights for justice, and I somehow do not? Is that what you're trying to say...

speaker: Altena
text: Very well, Arion... If you won't see reason, so be it. Come on. Kill me. End this. My... My life is in your hands, Arion. ...I die with no regrets.

speaker: Arion
text: A-Altena... Very well. You can rest easy now. I get it. I was wrong... My mercenary days are at an end, and my final task is with Seliph... Wait, no... With you. I now fight for you, Altena.

speaker: Fee
text: Say, Lord Seliph, I’ve got an idea. How about I go scout out the enemy?

speaker: Seliph
text: No, that would be too great a risk. This battle is nothing like anything we’ve yet seen. I don’t want you leaving my side.

speaker: Fee
text: Fine…

speaker: Seliph
text: Er… Are you worried about Silesse, Fee?

speaker: Fee
text: Just a little, I guess. I’ve heard rumors about how there’s some fighting there.

speaker: Seliph
text: Indeed! Its citizens have staged their own revolt against the Empire. From what I hear, they’ve already made impressive progress.

speaker: Fee
text: Really? Oh, that’s such a relief…

speaker: Seliph
text: Would you like to return to Silesse, Fee?

speaker: Fee
text: Thanks, but no thanks! The best place for me is to be by your side, Lord Seliph!

speaker: Seliph
text: Really? Well, thank you, Fee. It’s an honor and a pleasure to hear it.

speaker: Fee
text: I don’t ever want to leave you, Lord Seliph… This is like a dream come true…

speaker: Fee
text: Say, Oifey, I’ve got an idea. How about I go scout out the enemy?

speaker: Oifey
text: Sorry, Fee, but I must object. Their lines are crawling with archers willing to shoot down any pegasi.

speaker: Fee
text: So, er, Oifey…

speaker: Oifey
text: ...Yes?

speaker: Fee
text: Y’know, I actually think it’s really great. I mean, how all your life you’ve lived just for Lord Seliph, always putting yourself second.

speaker: Oifey
text: Mm… I confess that, in a way, those of us who survived the old war never truly wished to survive… But we had our own mission, painful as it was to leave our friends to their doom… Your parents among them.

speaker: Fee
text: Y’know, thanks to this war I’m starting to get my mom and dad a bit, and what they had to deal with… I never really knew them much… And I’m really glad I had you to tell me more about them, Oifey.

speaker: Oifey
text: Thank you… I feel I’ve always been indebted to Lady Erin for all the help she gave me back then. It is a privilege to help her daughter.

speaker: Fee
text: Um… Y’know, Oifey, I kinda wish I knew how to act a bit more, er, adulty. I think there’s a lot I could learn from you.

speaker: Oifey
text: All in good time, Fee. Little by little, life itself will teach you what adulthood is.

speaker: Fee
text: Oh, come on! I can’t just let you get all old on me before I can catch up!

speaker: Oifey
text: Whoa, whoa! Settle down, Fee…

speaker: Fee
text: Whatcha doing, Arthur?

speaker: Arthur
text: Well, for one, I’m fighting! The big hint here is the tome I’m holding… And you’re still as flighty as ever, I see.

speaker: Fee
text: Well, hello to you too!

speaker: Arthur
text: And there you go! People are busy, and you just sulk! This sort of thing’s why nobody-

speaker: Fee
text: -will ever like me at all? That’s what you’re saying, right? Well, I don’t have to stand here and listen to this garbage!

speaker: Arthur
text: No, wait! What I’m trying to say is, you sort of give people the wrong impression! But I like you… You’re really important to me..

speaker: Fee
text: A-Arthur… Stop kidding around…

speaker: Arthur
text: Fee, I always want to be with you. You know that. As soon as this war’s over, we’ll go back to Silesse… Together.

speaker: Fee
text: Oh, Arthur… Really? Yes! Thank you… Sniff… I’m… I’m so happy!

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia! What in blazes has happened to you? Come on, wake up!

speaker: Julia
text: HA HA HA... DEATH TO ALL... WHO DARE TO CHALLENGE LORD MANFROY...

speaker: Lewyn
text: This isn't going to work, Seliph. An evil spell's got Julia strung up like a puppet. I think we should deal with Manfroy first. We can come back for Julia once he's gone.

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia! Wake up... Please!

speaker: Julia
text: ......Nnh... Lord Seliph?! I... why am I here?

speaker: Seliph
text: You can thank Manfroy's dark arts. He brainwashed you into his service.

speaker: Julia
text: Manfroy... Oh, that's right... That man who caught me...

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank goodness you're safe...

speaker: Julia
text: Lord Seliph, I-

speaker: Seliph
text: It's fine, Julia. I know. Lewyn already told me everything. I'm sorry... I am so sorry. I failed to protect you...

speaker: Julia
text: No... It's fine. Don't worry, Seliph. I finally know why I've survived for all these years. I know my fate... I'm fated to fight. I'll never run away again!

speaker: Seliph
text: Your strength and courage is such an inspiration, Julia... But you're right. This is the will of fate, tragic as it is. None can afford to cower or flee now. Until the bitter end, we must march on…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Okay, Julia. This is the treasury. Try fitting the gemstone on your circlet into that niche there.

speaker: Julia
text: Here we go...

speaker: Lewyn
text: It worked... It really worked! There it is! The Book of Naga! And it's yours for the taking, Julia!

speaker: Julia
text: Wow, I... Oh! How strange... It feels so warm... It's almost as if I've known this book all my life…

speaker: Roberto
text: Yer head's goin' fer a huge bounty, y'know? No hard feelings, but die!

speaker: Roberto
text: Nngh... This... This can't be…

speaker: Boyce
text: Must I waste my skills on such feeble foes...?

speaker: Boyce
text: W... What fearsome foes…

speaker: Rodan
text: What the devil is happening... You! What have you done?!

speaker: Rodan
text: Is this... my damnation…

speaker: Fisher
text: Damn you all! Your heads are mine to cleave right off!

speaker: Fisher
text: H-how could this be…

speaker: Brian
text: How dare you murder my father... Learn the pain and wrath of three generations of House Dozel!

speaker: Brian
text: Johalvier, you moron! How dare you seek to destroy House Dozel!

speaker: Johalvier
text: Well, hi to you too, Brian. Heh… You’re worrying over nothing. Dozel’s not about to be destroyed on my watch. After all, the people are behind me!

speaker: Brian
text: H-how dare you, you dastard… You won’t get away with this!

speaker: Brian
text: Keh. Johan, you traitorous scum! How dare you bring such ruin to House Dozel!

speaker: Johan
text: Now, now, dearest brother! Why so glum? The task of restoring Dozel's honor falls to me. Now, do step aside while you still can!

speaker: Brian
text: Y-you dastard…

speaker: Brian
text: Even with Helswath, I... I fell so easily? Could it be... Could I have been wrong... all along...?

speaker: Dark Bishop
text: Kehehehe... Foolish mortals... Naught but prey to the darkness!

speaker: Dark Bishop
text: Gah! Lord Julius... I crave your pardon…

speaker: Hilda
text: Hmph... I won't fall anywhere near as easily as those other worms!

speaker: Hilda
text: Ohohohoho! You're Tailtiu's other brat, aren't you? Am I to presume you've come to seek my head for your mommy's pathetic demise?

speaker: Arthur
text: Oh, yeah. I figured that Tine shouldn't dirty her hands this time around...

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, did you now? In that case, I'll drag you straight to hell with me!

speaker: Hilda
text: Ohoho! So you toddled all the way here, Tine. I've been waiting for you. I want nothing more than to choke the life from you with my bare hands!

speaker: Tine
text: You won't get that chance! I pray you're watching, Mother... I'm finally going to kill Hilda!

speaker: Hilda
text: Gaah! This is a travesty... Ishtar... Avenge me... You must avenge me…

speaker: Scorpius
text: You murdered my father, André... And at last, I will have my vengeance!

speaker: Scorpius
text: And what are you supposed to be?

speaker: Lester
text: I'm Lester... The son of Aideen.

speaker: Scorpius
text: What? As in my dear aunt Aideen?! Well, then... The traitor's spawn shows his disgusting face at last! I certainly won't object. After all, I get to kill you, here and now!

speaker: Lester
text: Heh... My thoughts exactly.

speaker: Scorpius
text: And what are you supposed to be?

speaker: Faval
text: The name’s Faval, son of Bridget.

speaker: Scorpius
text: What? As in my dear aunt Aideen?! Well, then... The traitor's spawn shows his disgusting face at last! I certainly won't object. After all, I get to kill you, here and now!

speaker: Faval
text: Heh, took the words right out of my mouth!

speaker: Scopio
text: Gah... Why…

speaker: Arion
text: Forgive me…

speaker: Arion
text: Altena... I wish we hadn't met here, that you may be spared from knowing my shame...

speaker: Altena
text: Arion…

speaker: Arion
text: Nngh... Altena…

speaker: Manfroy
text: You fools! How dare you... All my life I've toiled for this moment... I'll show you no mercy!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Kehehe... You've come at last! I've been awaiting you for a long time.

speaker: Seliph
text: Manfroy! It was you who cursed Julia, was it no?

speaker: Manfroy
text: So I did. And so long as I live, my puppet she shall remain! Hee hee hee! She's every bit as helpless before my magic as her mother was...

speaker: Seliph
text: I should have known. If not for you, Mother... Gah! All of this misery... All these agonizing years... It was all your doing from the outset!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Heh... You've realized at long last. Everything I've done has led to this moment: the revival of my lord Loptous. And at long last, it is so! Loptous's advent in the form of Prince Julius is complete, and darkness shall soon engulf the world. You cannot prevent it. Nobody can...

speaker: Seliph
text: Manfroy, you... Father's grief... Mother's despair... If not for you and your foul ambitions, none of this would have ever happened... Damn you, Manfroy! I cannot allow you to win... I will not... You'll NEVER know mercy for your crimes!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Lord Julius... The Loptyrian Empire... is yours…

speaker: Julia
text: HA... HA... HA…

speaker: Julia
text: NNNGHhhhh... Ahh... Lord... Seliph…

speaker: Ishtar
text: Still your tongue... And feel the wrath of the goddess of lightning!

speaker: Ishtar
text: Tine...

speaker: Tine
text: Ishtar, please! Stop this! You've been nothing but kind to me all my life... I know you want no part of this battle!

speaker: Ishtar
text: ...I may be in the wrong, but I could never turn back now. Forgive me, Tine... Please…

speaker: Ishtar
text: Lord Julius... Are you pleased?

speaker: Mabel
text: Taste my blade!

speaker: Mabel
text: Lady Ishtar... Please... Forgive me…

speaker: Bleg
text: ...Die!

speaker: Bleg
text: Lady Ishtar... My sisters…

speaker: Meng
text: This place will be your grave!

speaker: Meng
text: Luck be with you, Lady Ishtar…

speaker: Julius
text: Hmhmhm... Have you gone mad? You cannot even touch me.

speaker: Julius
text: Feh... We meet at last, Seliph. The so-called scion of light... Don't make me laugh! What challenge could an heir of Baldr possibly provide? This is where your story ends!

speaker: Julius
text: J-Julia?! Why... What are you... Argh! Manfroy, you've made a grave mistake!

speaker: Julius
text: GWAAAAAAAAAAaaaaaaaa....

speaker: Julius
text: GHARRGH... SELIPH... HEAR ME WELL... SO LONG AS AVARICE LURKS STILL IN THE HEARTS OF MEN... I WILL RETURN... COUNT ON IT... THE HEARTS OF... GAAAAHHhhh…

speaker: Julius
text: GHARRGH... NAGA! YET AGAIN... YOU HAVE BROUGHT RUIN... TO ME…

speaker: Travant
text: ALTENA!! What was that sorry display? Why, pray tell, is Munster still standing?!

speaker: Altena
text: Father... I...

speaker: Travant
text: I've no interest in any more excuses! Don't you dare belittle me, Altena. You are a warrior beyond compare, and you and Arion embody my will beyond these walls. I expect no less than for you to do your duty! And what do I find instead? You've ignored my orders, left an entire platoon to the slaughter, and strolled home as if nothing ever happened! I've never been more disappointed...

speaker: Altena
text: I'm sorry, Father, but at least let me explain! I could never agree with such tactics, which enrich us at the expense of everybody else! How could you ever expect the proud Thracian people to accept prosperity built on the bones of others? Please, Father, rethink your ways!

speaker: Arion
text: Enough, Altena. There's no place here for such meddling. Still your tongue and obey Father! Father, bear in mind Altena is still young and unseasoned. I suspect she merely found the last battle too overwhelming a prospect. Please do forgive her, even just this once.

speaker: Travant
text: You know, Arion? If you'd just hold back on the coddling, perhaps Altena wouldn't be so stubborn! Look, Altena. I'll give you one last chance. Take a dracoknight platoon and retake Meath! If you so much as slip again, then daughter be damned, I will accept no excuses! Understood?

speaker: Altena
text: Yes, Father…

speaker: Travant
text: Whew... Family resemblance, indeed! It's plainly obvious that she loathes me...

speaker: Arion
text: Father, you have to remember that she's still a child. Like all children, she has yet to realize her thoughtless words have real effects.

speaker: Travant
text: Hmph, I suppose... I'm off to Kapathogia. I hear Hannibal's found himself some funny ideas about my plans. And so it falls to me to ensure he loses those ideas before somebody gets hurt...

speaker: Arion
text: I've never seen father so fearful... What could possibly have happened…

speaker: Travant
text: General Hannibal! The rebels have seized control of Meath. Altena is en route to counter-attack. Your armored knights will join her at once!

speaker: Hannibal
text: Your Majesty, I've said it a thousand times and I'll say it again. There is no use fighting this war! We must arrange a truce with the liberators if we wish to recover the strength to endure! Bowing to the Empire was a despicable choice to start, one which now leaves us serving our citizens to the true enemy on a gilded platter!

speaker: Travant
text: I did not ask for such dopey nonsense! The rebels have slaughtered my soldiers, and now they've stolen our territory! The hour is far too late for a truce!

speaker: Hannibal
text: I thought as much... Very well. I suppose I have no choice.

speaker: Travant
text: What's this, Hannibal? Do I hear traitorous rumblings coming from that mouth of yours?

speaker: Hannibal
text: Come now, Your Majesty! Never would a warrior such as I consider turning my cloak. Traitor, indeed!

speaker: Travant
text: Really, now? Then I trust you wouldn't object to a test of your warrior's loyalty. Until the war reaches its victorious end, Hannibal, I'll be taking care of your son.

speaker: Hannibal
text: I beg your pardon, Your Majesty? Do you have such little faith in me?!

speaker: Travant
text: You have nothing to worry about, Hannibal. If you don't intend to betray me, then I don't intend to so much as scratch the boy.

speaker: Hannibal
text: Why...

speaker: Travant
text: Men! Bring me Hannibal's son!

speaker: Cairpre
text: P-Papa...

speaker: Hannibal
text: Oh, Cairpre... I am so sorry...

speaker: Travant
text: Remember, Hannibal. You have nothing to worry about, so long as you behave yourself. As soon as this war is won, you'll get him back. I don't get it, though. The boy isn't even your real son. How could he have such sway over you?

speaker: Hannibal
text: Cairpre has brought so much joy into my life. A true family transcends simple blood...

speaker: Travant
text: Ohoho! Could it be? Does Thracia's great statesman have a soft spot for children? Now, then. Thracia depends on you, Hannibal!

speaker: Travant
text: Distler! War is on our horizon. Defense of this castle is in your hands.

speaker: Distler
text: Oh, Your Majesty! To have your presence is a true honor and pleasure! Rest assured, milord. Luthecia is as an impregnable wall! I've seen to it myself.

speaker: Travant
text: I'll hold you to your word. Now, I've reason to doubt the loyalty of Hannibal at Kapathogia. I've taken his son hostage, just in case, and I'm leaving him to your custody.

speaker: Distler
text: Yes, sir! I'll not let him out of my sight. But should Hannibal turn his cloak-

speaker: Travant
text: Then you'll kill the son. Don't be lulled into offering even a child such as he any mercy.

speaker: Distler
text: Understood, milord.

speaker: Travant
text: Bishop Judah, we may be in need of reinforcements. How soon can I expect the Emperor to honor his end of the treaty?

speaker: Judah
text: Heh... Even the great King Travant is wary of betrayal, is he? Be at peace. An Imperial unit is on the march to Thracia even as we speak.

speaker: Travant
text: Good. In that case, I think I'll leave the defense of Grutia to your hands. Try not to get too cocky with the rebels, Bishop. They're of a treacherous sort.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Looks like they're finally sending more wyvern knights our way, Seliph. This must be it. It's time we readied everybody for battle.

speaker: Seliph
text: I don't know, Lewyn. Our foremost enemy is the Empire, is it not? Waging a war here feels... meaningless.

speaker: Lewyn
text: The point of a battle comes from how you conduct yourself in it, Seliph. And we hardly have much choice at this point! We're already this far into the fight...

speaker: Seliph
text: But what of that dracoknight who was watching us from the Munster peaks? I've seldom seen such a sad look in anybody's eyes... How could I fight somebody like her...?

speaker: Lewyn
text: That's enough, Seliph! This is a war! If you can't stand it any more, then go on! Run home to Tirnanog!

speaker: Seliph
text: Lewyn…

speaker: Oifey
text: I beg your pardon, Lord Lewyn?! His Majesty is tired and stressed. Such harsh words are uncalled for...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Look, I know... But everyone is just as stressed as he is, yet they all know that we can't afford to stop. With the resurrection of Loptous lurking on the horizon, it's crucial we get to Grannvale and stop the world falling to ruin while we still can.

speaker: Seliph
text: Thank you, Oifey... but Lewyn speaks the truth. An inevitable battle lies ahead, and if we see in it naught by futility, then my duty is to carve my own purpose into it. Come, Oifey! Lewyn! I'll never again flinch or turn away!

speaker: Leif
text: Is something wrong, Finn? You've been awfully quiet since we left Manster... Is something on your mind?

speaker: Finn
text: Oh... Yes my lord. I don't suppose you saw a lone dracoknight lurking atop the mountains of Manster?

speaker: Leif
text: Oh, the woman? I saw her. I don't believe it's every day that you encounter a female dracoknight, is it? Was there something amiss about her?

speaker: Finn
text: It was her weapon... She was wielding Gáe Bolg, Leonster's holy lance. And I sensed an aura cloaking her... The holy aura of Njörun, like your father.

speaker: Leif
text: What? What are you saying, Finn?!

speaker: Finn
text: There is only one explanation, my lord. Your sister, Altena, mustn't have died in the Thracian ambush seventeen years ago. Nor must Gáe Bolg have been lost...

speaker: Leif
text: Altena?! She... She's still alive?! Then... Then what in the blazes was she doing commanding the Thracian army?

speaker: Finn
text: I'd surmise that Travant took her back to Thracia as a child, and raised her as his own.

speaker: Leif
text: Huh... Who knew a man as cold as Travant could do something so humane?

speaker: Finn
text: It isn't so simple, my lord. Altena is the sole inheritor of your father's holy lineage from the earth goddess, Njörun. As such, unlike you, she alone is capable of wielding Gáe Bolg. Power is the only reason a man like Travant would ever be so kind to his enemy's child.

speaker: Leif
text: So he's tricked my sister just so he can use her like a... like a weapon! Travant... What a disgusting man... ...I want to help her, Finn. If we can tell her the truth, then I know we can work together to avenge our parents.

speaker: Finn
text: My lord, I believe you're the only one who could possibly convince her now. Even after all these years, my lord, you are still her brother. I'm certain she will open her heart to you if you try. Please, my lord. Please save Lady Altena…

speaker: Hannibal
text: Hm... The rebels are on the move, are they?

speaker: Kanatz
text: Lord Hannibal! We're ready to attack at any moment. We await your command.

speaker: Hannibal
text: Wait. For the time being we should remain on the defensive. I'd prefer to avoid any needless skirmishes with the enemy.

speaker: Kanatz
text: But sire, what about...

speaker: Hannibal
text: ...My son? I know... I know, but... For now, I would rather hold back and let the battle unfold on its own first. My apologies, Kanatz, but I'd like you to take charge of defending the castle.

speaker: Kanatz
text: As you will, sire!

speaker: Altena
text: All units, move in and engage the rebels! We will return Meath to Thracian control!

speaker: Distler
text: What a sorry joke... Me, a distinguished general, stuck babysitting some brat?

speaker: Cairpre
text: Excuse me, Mister Distler, but... Let me go! Papa doesn't want to fight. He's out there risking his life all because of me!

speaker: Distler
text: Silence, boy! If Thracia's legendary Shield refuses to ply his warrior's craft of his own will, then we will force him to, by any means necessary!

speaker: Cairpre
text: Oh, Papa... Sorry…

speaker: Arion
text: Father, I've received grave news! It's Altena... She has fallen in battle.

speaker: Travant
text: I see... Very well, then. I suppose there's little choice now... I'm going to join the fray, Arion. You're in charge of defending the castle. I'll entrust this spear to you... And with it, the future of Thracia.

speaker: Arion
text: Hold on a moment, Father... This is Gungnir! What is the meaning of this? How do you intend to fight without it? Unless... Father, you can't be-

speaker: Travant
text: I am. Frankly, Arion, I've had enough. Thracia is yours to do with as you see fit. But we don't need to be hated by their kind...

speaker: Arion
text: Are you seriously suggesting I should seek a truce, Father? No! Never! To comply with the rebels now would be unthinkable!

speaker: Travant
text: As I said, Thracia is yours. Do as you see fit. All I ask is for you to find a way to liberate Thracia's people from their suffering... Farewell, Arion.

speaker: Arion
text: Father...

speaker: Hannibal
text: King Travant has joined the battle, has he? Hrm... I suppose I've no choice. My duty as a warrior demands it... Move in on the invaders! We'll let them proceed no further!

speaker: Arion
text: Altena! Are you alright?

speaker: Altena
text: Nngh? ...Oh... Arion...

speaker: Arion
text: My apologies, Altena. I had to give Father a convincing show, that I might ensure your survival. I had no choice but to deal such a powerful blow.

speaker: Altena
text: Don't worry, Arion. I understand. But where is Fath... er, King Travant now?

speaker: Arion
text: You won't see him again... Father has died in battle.

speaker: Altena
text: He has? ...How did it happen?

speaker: Arion
text: You'd be better off not knowing. Father's heart was an enigma at the best of times...

speaker: Altena
text: ...Listen, Arion. What do you think I should do now?

speaker: Arion
text: Join Prince Leif, your true brother. I'm certain he is still waiting for you.

speaker: Altena
text: Then what will you-

speaker: Arion
text: Altena... This is my fate. There's no helping it.

speaker: Altena
text: No! You can call for a truce, Arion! Now that Travant's dead, there's nothing at all to stop you from seeking peace! And I... I could never fight you!

speaker: Arion
text: I wish I could, and I would were it not for Father's final words to me... Please, Altena... Go! However, be prepared. Our next meeting shall be on the battlefield, and I will not stay my hand!

speaker: Altena
text: Oh... Arion…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Bad news, Seliph. Looks like General Hannibal only opposed us because they're holding his son hostage. He never wanted to fight...

speaker: Seliph
text: This cannot be... I've made a horrid mistake! Oh, General Hannibal... Please forgive me…

speaker: Lewyn
text: It looks like they've been holding a child in the dungeon, Seliph.

speaker: Seliph
text: Who are you? What's the matter?

speaker: Cairpre
text: I'm Cairpre... I'm General Hannibal's son. And... Wait... Aren't you Lord Seliph, the liberator?!

speaker: Seliph
text: Indeed I am. If I may ask, Cairpre, why would Thracia imprison one of their own general's sons?

speaker: Cairpre
text: King Travant took me hostage. Papa didn't want to fight your army at all, sir! The king threatened my life to force Papa to fight... Please, sir... Please take me to Papa! If Papa knows I'm safe, then he won't have to keep fighting! Please! We've gotta save him!

speaker: Seliph
text: I see... Don't worry. I promise we'll find him. Move out, everyone. I pray we'll still be in time to save General Hannibal!

speaker: Lewyn
text: Bad news, Seliph. By the sound of it, they were holding General Hannibal's son hostage here.

speaker: Seliph
text: Hannibal must have been forced to fight solely to protect his son! How appalling...

speaker: Lewyn
text: The son, Cairpre, seems to have vanished. He must've heard of his father's death. He probably couldn't stand to see any of us right now.

speaker: Seliph
text: Blast…

speaker: Judah
text: The enemy has got their grubby paws on Kapathogia?! I should've known better than to trust those worthless Thracians... I suppose it was unavoidable... Fortify our defensive line. Until reinforcements arrive, we must defend the castle at all costs.

speaker: Musar
text: So this is the infamous Thracia... I've never seen such a bleak wasteland! Heh, no matter. The rebels' little rampage ends here. Ready, men? We're going in. The Emperor himself's put a handsome bounty on each rebel head. We mustn't waste a chance to claim it for ourselves!

speaker: Seliph
text: Lewyn, do you think Arion still intends to fight us?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Looks like it. I've sent envoy after envoy offering a truce, but he's not responding. I guess his stubborn dracoknight pride compels him to fight to the bitter end. And here I was hoping the legendary Arion of Thracia'd be a wiser man than this... Seliph, I hope you understand we can't turn back now. This last battle needs to be fought.

speaker: Seliph
text: I don't understand him... Why? Why must Arion insist on fighting such a futile battle…

speaker: Seliph
text: Arion... How can he be so callous? Does he not understand the grief he is inflicting on Altena?!

speaker: Arion
text: The enemy has come as far as Grutia... Very well. All hands, deploy at once! Engage them in the Dragon Trinity Strike formation! This is our final chance. Thracia's destiny hangs in the balance of this final assault!

speaker: Arion
text: They've come at last... Move out! Whether we win or die, we'll have fought in our fatherland's name! Wyvern knights! Descend upon the enemy!

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia?! You’re safe! Oh, thank heavens…

speaker: Julia
text: Mm… The enemy seized and imprisoned me here, but I knew… I knew you would rescue me, no matter what.

speaker: Seliph
text: Say, Lewyn... Did my eyes deceive me, or did Arion really vanish like that?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Yeah, he did. Witnesses to the fight are saying Prince Julius appeared and took Arion.

speaker: Seliph
text: The Emperor's son himself?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Mm... and your half-brother, at that...

speaker: Seliph
text: I can hardly believe we share a mother...

speaker: Lewyn
text: And yet you do. Empress Deirdre was a talented priestess, and it looks like he inherited her skill with white magic. For Prince Julius, common warping and healing spells are the merest of trifles. He doesn't even need staves! But that's not the whole story, Seliph. Prince Julius's true power comes from something else entirely...

speaker: Seliph
text: How do you mean?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Loptous... It's the power of the dark lord…

speaker: Young Man
text: I heard tell that the Empire’s gonna send reinforcements to come after ya. Sounds like Sir Musar’s leading the charge. Legend has it his father fell at the hands of a Silessian knight who’s now among ya. You best take care. Odds are he’s lustin’ for a bit of revenge.

speaker: Young Man
text: Oh, hey! You've gone and sorted out them Imperial reinforcements already? Wow... I'm pretty dang impressed!

speaker: Woman
text: Thracia has many generals in its service, but Lord Hannibal is the most revered of 'em all. The man has devoted nigh on his entire life to the battlefield, so he never found a wife. Mind, twelve years ago or so, he did take in an orphan. He treats the boy as if he's his own flesh and blood. What a wonderful guy!

speaker: Old Man
text: They say a priest from a dark cult has got his foul hands on Grutia. Could it be true? Make no mistake. I know well the life King Travant is trying to crawl free of... But to allow a fell agent of the Loptyrian Order free run of his country... How could he make such a foolish choice? Accept this here barrier ring... And with it, please, save our beloved nation!

speaker: Old Woman
text: King Travant's as heartless as men come, he is. But oddly enough, his two kids, Arion and Altena, are the kindest souls you'll ever meet. Like peas in a pod, those two are! Always have been. Oh, I pray nothing ever changes that…

speaker: Young Man
text: General Distler of Luthecia's nothing more than a slimy toady to the king! Useless as he is, he still acts all like he's some almighty tyrant... What a foul little man.

speaker: “Shannan”
text: Wow, what a beauty...

speaker: Jeanne/Femina
text: ...Excuse me?

speaker: Shannam
text: Oh, how rude of me! Y'see, I'm the prince of the great state of Isaach. Call me Shannan. And you're just too pretty, miss! I had to meet you, y'know? If I may be so bold, how'd you like to go get a nice, hot meal with me? I know the most charming little tavern...

speaker: Shannam
text: Something wrong, miss? Oh, I see! You're all nervous 'cause you stand before me, the great Prince Shannan, aren't you? Don't worry about it! How I look doesn't matter, 'cause to me, stayin' close with the peasants is the most important thing there is.

speaker: Jeanne/Femina
text: Huh... So you're... Alright, then. Show me Balmung! I've always wanted to see it for myself!

speaker: Shannam
text: Huh? B-Balmung? Oh, yeah! The Balmung... Oh, er... Here you go! Look! It's the Balmung, the great dracoshield! How about that, huh? Now, where were we? Dinner, right?

speaker: Jeanne/Femina
text: Oh, you imbecile! Everybody knows that Balmung isn't a shield! You're nothing like the real Prince Shannan!

Oh, geez... You're part of that liberation army, aren't you? Look, I'm real sorry! It's just... Women've been fawnin' over me left and right ever since I took to callin' myself Shannan. Here, take the bloody shield. Let's pretend this never happened, alright?

speaker: Jeanne/Femina
text: Honestly... What a pig! Oh, well. I guess this shield'll help me to toughen up a bit.

speaker: Man
text: It wasn't all that long ago that the region here was under House Leonster's rule. Oh, what a peaceful time that was... As soon as the last war was over, though, the Thracians pounced on us like a starving cat…

speaker: Faval
text: Patty! Hey! PATTY! Don’t tell me you’ve been stealing again!

speaker: Patty
text: Oh, er… Yep. Just a bit, though!

speaker: Faval
text: Ugh. Look, I don't care if you're just stealing from the enemy. I don't like you stealing at all! Knock it off, okay?

speaker: Patty
text: What, d'you think I like doing this? That I'm stealing for the fun of it?! This army needs to eat, y'know, and we need gold for that! We don't exactly have many options here!

speaker: Faval
text: Yeah, but haven’t you heard what people are saying about you? I caught this guy mocking you, like being a thief’s a walking punch line… “What else didja expect from being a pirate’s brat? Like mother, like child,” he kept saying. Of course, I wiped the floor with him for that…

speaker: Patty
text: It doesn’t matter what people think, Faval! Let them say whatever they want. Doesn’t change a thing about Mom… And it doesn’t change that she was an heir of Ullur the crusader! I was in tears when Lewyn told me about her… I’ve never been so happy!

speaker: Faval
text: Yeah, me too. Y’know, we haven’t exactly had the best lives. Poor orphans and all that… But I never even dreamed that our mother could be a noblewoman! I don’t suppose you remember anything about her, Patty?

speaker: Patty
text: Nope! Not a thing… You?

speaker: Faval
text: Yeah, but… only just a little… She was a kind and beautiful woman…

speaker: Patty
text: So is she… Do you think Mom’s dead?

speaker: Faval
text: I can’t say for sure… But as soon as the war’s done, Patty, we're gonna go look for her. We’ll find our mother… Bridget… And even though we don’t know his name, maybe we’ll find our father, too…

speaker: Asaello
text: Daisy! Hey! DAISY! Don't tell me you've been stealing again!

speaker: Daisy
text: Oh, er... Yep. Just a bit, though!

speaker: Asaello
text: Ugh. Look, I don't care if you're just stealing from the enemy. I don't like you stealing at all! Knock it off, okay?

speaker: Daisy
text: What, d'you think I like doing this? That I'm stealing for the fun of it?! This army needs to eat, y'know, and we need gold for that! We don't exactly have many options here!

speaker: Asaello
text: But-

speaker: Daisy
text: And what about the kids back in Connaught, huh? They need money to get by as well, and I can't just leave them to starve!

speaker: Asaello
text: Yeah, I guess you're right... I hope they're doing okay.

speaker: Daisy
text: Don't act like you don't have to help too, Asaello! You're sitting on a tidy little fortune from arena prizes. You'd better not waste it!

speaker: Asaello
text: Gah, I knew that'd come back to bite me…

speaker: Leif
text: Waaaaait! Please, my sister! Stop it!

speaker: Altena
text: Your sister?! ...Who are you, and why do you think calling me your sister is a good idea?

speaker: Leif
text: I... I am Leif, of House Leonster.

speaker: Altena
text: Leif? Oh, I see... The famous Prince Leif, is it? In case it wasn't obvious... And, evidently, it wasn't... I am Altena, daughter of Travant.

speaker: Leif
text: Listen to me, Altena! Your true parents are Quan and Ethlyn, whom Travant slew seventeen years ago. You vanished in Travant's attack, and so too did Gáe Bolg, the sacred earth lance of Leonster. Which, I might add, is the very lance resting in your hand as we speak! Only a true heir of House Leonster can wield Gáe Bolg.

speaker: Altena
text: What are you talking about?! Are you seriously trying to claim my real father is my father's arch-enemy? That could never be... It mustn't...

speaker: Leif
text: Look into my eyes. If anything can prove the truth of my words to you, it will be my eyes. Please, sister...

speaker: Altena
text: Fine... ...What is this?! I know you're lying, but I... I can't bring myself to doubt you anymore!

speaker: Leif
text: ...Altena!

speaker: Altena
text: Wait! I... I must speak with Father. I need to confirm this…

speaker: Travant
text: Altena? Oh, you have got to be joking. Why? Why, why WHY did you abandon your post for the second time in as many days?

speaker: Altena
text: My apologies, Father... but I have an urgent question to ask of you. Are you my father? Or was my father really King Quan?!

speaker: Travant
text: Feh... I see you've found out at last. Well, I suppose it was only a matter of time before this day came. It's true. Quan did indeed sire you, but what difference does it make now? It doesn't change that it is I who raised you.

speaker: Altena
text: So you... You murdered my parents, Father...

speaker: Travant
text: Heh heh... I suppose I did. Quan and Ethlyn died at my hand. Do you take issue with that? War is hell, Altena. War claims lives. Worrying now won't change a thing.

speaker: Altena
text: Gah... How dare you! How dare you mislead me all these years, Father! Er, no... Travant!

speaker: Arion
text: That's enough, Altena!

speaker: Altena
text: Get out of my way, Arion! This man dies here and now, and nobody can stop me! Not even you!

speaker: Arion
text: I cannot allow this. If you dare to turn on Father, then you'll have to contend with me first!

speaker: Altena
text: W-wait! I can't fight you, Arion! I could never-

speaker: Arion
text: It's too late for you to stand down now... Farewell, Altena!

speaker: Altena
text: Nngh... Arion...

speaker: Travant
text: ...You didn't just kill her, did you, Arion? You know, you didn't need to go quite so far... Eh, no matter. I'm going to join the fray, Arion. I suppose there's little choice now... You're in charge of defending the castle.

speaker: Arion
text: Understood, Father.

speaker: Travant
text: I'll entrust this spear to you... and with it, the future of Thracia.

speaker: Arion
text: Hold on a moment, Father... This is Gungnir! What is the meaning of this? How do you intend to fight without it? Unless... Father, you can't be-

speaker: Travant
text: I am. Frankly, Arion, I've had enough. Thracia is yours to do with as you see fit. But we don't need to be hated by their kind...

speaker: Arion
text: Are you seriously suggesting I should seek a truce, Father? No! Never! To comply with the rebels now would be unthinkable!

speaker: Travant
text: As I said, Thracia is yours. Do as you see fit. All I ask is for you to find a way to liberate Thracia's people from their suffering... Farewell, Arion.

speaker: Arion
text: Father…

speaker: Altena
text: Pardon me, Lord Seliph. My name is Altena... Daughter of Quan of Leonster. My brother, Prince Leif, has explained the truth to me, and I can no longer oppose you. If you please, I'd like to join your ranks.

speaker: Seliph
text: Princess Altena?! ...Ah, yes. That's right! Prince Leif has told me everything, and we've both prayed you would come... He'll be so glad to know you've joined us. You've made a difficult but wise decision.

speaker: Altena
text: ...I can still scarcely believe this has all happened. And yet, the moment I gazed into my brother's eyes, I understood everything. His eyes revealed my father's warm gaze... And as clear as if it were only yesterday, I felt for a split second as if I were a mere baby, once more swaddled in my mother's gentle arms...

speaker: Seliph
text: I admit I'm still not entirely sure what King Travant was trying to do with you. I still cannot see what would have led him to spare you and bring you home after murdering your parents...

speaker: Altena
text: I've heard he once told my brother, Arion, that he sought to use the might of Leonster's holy lance, Gáe Bolg, as his own. For that alone, he needed me...

speaker: Seliph
text: You were a little more than a tool to him?

speaker: Altena
text: I... I'm still not entirely sure. For all his cruelty, he still treated me as if I were his true daughter. He was still a father to me.

speaker: Seliph
text: Did he, now... I suppose I've never known much of his ways.

speaker: Altena
text: I must ask a favor of you, milord. It's about Arion... We need to help Prince Arion!

speaker: Seliph
text: Certainly! I'm hardly eager to fight a man of his fine caliber, if what I've heard is true. The only question is, can we convince him?

speaker: Altena
text: I'll do my best to persuade him again. All I ask is a little time: Please, milord!

speaker: Patty
text: Hmph... So you're that Cairpre guy? Here I thought the son of the great General Hannibal'd be this amazingly hot guy, but you're just some snotty kid...

speaker: Cairpre
text: You're not any better yourself, you know.

speaker: Patty
text: Oh, excuse you! Are you really trying to say I just look like a child?

speaker: Cairpre
text: Yeah. I really am, because you really do.

speaker: Patty
text: Nrrrgh... Y-you little... You JERK!

speaker: Cairpre
text: Papa, stop! It's me! You don't have to fight now! The liberators have gone and captured Luthecia!

speaker: Hannibal
text: Cairpre?! You... You're safe!

speaker: Cairpre
text: Yep! Listen, Papa... I want to join Lord Seliph's army. Thracia's changed so much lately... I want to fight to help all its people, and bring back the old Thracia!

speaker: Hannibal
text: You've grown into such a splendid young man, Cairpre... Very well! I, too, shall serve Lord Seliph.

speaker: Cairpre
text: Yes! Thank you, Papa! First we'll help free Thracia, and then together, we'll challenge the Empire!

speaker: Seliph
text: General Hannibal, it is an honor to meet you at last. Please accept my apologies for engaging you in such a pointless battle.

speaker: Hannibal
text: Lord Seliph... it is I who need apologize, not you. You have my deepest gratitude for all you've done to rescue my son...

speaker: Seliph
text: Your reputation precedes you, General. We've all heard of Thracia’s great Shield. That a warrior of your caliber was coerced onto the battlefield by use of hostages... King Travant is an utterly sickening man!

speaker: Hannibal
text: Indeed... And a pitiful man, at that. All he has accomplished is shattering any trust his subjects once held in him. The people's hearts can only endure so much abuse before they break...

speaker: Seliph
text: If I may, General, would you join us? To have the power and wisdom of a great general like you would be the finest boon.

speaker: Hannibal
text: Very well! If you have a use even for these old bones, Lord Seliph, then you have my fealty.

speaker: Lene
text: You're Cairpre, right?

speaker: Cairpre
text: Oh, y-yes... I am.

speaker: Lene
text: I hear you're an orphan too, right? D'you remember anything at all from being a kid?

speaker: Cairpre
text: No, sorry. Nothing at all. I think I was still just a baby when Papa came to Darna and took me in...

speaker: Lene
text: Wait, you're from Darna, too?!

speaker: Cairpre
text: Are you familiar with Darna, Lene?

speaker: Lene
text: Yep. I grew up in the Darna abbey. They told me my mom, who I think was a dancer as well, left me there when I was just about two years old. And that's why I'm a dancer now. See, what I was thinking was that maybe, if I did the same thing as her, one day I might find my mom again. It's a bit embarrassing, but I taught myself everything I know about dancing.

speaker: Cairpre
text: Huh. That's really great of you, Lene! I, er, guess I thought wrong about you...

speaker: Lene
text: Not a big fan of dancers, Cairpre?

speaker: Cairpre
text: Not really, no... At least, I wasn't until I met you, Lene.

speaker: Lene
text: Aww! Thanks, Cairpre!

speaker: Leylia
text: Hey! You’re Sharlow, right?

speaker: Sharlow
text: Huh? Sorry, but who are you, miss?

speaker: Leylia
text: I’m Leylia! Er, you’ve never seen a dancer before, have you?

speaker: Sharlow
text: No, sorry… Not yet.

speaker: Leylia
text: Heh! Y’know, if you ever have time to spare, I can show you a bit of dancing. Deal?

speaker: Sharlow
text: T-thank you…

speaker: Julia
text: Are you at all hurt, Lord Seliph?

speaker: Seliph
text: Ah, Julia! No, I'm fine, thank you. I pray you're taking care of yourself.

speaker: Julia
text: Lord Seliph...

speaker: Seliph
text: Is something amiss?

speaker: Julia
text: Er... No, it's nothing...

speaker: Seliph
text: Listen, Julia. You've been acting oddly all day. Is something troubling you?

speaker: Julia
text: I... All I can feel is dread... I feel as if I'll be torn from you, and we'll never see each other again... I... I'm terrified...

speaker: Seliph
text: You've no need to worry, Julia. I swore to you all those months ago that I'll protect you, no matter what. Have faith, Julia. I'll never let you down.

speaker: Julia
text: I know... I do believe in you... I'm so sorry, Lord Seliph... I've never been more than a nuisance to you.

speaker: Seliph
text: You must be weary. We have been on the march for weeks on end, after all! Listen. Once we're done here, we'll be headed for the free city of Miletos. You can have a nice, long rest there. Oh, that's right! Miletos is famous for its merchants, no? I can take you shopping while we're there. I'll buy you anything you desire. Well, so long as it's not too pricey. Heh... I can only imagine how poorly Lewyn would handle any over-spending!

speaker: Julia
text: You would do that...? Oh, thank you, Lord Seliph... Thank you...

speaker: Seliph
text: Is that a little smile I see before me? Heh, now that's more like it!

speaker: Julia
text: Lord Seliph... Close your eyes, please.

speaker: Seliph
text: Hm? Why do you ask?

speaker: Julia
text: I wish to cast a Ward spell upon you... It will help you better resist enemy magic.

speaker: Seliph
text: Are you sure, Julia?! Wouldn't the use of such a spell endanger you?

speaker: Julia
text: Everything will be alright... I've done naught but take and take so far. All I want is to give something back.

speaker: Seliph
text: Julia...

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, lords in the heavens above... I implore you, confer your blessings upon Lord Seliph…

speaker: Finn
text: Pardon me, my lady... I am Finn, a knight of House Leonster. It is an honor to meet you once more.

speaker: Altena
text: So you're Sir Finn, then? Leif's told me about you already. I can't thank you enough for all you've done to protect him all these years.

speaker: Finn
text: Thank you, my lady, but it is I who owes you an apology. Not once in the past seventeen years did I ever suspect that you yet lived on, let alone just across the border! My failure to search for you is... is inexcusable...

speaker: Altena
text: Sir Finn... Are those tears I see? Why... Why are you crying?

speaker: Finn
text: I... My apologies, my lady. You shouldn't have to see me in such a state as this...

speaker: Altena
text: Hold a moment... I remember something... Yes, I... I was incredibly fond of you... And I always sought your attention, didn't I? That's right... Sir Finn...

speaker: Finn
text: My lady, I…

speaker: Hannibal
text: Princess Altena. I've been filled in on your situation. You have my deepest condolences.

speaker: Altena
text: General Hannibal... You've chosen to ally with Lord Seliph as well, have you? Thank goodness... I was dreading the very idea of considering you an enemy as well.

speaker: Hannibal
text: Hm. Pray tell, milady, what has become of Prince Arion?

speaker: Altena
text: My broth- Er, no... Arion simply refused to listen to anything I said. Perhaps you would have better luck persuading him, sir?

speaker: Hannibal
text: If you couldn't convince him, milady, then nothing has a chance. I would surmise that Prince Arion is resolving to die a warrior's death, not giving in to the indignity of a truce. We've no choice left.

speaker: Altena
text: But sir-

speaker: Hannibal
text: I know how you feel, milady... But some men like Arion are stubborner than mules. Most likely, Prince Arion would never wish to reveal such perceived weakness before you. Please understand this at lest, milady…

speaker: Hannibal
text: Sharlow…

speaker: Sharlow
text: Hm? Is something wrong, Papa?

speaker: Hannibal
text: Son… I feel as if I am in some way responsible for all of your misfortunes… If you’d been raised by a normal family, rather than a soldier such as myself, you would have never been abducted…

speaker: Sharlow
text: Don’t say things like that, Papa! I’m as happy as can be to live with you! And thanks to you, I’m using my magic to help you all fight for peace and justice. I wouldn’t give that up for anything!

speaker: Hannibal
text: I see…

speaker: Sharlow
text: Oh, and by the way.

speaker: Hannibal
text: ...Yes?

speaker: Sharlow
text: I’m so proud that you’re my papa, Papa… Kapathogia’s people love you so much. They all say you’re the best thing that ever happened to them. Not to mention, you adopted an orphan!

speaker: Hannibal
text: They do, do they… Thank you, Sharlow. I’m so glad I have such a fine son… Which reminds me. This staff is for you. I found it discarded in the castle grounds. I believe you’re skilled enough to wield it.

speaker: Sharlow
text: Ohh! And it’s a lovely staff, too! Thank you, Papa! Thank you so much.

speaker: Villager
text: Hee hee hee!

speaker: Hawke
text: Hm?

speaker: Villager
text: Would ya believe it? I was sittin’ around the town square and this girl confessed her love to me… It feels so, SO great! Wish I could share my happiness with ya!

speaker: Hawke
text: Er…

speaker: Villager
text: Hang on! You’re with the liberators, right? Here, take this town’s famous tonic and secret book!

speaker: Hawke
text: T-thank you…

speaker: Villager
text: Love’s such a wondrous thing… You oughta find someone to love, too!

speaker: Kanatz
text: My lord Hannibal is depending on me to defend this castle. If you wish to claim it, you must first claim my life!

speaker: Kanatz
text: General Hannibal... Forgive me, my liege…

speaker: Hannibal
text: Must we fight...? I suppose I have no choice. In Thracia's name, then…

speaker: Hannibal
text: Ohh, my son... Please... Survive…

speaker: Distler
text: The rebels are already here?! Blast... We aren't ready for this!

speaker: Distler
text: Nngh... King Travant... I beg... your forgiveness…

speaker: Musar
text: Death to all rebel scum! Only oblivion awaits those who dare to threaten the Empire!

speaker: Musar
text: Glory be… to Grannvale!

speaker: Judah
text: A liberation army, is it... There is no place for your precious light in this realm. This world is Lord Loptous's to smother in darkness!

speaker: Judah
text: Heh... Lord Loptous's return is nigh... And when it comes... You will all…

speaker: Altena
text: Stand down before I cut you down. You will never win!

speaker: Altena
text: Arion... Oh, Arion…

speaker: Altena
text: You're Leonster's prince, are you? How dare you try to steal our land!

speaker: Leif
text: Please, stay your hand! You... You're my-

speaker: Altena
text: Silence! Spare me your ravings!

speaker: Altena
text: My apologies, but you shall fall here...

speaker: Finn
text: Oh! L-Lady Altena! It is you... It really is you…

speaker: Travant
text: Heh heh heh... Welcome, rebel scum. I am Travant. Remember this well: a final gift from the depths of the inferno!

speaker: Travant
text: Thracia... Nngh... My beautiful fatherland…

speaker: Travant
text: Heh heh heh... So! You're Quan's troublesome little son, are you? What a fool Blume was... How could he have failed to kill a runt like you?

speaker: Leif
text: We meet at last, Travant... I... I've awaited this day for so long. This is what kept me alive all this time... I've lived for this alone: to choke the life from you with my bare hands!

speaker: Travant
text: Heh... As foolish as your father... And unlike him, you can't even wield the Gáe Bolg! You don't stand a chance! Now, hold still! It's time you learned the last agonies your father felt at my hands!

speaker: Travant
text: Ah, yes. The famous Finn! Still clinging to life, are you?

speaker: Finn
text: Prepare yourself, King Travant! Today, I avenge my fallen lord!

speaker: Travant
text: Hah! How laughable! A common soldier like you could never even scratch me! I take it you're ready to die, then?

speaker: Arion
text: Heh... What fools. You dare challenge me, even knowing I wield Gungnir, the heavenly lance?

speaker: Arion
text: So... You're the famous Prince Seliph... Heh, I trust you'll make for a fine foe. Shall we begin our duel, then?

speaker: Seliph
text: Prince Arion, please! Lay down your arms! It isn't too late to end this peacefully!

speaker: Arion
text: Enough! I've nothing left to say. Now, come! Come acquaint yourself with Gungnir, Seliph!

speaker: Altena
text: Stop this madness, Arion! We've no reason to fight!

speaker: Arion
text: Altena... I see you're in good health. I for one have long sought to test my skills against you. Now, come at me! I won't hold back!

speaker: Altena
text: Oh... Arion…

speaker: Arion
text: How... How could this be?! I've... I've brought shame on myself... Altena…

speaker: Julius
text: Arion. This place will not be your grave. I forbid it. Heh heh... Join me.

speaker: Julius
text: Ishtar, what's the status here?

speaker: Ishtar
text: Everything is moving smoothly according to your plan, Lord Julius.

speaker: Julius
text: Heh... I wonder what it must be like to be as terrified of our sacrifices to the dark lord as the peasants must be.

speaker: Ishtar
text: I've seen it myself. Knowing their children are doomed to the stake nigh drives them mad with grief... Particularly the mothers...

speaker: Julius
text: Hmhmhm... Magnificent. Let them learn now the true meaning of despair. Let their will to live erode and crumble. Let them become little more than ragdolls. Let them become the ideal slaves for the rise of the Loptous Empire.

speaker: Ishtar
text: Also, it seems we've captured far too many children. This castle simply doesn't have the room for them all. How shall I handle this?

speaker: Julius
text: Send them to Belhalla at once. I will groom them personally, I think. Friends, family... it matters not. By the end they will despise each other, ready to kill their own in power's name. Only the fittest will survive, and these fittest will become the ideal citizens of Loptous's new world.

speaker: Ishtar
text: But Lord Julius... What of your father? What of Emperor Arvis? The emperor refuses to allow any child hunts under his watch.

speaker: Julius
text: My father? Heh... My father is not worth fretting over, Ishtar. I will persuade him easily...

speaker: Ishtar
text: Lord Julius...

speaker: Hilda
text: Ishtar! Where is His Highness?

speaker: Ishtar
text: Oh, Mother... The prince just departed for Belhalla.

speaker: Hilda
text: He did, did he? ...You know, Ishtar, I daresay the prince has quite the love for you. Hell, I'm already hearing the wedding bells ring!

speaker: Ishtar
text: I... I don't-

speaker: Hilda
text: Open your ears, Ishtar! Freege is by far the most esteemed of Grannvales noble houses, and I, like the Emperor himself, am of House Velthomer. There is nobody in this land who could ever be worthier to the prince's hand than you!

speaker: Ishtar
text: A-as you say...

speaker: Hilda
text: Now, then! We have more pressing matters ahead. Those rebels, murderers of my dear husband and son, are coming our way, Ishtar! Not only that, they dared to steal Alster from us! Never has history given Freege a more dire enemy than Seliph, his father and all of his kin! I shall await them here at Chronos, that I may give them the welcome they deserve. You run along to Miletos. After all, those brats won't arrange their own journey to Belhalla!

speaker: Ishtar
text: Yes, Mother...

speaker: Dark Mage
text: Your Majesty, the mages are in position. However, er... we have a slight problem. A small few children escaped our hold amidst the cover of confusion from our deployment. What are your orders?

speaker: Hilda
text: Excuse me?! How dare anyone under my command be so incompetent... No matter. Kill them all. Teach them all a lesson. Relay this command to General Riddell at Rados. He is to put them all down at once.

speaker: Girl
text: Er... Where do we run now?

speaker: Boy
text: Sorry, I dunno.

speaker: Girl
text: But... But if we get...

speaker: Boy
text: Don't cry! It... It'll all be fine! Don't ya know? The crusaders are coming! They'll save us all. I know it!

speaker: Girl
text: Sniff... I guess you're right. The crusaders'll come. They will... They will…

speaker: Morrigan
text: Ah, General Riddell. We've got orders for you from Queen Hilda. She wants you to move out at once.

speaker: Riddell
text: Excellent. It's high time that we had work which better befits knights. I am absolutely fed up with hunting children! I swear, if I have to hunt even one more child...

speaker: Morrigan
text: Oh, what a pity that is. You see, we've a handful of escaped brats who are all in sore need of an execution.

speaker: Riddell
text: Oh, for the love of...

speaker: Morrigan
text: What's this? Are you, a loyal Imperial general, dissatisfied with your orders? Do I smell a filthy traitor to the trust of His Imperial Majesty, Emperor Arvis?

speaker: Riddell
text: ...No, sir. I could... I could never consider betraying His Majesty... Very well. I suppose I have no choice...

speaker: Morrigan
text: Hmph... Honor of a knight? How quaint.

speaker: Manfroy
text: Princess Julia. At last, I've found you...

speaker: Julia
text: Huh? Who are you?

speaker: Manfroy
text: Heh... The shock stripped you of your memory all those years ago, did it? Perfect. Now, come!

speaker: Julia
text: N-no! Take your hands off me!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Heh heh... You cannot resist fate, my dear. Now, cease your struggle and come along...

speaker: Julia
text: No! Ahh... Lord Seliph... Help... me…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Seliph, I'm hearing that a couple of children have just fled Chronos. Unless we step in now, they're sure to meet a grisly end.

speaker: Seliph
text: Children?! Very well. We'll move out at once. I won't rest until every last one is safe.

speaker: Lewyn
text: We've got another problem, too. It's Julia... She's gone. I've searched high and low, but she's nowhere in sight.

speaker: Seliph
text: No! Oh, no... How could this be...

speaker: Lewyn
text: I can't believe it, either, but that's how it is... My guess is the enemy seized her. But why... Why would they only target Julia? This doesn't make any sense...

speaker: Seliph
text: Gah... Hold on, Julia, wherever you are... No matter what happens, we'll find you!

speaker: Riddell
text: Well, we've no need to make haste here. Men, move out... but at a leisurely pace.

speaker: Seliph
text: Any luck finding the children, Lewyn?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Nope, no luck. Looks like they've already been sent to Miletos. Let's move! There's no time to lose while they're still in danger.

speaker: Lewyn
text: But it looks like we'll need to capture Rados as well, if we're going to get the gates to Miletos open.

speaker: Seliph
text: Understood. Castle Rados is our next challenge, then!

speaker: Seliph
text: This is... It's like a ghost town...

speaker: Lewyn
text: The handiwork of Morrigan's mages, I hear. Any who dared to resist met a grisly end...

speaker: Seliph
text: How could they... How could anyone be so savage...

speaker: Lewyn
text: And that's why we've got to fight this war to the end, Seliph. This is something you've got to understand. This is the way of the Loptous Empire. They have no place at all for the good-hearted…

speaker: Lewyn
text: Now, it shouldn't be too long before the gate through to Miletos opens for us. What's your next move, Seliph?

speaker: Seliph
text: Needless to say, we must march on Miletos. We can't afford to rest while those children are still at risk... Or Julia for that matter.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Good. And after that, Grannvale awaits!

speaker: Arvis
text: It has been a long time, Ishtar. How fare you of late?

speaker: Ishtar
text: Oh, Your Majesty! What brings you here?

speaker: Arvis
text: Listen, Ishtar. Release the captive children. I know you care no more for these foul deeds than I do.

speaker: Ishtar
text: My apologies, sir, but I'm on Prince Julius's-

speaker: Arvis
text: Pay Julius's orders no mind. I'll be having a word with him soon.

speaker: Ishtar
text: But...

speaker: Arvis
text: This is an order from your emperor, Ishtar! Has Julius bent you such that you will no longer listen to the word of your liege?

speaker: Ishtar
text: No... Never, Your Highness...

speaker: Julius
text: I think not, Father. Ishtar is mine. Your selfish ways are so bothersome.

speaker: Arvis
text: Julius! How dare you-

speaker: Julius
text: Why, Father, it almost sounds as if you still don't know any better! Old age must already be dulling that once brilliant mind of yours. Why not retire before it grows still feebler? Unless... Ohoho! Don't tell me you still seriously believe that you can banish me?

speaker: Arvis
text: No... I know better than to try something so futile again... I... I have no further objection.

speaker: Julius
text: That's better. Now, then. Begone! Return to your post and haunt my sight no more. Defending Chalphy is crucial. Don't fail me for once in your sorry life, Father.

speaker: Arvis
text: Y-yes, Julius. At once...

speaker: Manfroy
text: Hmhmhm... How the mighty have fallen! Never would you think this wretch, now clinging only to the ghost of a crown, was once the most powerful man in Jugdral.

speaker: Julius
text: Ah, Manfroy. Where's Julia? Have you restored her memory yet?

speaker: Manfroy
text: Your dear little sister is in Chalphy, burdened once more by her old memories. Never have I seen such horror as when she recalled how you, her brother, almost killed her! Or how her dearly departed mother spirited her clear of the castle and your clutches...

speaker: Julius
text: Indeed... Near everyone puts up some defiance to death by my hand, yet Deirdre never so much as flinched in the end. She accepted her own demise, all to save Julia with what little strength she still had... Julia possesses the foul powers of that ghoul, Naga, just as Deirdre once did. Nothing is more crucial than killing her now, Manfroy, lest we lose the chance.

speaker: Manfroy
text: You overestimate her threat, milord. After all, the Book of Naga remains under the strictest lock and key in Belhalla. Without it, I cannot fathom how Naga's soul could ever come to dwell within that girl...

speaker: Julius
text: How many times must I explain, Manfroy? Every last one of the avatars of Naga, the heirs of Heim, must be purged from existence!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Understood, milord. I'll have my men see to it that Julia is dead by sundown.

speaker: Julius
text: Do not fail me Manfroy. Now, then. I suppose I'm needed in the capital. I shall ensure that holding the Miletos territory is the Order's highest priority.

speaker: Manfroy
text: Before the week is done, Your Majesty, the corpse of Seliph will lie before you.

speaker: Julius
text: Seliph? ...Ah, of course. The one the peasants call the "scion of light"... Feh, just as they call me the "scion of darkness". The alleged eldest son of Deirdre, and the alleged true heir of Grannvale... A fairy tale, told to inspire hope amongst fools!

speaker: Manfroy
text: He poses a threat to us nonetheless, milord. The sooner we dispose of him, the better.

speaker: Julius
text: Surely he doesn't truly bear the power of the crusader Baldr... He couldn't possibly... I might not care about him, Manfroy, but you're welcome to do with him as you will.

speaker: Manfroy
text: Very good, milord...

speaker: Ishtar
text: Lord Julius...

speaker: Julius
text: Ishtar. Shall we be off, then? I've tasked the Order to defend Miletos. Say... I have a better idea. I want to play a game. Rumor has it that a small army of fresh sacrificial meat is headed our way. Let's see who can claim the life of a rebel first.

speaker: Ishtar
text: Yes, Lord Julius. I'd love to!

speaker: Ishtar
text: Heh! That's the end of it, Lord Julius. I've won.

speaker: Julius
text: Hrm... Not bad at all, Ishtar.

speaker: Julius
text: Heh... Such an easy win, Ishtar.

speaker: Ishtar
text: Masterfully done, Lord Julius! I expected no less of you.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Looks like we're too late, Seliph. The kids are already gone. I'm guessing they're well on their way to Grannvale.

speaker: Seliph
text: Blast... Not again...

speaker: Lewyn
text: I hate to admit it, but I doubt we could've gotten here soon enough either way. Now, then. It sounds like they're just finishing up repairs on the Miletos Strait bridge. Ready to move in on Chalphy?

speaker: Seliph
text: Chalphy... My father's homeland...

speaker: Lewyn
text: So it is. I'm betting the citizens there will be even happier to see you than usual. Let's not let them wait any longer!

speaker: Seliph
text: Indeed! Everyone, move out. Onward to Chalphy!

speaker: Julius
text: I grow weary of this game. Ishtar! We leave at once.

speaker: Ishtar
text: Yes, Lord Julius.

speaker: Arvis
text: Ah, Bishop Palmarch... Your Grace, I need you to escort these children to safety.

speaker: Palmarch
text: Come again?! Are you setting them free?

speaker: Arvis
text: Indeed. More of Julius' minions from Belhalla will be here at any moment. You need to move, and quickly!

speaker: Palmarch
text: Y-yes, of course! Thank you, Your Majesty... Thank you so much...

speaker: Arvis
text: I... I also wish to entrust you with this.

speaker: Palmarch
text: Hold on a moment... Isn't this-

speaker: Arvis
text: Once, long ago, you were a confidante to Sigurd, were you not? ...You already know what you must do.

speaker: Palmarch
text: Y-yes, sire...

speaker: Arvis
text: Now go! Protect the children with your life!

speaker: Julia
text: Father...

speaker: Arvis
text: Julia, I... I beg your forgiveness. For all the misery I've wrought, you must hate me so...

speaker: Julia
text: That's not true! It doesn't matter what happened, Father. Not even for a moment have I hated you! To me, you've always been one of the kindest men I've ever known!

speaker: Arvis
text: No... I am a fool. I've been a fool from the outset. All this time, I've been Manfroy's puppet. When I finally saw the strings he was pulling, it was too late. I was powerless to do a thing. I had already given the Empire to Julius... The embodiment of Loptous, the dark god. He... He took the love of my life from me... And you are next...

speaker: Julia
text: Mother sacrificed herself for me... She gave the last of her strength to ensure I made it as far away from Julius as possible. I think the trauma must have wiped my memory... And if Lewyn hadn't found me... But just knowing that Julius did that to his own mother... Now I remember, I almost wish I didn't... It hurts so much...

speaker: Arvis
text: Oh, Julia... We have so much more to talk about. I wish we could, but time is short. You are in grave danger so long as you stay here. Run. Run with Bishop Palmarch. Please...

speaker: Manfroy
text: Tsk tsk... I think not, Arvis. The only place Lady Julia is going is back with me to Velthomer. Now, I do believe His Imperial Majesty should keep to Prince Julius' orders. That is, unless you want your dear daughter to meet the axe.

speaker: Arvis
text: How dare you, Manfroy! You address your emperor! How dare you seek to use my daughter as a common bargaining chip!

speaker: Manfroy
text: Hmhmhm... So you still feebly cling to your titles and thrones, do you? Your time has long passed, Arvis. You, and this world, now belong to Prince Julius. Unless you wish to know pain beyond the ken of mortal men, still your tongue and obey your new liege without question. It is almost a pity your heroics are for naught. Every last child you freed shall be a festering corpse before this day is done! Hee hee hee...

speaker: Julia
text: F-Father!!

speaker: Arvis
text: Julia... I am so sorry... Julius' thugs are too powerful. I cannot protect you... All I can do now is give you this... This circlet once belonged to Deirdre. This... Only it could possibly save you n-

speaker: Manfroy
text: Enough! We leave at once, Julia!

speaker: Julia
text: Father! Oh…

speaker: Palmarch
text: Come along, children! Hurry!

speaker: Girl
text: But there's nowhere for us to go, sir...

speaker: Boy
text: The dark priests are right behind us! We're gonna die, aren't we?

speaker: Palmarch
text: Be at peace. All will be well. Lord Seliph will be here at any moment to rescue us. Have faith in the crusaders, my children!

speaker: Lewyn
text: A job well done indeed, Seliph. And would you just look at that! The locals are so happy to see you. Look! They're already pouring into the streets to rejoice at your return.

speaker: Seliph
text: Mm. I'm home. At long last, I'm home... Nothing has ever felt this good. But... I mustn't celebrate just yet...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Julia, right? You must be worried something fierce. Heh... Got a little thing for her, do you?

speaker: Seliph
text: Oh! Er... No, nothing of the sort...

speaker: Lewyn
text: I've had a word with some locals who've seen her. Archbishop Manfroy's got his grubby hands on her, by the sound of it. It's a pretty safe bet that Julia's still somewhere in Grannvale.

speaker: Seliph
text: Say, Lewyn... Something feels amiss. We've defeated Arvis and avenged my father, and yet I still feel... Empty.

speaker: Lewyn
text: That'd be because we still have a while to go until we reach the end of all this. If anything, the real battle here's only just about to get started. Trust me. By the time this holy war has come to a close, Seliph, the truth behind it all will be clear as day.

speaker: Woman
text: Ohh! Oh, noble crusader! We beg of you, save our children! The children... the dark priests want to sacrifice them to their god!

speaker: Man
text: Few folk livin' today are as vile as that Queen Hilda of Chronos. She's real cozy with them dark cultists. She goes 'round stealin' kids, then if they so much as cry, she kill the mams so calm-like, you'd think she was just swattin' flies! There's no way that woman's human! It's a fiend that's rulin' us now…

speaker: Old Man
text: Long ago, the Twelve Crusaders waged holy war against the Loptous Empire for fifteen years. Nary a single corner of the land of Jugdral escaped the war's clutches. It was Saint Heim who smote the dark god's avatar, Emperor Galle XVII, restoring light to this land at long last. And yet... the dark god is upon us once more. Oh, great crusaders, protect us all!

speaker: Man
text: 'Tis only been lately that we've had t'deal with these rites of sacrifice. Not so long ago, from what I hear, Emperor Arvis himself forbade 'em entirely. What the devil could've changed his mind? Please, I'm beggin' you! You've gotta save our children! Here, this magic ring oughta help you out.

speaker: Young Woman
text: A terrifying man, that Prince Julius is... Just a single glance into those eyes of his and you're gone... You lose yourself. So many of my friends and others my age've all left for Belhalla to serve him. I've heard nothing from any of 'em since…

speaker: Old Man
text: None of yeh come even close t'being strong enough t'fight Prince Julius. Hate t'say it, but sometimes, yeh need t'make sacrifices if yeh wanna keep goin'...

speaker: Lester
text: Hey! Hey, Patty! Looking good as ever, I see.

speaker: Patty
text: Oh. It's you, Lester. Look, just go away, okay?

speaker: Lester
text: Oh, come on! You're always so harsh and mouthy. What gives?

speaker: Patty
text: You're one to talk! You've never said anything that isn't teasing me in the most mind-numbing ways imaginable!

speaker: Lester
text: Wait, I haven't?

speaker: Patty
text: Of course you haven't! How can't you see that? You don't treat any other girls like this!

speaker: Lester
text: Hang on! What do you mean you're a girl, Patty?

speaker: Patty
text: Oh! You... You twit!

speaker: Lester
text: Hey, I was joking! I'm sorry... C'mon, calm down, okay? Look, I guess I kinda care about you. That sort of turned into... Er, sorry.

speaker: Patty
text: Care about me? What's that supposed to mean?!

speaker: Lester
text: It means that I sort of like you, okay! You can't be that thick, can you?

speaker: Leif
text: Is everything alright, Altena? You look rather weary.

speaker: Altena
text: Oh, Leif... No, it's nothing. Don't worry about it.

speaker: Leif
text: Well, if you say so... Listen, Altena. Don't be afraid to ask for my help. If you ever need anything, I'll gladly do all I can.

speaker: Altena
text: Thanks, Leif. Er, actually... I was thinking of Arion.

speaker: Leif
text: I thought as much... Is it true that someone came to spirit him away after we brought him down?

speaker: Altena
text: It is, and from what I hear, that someone was Prince Julius...

speaker: Leif
text: The Empire's crown prince himself?! But why... Why in the world would he do that?

speaker: Altena
text: Perhaps he's trying to win himself a new ally by appealing to Arion.

speaker: Leif
text: That makes sense... And I suppose it means we'll be crossing blades with Thracia's wyvern knights again.

speaker: Altena
text: Mm. I'm afraid so. So long as this war continues...

speaker: Leif
text: To be honest, Altena, I believe this is actually good news.

speaker: Altena
text: Huh? How so?

speaker: Leif
text: Think about it. So long as Arion is still alive, there is still hope that we can help him. Never give up, Altena. So long as we keep moving forward, surely everything will be fine in the end.

speaker: Altena
text: Thank you, Leif... I think I'm feeling better already.

speaker: Leif
text: Oh, thank the gods. I couldn't bear knowing that my sister was in such grief. I'm here for you, Altena. All I want is to ensure your happiness, and I'll do whatever it takes to help you.

speaker: Nanna
text: Say, Lord Leif... All my life I've been hearing how Miletos' cities are so fabulously rich. But look at it now... Look at all these ruins...

speaker: Leif
text: Mm... No matter how awful the Empire is, I never thought them to be quite so brutal. To think, just two decades ago one could buy almost anything one could ever desire from this region's many merchants... I suppose that nothing can thrive, so long as the Empire remains in power.

speaker: Nanna
text: Ever since I was little I've always wanted to wander the beautiful cities of Miletos and sample all the rare goods on sale... It must have been so lovely once...

speaker: Leif
text: Nanna... The instant this war is over and we've restored peace to the world, let's come back here... Just the two of us.

speaker: Nanna
text: Why?

speaker: Leif
