text: I don't believe this... If you're not going, how are you supposed to protect Shannan?

speaker: Ayra
text: Ah, of course. My pledge to my late brother... Shannan has grown into a strong young man, capable of leading his own life. My work is done. He no longer needs my protection.

speaker: Sigurd
text: But-

speaker: Ayra
text: Once I've seen this war through, I'll return to his side in Isaach. Until then, Sigurd, I won't run away. For better or worse, I'm with you.

speaker: Lex
text: Geez, Azelle, you look awful! What's going on?

speaker: Azelle
text: Oh, Lex... Why are you looking so happy?

speaker: Lex
text: Huh? Oh, right. My dad...

speaker: Azelle
text: Mm...

speaker: Lex
text: Yeah... I'm gonna be honest, Azelle. It's not that I feel nothing at all about what happened. Can't be helped, right? But after all the pain and suffering Dad caused... Well, he deserved to go down.

speaker: Azelle
text: Oh... You know, I've always admired you for your resilience, Lex. Just thinking about my brother is enough to make me tremble.

speaker: Lex
text: Yeah, Arvis has always struck me as quite an odd one, but he's always been a decent fellow. I still can't see him as our enemy...

speaker: Azelle
text: I know... Arvis has always been like a father to me, and I never knew my real father. The problem is, sometimes he just... He just changes! It's as if he becomes a whole different man. That's why I...

speaker: Lex
text: That's why you up and left him behind at home, right? There's nothing wrong with that, Azelle. He's got his life, and you've got yours. Don't beat yourself up about it, okay?

speaker: Azelle
text: I suppose you're right…

speaker: Dew
text: Hey... Jamke?

speaker: Jamke
text: Dew? Still here, are you? Look, didn't you hear us the first time? You're just in the way now. Go on, get outta here!

speaker: Dew
text: Ugh, why's everyone sayin' that?! What is WITH you lot lately? We're so close to winnin' this thing, but you wouldn't know it from how you're all actin'! What's goin' on here?

speaker: Jamke
text: Oh, er, sorry... You're right. I guess I am a bit tense at the moment. Not sure why, though...

speaker: Dew
text: ...Look, Jamke. You're a neat guy and I like you. I know I've kinda been a pain in the neck right from the start and... Er, sorry.

speaker: Jamke
text: Huh? Why're you so sappy all of a sudden? If anyone's being weird now, it's you!

speaker: Dew
text: Er, well, I kinda... Never mind. I guess I'll see ya later.

speaker: Jamke
text: Huh... Even Dew can tell something's not right here…

speaker: Ayra
text: You holding up okay here, Arden?

speaker: Arden
text: Phew… I think the weight of this armor’s finally starting to catch up with me.

speaker: Ayra
text: Hah! But I do love how manly you look in it.

speaker: Arden
text: Oh, thanks! It’s nice to hear you say that. Just as nice as how womanly you are, Ayra!

speaker: Ayra
text: Womanly? Hah! Good one.

speaker: Arden
text: No, really! That’s how I see you, Ayra. You’re the loveliest lass I’ve ever known.

speaker: Ayra
text: Are you sure you’re just feeling okay, Arden?

speaker: Arden
text: I can’t just not say this stuff, can I? After all, Ayra, I really do love you.

speaker: Ayra
text: W-wh… Arden, you silly man…

speaker: Ayra
text: I guess we're nearing the end here, Lex.

speaker: Lex
text: Yeah... Y'know, Ayra, your stubbornness never ceases to amaze. Why didn't you just leave for Isaach?

speaker: Ayra
text: Why should I have? Because I'm a woman?! Why didn't you leave? You're every bit as responsible for the children as I am!

speaker: Lex
text: Yeah, you're right... Sorry about that. But I dunno... I'm still not sure we should've abandoned the kids like that.

speaker: Ayra
text: That's why, the instant this war is over, we'll go back to Isaach for them. Together.

speaker: Lex
text: Fair enough. C'mon, let's get this over with!

speaker: Ayra
text: Lex... I'm sorry about all that. I've always been a fighter. This is the only life I have.

speaker: Lex
text: Hah! It's fine, Ayra. I know. That's what I love about you, isn't it? I have no idea how this thing'll play out, but we're in it together, no matter what.

speaker: Ayra
text: Heh... Thank you, Lex.

speaker: Ayra
text: I guess we’re nearing the end here, Holyn.

speaker: Holyn
text: Mm…

speaker: Ayra
text: There’s just one thing I’d like to ask you, Holyn. Is that alright?

speaker: Holyn
text: Sure. What is it?

speaker: Ayra
text: You’ve always talked about wanting to protect me. What’s the reason behind that?

speaker: Holyn
text: I’ve known you since we were kids, Ayra. Nothing’s more important to me than making sure you’re safe.

speaker: Ayra
text: What?! It can’t be… Holyn, are you…

speaker: Holyn
text: The Lord of Sophara’s kid? Yeah, I am. And right from the start, Ayra, you stole my stupid little heart…

speaker: Lachesis
text: Hold it, Noish!

speaker: Noish
text: Lachesis?! You shouldn’t still be here! I thought we agreed you’d go to Leonster!

speaker: Lachesis
text: I’ve sent the children there already, but I can’t leave. I won’t leave! I’ll fight at your side till the bitter end!

speaker: Noish
text: You promised you would, Lachesis! The children need their mother to survive all of this, and they’re not even the only ones! What about Lord Eldigan’s son?

speaker: Lachesis
text: Ares… I don’t even know what happened to Ares after Agustria fell.

speaker: Noish
text: Lord Sigurd is gravely worried about Ares. After all, the boy lost his father at such a young age. Do you not care for Ares’ safety as well?

speaker: Lachesis
text: Of course I do! But… Oh, never mind. For the gods’ sakes, Noish, I am your wife! I’ll never sit back while you risk your life!

speaker: Noish
text: I know, Lachesis. I know, and I love you dearly. Never forget that.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Of course I won’t, dear. ...Sorry.

speaker: Lachesis
text: And what exactly do you think you’re still doing here, Dew?!

speaker: Dew
text: Oh, come on! I’m a lot stronger than all of ya seem to think!

speaker: Lachesis
text: Look, Dew I know you are. I know. The problem is, this battle is far beyond anything we’ve ever seen before. You simply won’t be able to cope, Dew.

speaker: Dew
text: Ugh, this isn’t even the first time you’ve said that all day! I’m not just a kid anymore!

speaker: Lachesis
text: I know, Dew. After all, I know more than most about how you’re not just a kid anymore! Heh heh!

speaker: Dew
text: Aw, look, Lachesis! You’re blushing!

speaker: Lachesis
text: Oh, Dew! Stop teasing!

speaker: Dew
text: Well… Guess it was nice knowin’ ya, Lachesis. Thanks for all the fun we’ve had.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Dew… Take care of yourself, too.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Beowulf...

speaker: Beowulf
text: Look, Lachesis. If somethin' happens t'me, I want ya to go to Leonster fer me. Quan's kids're there with Finn. Help 'em out where I can't, yeah?

speaker: Lachesis
text: No! You mustn't say such things! If I go to Leonster, you will come with me!

speaker: Beowulf
text: Lachesis... I don't think I've done right by ya.

speaker: Lachesis
text: W-what? Why...?

speaker: Beowulf
text: I knew how ya really felt all along...

speaker: Beowulf
text: Look after yerself, Lachesis. This was fun while it lasted.

speaker: Lachesis
text: Wait! Beowulf!!

speaker: Silvia
text: Oh, there y'are, Alec!

speaker: Alec
text: Silvia? Aw, geez! You shouldn't still be out here! Just go back to the castle! Please?

speaker: Silvia
text: But I'm really worried 'bout ya, Alec...

speaker: Alec
text: Listen, Silvia. You've gotta act a bit less like a child. C'mon, you're a mother now!

speaker: Silvia
text: Not like you're one to talk on that one! That part's your fault too, remember?

speaker: Alec
text: Y-yeah, I guess...

speaker: Silvia
text: Look, Alec, you've gotta come back from this thing, okay? Without ya, I don't think Lene and me'll last... Promise? Please?

speaker: Alec
text: Silvia... Yeah, I promise. I'm coming home from this one…

speaker: Silvia
text: Say, Lewyn...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Hm? What is it, Silvia?

speaker: Silvia
text: Do ya still like me, Lewyn?

speaker: Lewyn
text: What? Where'd THAT come from?!

speaker: Silvia
text: Well, do ya?

speaker: Lewyn
text: Of course I still love you! That's why we're married, remember?

speaker: Silvia
text: Oh... 'Course. Whew. Be... Because I love you too, Lewyn... I'll never forget ya... And I don't want ya to forget me...

speaker: Lewyn
text: Silvia…

speaker: Silvia
text: Hey, Claude, you doin’ okay?

speaker: Claude
text: Yes, I’m fine. But you shouldn’t still be here, Silvia. There’s nothing you can do, and you are only endangering yourself.

speaker: Silvia
text: But…

speaker: Claude
text: Please, Silvia. You cannot stay with me this time.

speaker: Silvia
text: But Claude… I love ya…

speaker: Claude
text: And I, you. That is why I ask…

speaker: Silvia
text: No! I’m with ya ‘til death parts us!

speaker: Claude
text: Silvia, please… I can’t allow that… Please understand…

speaker: Erinys
text: Oh, Noish! There you are!

speaker: Noish
text: Is everything alright, Erinys?

speaker: Erinys
text: Yes, I'm fine.

speaker: Noish
text: That's a relief. Erinys, please... Do be careful out here. There are others depending on your health and safety now.

speaker: Erinys
text: I hope the children are okay back in Silesse. The sooner we can see them again, the better.

speaker: Noish
text: Mm... For their sake, Erinys, lets see if we can finish up this fight as quickly as possible.

speaker: Erinys
text: Certainly! But Noish... Please, be careful as well…

speaker: Erinys
text: How are you feeling, Arden?

speaker: Arden
text: I’m getting real tired of this bloody desert!

speaker: Erinys
text: Heh. It’s a shame you can’t ride my pegasus with me, isn’t it?

speaker: Arden
text: Mm. Maybe if I lost some of this 200-ish pounds of armor, I could.

speaker: Erinys
text: Say, Arden... Try not to die. Please.

speaker: Arden
text: Of course! I can’t exactly go dying now that I’ve got a lass as lovely as you to support, can I? Maybe once this war’s done, when we go back to Silesse we could quit fighting for a change and start ourselves a little shop!

speaker: Erinys
text: Heh… That isn’t a bad idea.

speaker: Erinys
text: We've nearly reached the end, Lewyn.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Mm. But don't go forgetting that promise you made, Erinys.

speaker: Erinys
text: Of course. I'm to return to Silesse, no matter what happens.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Trust me, I'm not planning on dying out here. You're not going to die any time soon, either!

speaker: Erinys
text: Of course! I promise... Being with you... It's as if all my childhood dreams have come true! I'm not going to just die and waste that. I'll always be with you, Lewyn. Always. No matter what.

speaker: Lewyn
text: Mother's still waiting for us back in Silesse... Hell, she's probably waiting for YOU more than anything else!

speaker: Erinys
text: Heh... I hope that Queen Rahna... Wait, no. That Mother will be proud of me!

speaker: Brigid
text: Not too far to Belhalla, isn’t it, Alec?

speaker: Alec
text: Yeah. This is going to be quite the little homecoming, eh?

speaker: Brigid
text: This’ll be the first time I can remember that I’m at home. What’s Jungby like?

speaker: Alec
text: It’s a lovely place. Just lovely! Heh… Plenty of lovely ladies there, too.

speaker: Brigid
text: Ugh… Am I going to find you in bed with another woman one day, Alec?

speaker: Alec
text: Heh, I’m kidding, I’m kidding! If I’m to die it won’t be over some other lady!

speaker: Brigid
text: Good. You’re not gonna do me much good if you’re dead, are you? After all, we’ve still got to finish up here first! And I guess I can’t just let you die if it means the kids won’t have a dad….

speaker: Alec
text: Don’t worry! Luck’s on my side, just like always. How else do you explain me getting married to someone like you?

speaker: Brigid
text: Oh, Alec…

speaker: Brigid
text: You holding up okay, Midir?

speaker: Midir
text: Mm, I’m fine. And how about you?

speaker: Brigid
text: Yeah. I’m okay. I know I’ll be okay if I’m right here with you.

speaker: Midir
text: I’m so glad we met, Brigid, and I’ll always be grateful for our time together.

speaker: Brigid
text: Excuse me? This had better not be some clumsy attempt to end this marriage, Midir!

speaker: Midir
text: Er, sorry about that. I just wanted to make sure you knew…

speaker: Brigid
text: Midir, listen. I know about how you mooned after Aideen all those years. You sure you’re happy with just me.

speaker: Midir
text: Of course! Yes, I liked Lady Aideen… But it was never real love. You’re the only one I’ve ever really loved!

speaker: Brigid
text: Thanks, Midir… I’m here for you until the end…

speaker: Brigid
text: You holding up okay, Jamke? Bet you're getting tired.

speaker: Jamke
text: Yeah, I'm doing fine. And you?

speaker: Brigid
text: Yeah, 'cause I've got you at my side...

speaker: Jamke
text: Are you sure I can't persuade you to escape, Brigid? I'm still not comfortable with you fighting in this mess of a battle.

speaker: Brigid
text: Oh, yeah. Dead sure, Jamke. Do you really still have to ask? You'd think I'd have made my point by now.

speaker: Jamke
text: Right...

speaker: Brigid
text: Jamke... You sure you're happy with me?

speaker: Jamke
text: Hm?

speaker: Brigid
text: Are you happy with me? I sorta know what you were like about Aideen...

speaker: Jamke
text: Oh, come on. This again? You're the one I love, Brigid. You're the one I want to spend the rest of my life with.

speaker: Brigid
text: S-sorry about that... Still glad I asked, though…

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Don’t go, Azelle!

speaker: Azelle
text: Tailtiu, you promised you would be headed for Silesse by now! I swear I’ll follow you as soon as I possibly can.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: But…

speaker: Azelle
text: You cannot fight the Freege army! Do you really plan on attempting to kill your own father, Tailtiu?

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Er… No, I don’t think I can…

speaker: Azelle
text: Good. I don’t think I could stomach the idea of you, or anyone else, being willing to kill their father. Look after the children for me, Tailtiu.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Azelle? Azelle!!

speaker: Tailtiu
text: You’ve still gotta fight, don’t you, Lex?

speaker: Lex
text: Yeah, I do. Tailtiu, just go ahead to Silesse already. I know you’ll be safe there.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: How can you be so cruel, leaving me alone?

speaker: Lex
text: Look, all of House Freege is out here doing their damnedest to take you back, whether you want to or not. And I don’t think I could live with myself if you or the kids were taken by them or the Dozels. You’ve gotta understand!

speaker: Tailtiu
text: But…

speaker: Lex
text: Look, right from the start, fate seriously screwed us both over. I wish we’d had longer together, but what little time we did have’ll always mean so much to me, right till the end.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Oh, Lex…

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Claude, what do you think I should do?

speaker: Claude
text: Fighting the Freege army is out of the question. I don't believe engaging your own father in battle is at all advisable. Please, go to Silesse. There is still a safe, peaceful life awaiting you there.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: But what about you, Claude?

speaker: Claude
text: I have an obligation, Tailtiu. My fate is to stay here and see this war through till its very end.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: How can you be so cruel? Wh... What about our children?!

speaker: Claude
text: I understand how difficult this fate will be for you, but please... Please understand.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Claude!!

speaker: Alec
text: Well, Noish, I suppose this is it.

speaker: Noish
text: Mm…

speaker: Alec
text: Thanks for everything.

speaker: Noish
text: You, too…

speaker: Alec
text: It’s been quite an adventure, huh?

speaker: Noish
text: That it has.

speaker: Alec
text: Take care of yourself, alright?

speaker: Noish
text: And you as well…

speaker: Byron
text: Gah... Is this as far as I'll go?

speaker: Byron
text: Oh, Sigurd... I've failed you…

speaker: Ethlyn
text: Hold tight, Altena! I'll protect you no matter what!

speaker: Ethlyn
text: Ahh! Altena... Quan... I'm so sorry…

speaker: Quan
text: Away, Thracian beasts! So long as I hold Gáe Bolg, only one of us will live this day!

speaker: Quan
text: Blast! Can I go no further...?

speaker: Quan
text: Oh, Ethlyn... Forgive me... Finn... I entrust Leif... to you…

speaker: Magorn
text: Don't take this personally. We've all got to make a living somehow…

speaker: Magorn
text: Gah... Glory be to Thracia!

speaker: Magorn
text: So, you’re the infamous Sigurd, are you? Heh… Not as impressive as the stories say...

speaker: Slayder
text: What's this? You rebels have already come this far? How could you have breached our front lines so quickly?

speaker: Slayder
text: Unnh... We've been breached, too...?

speaker: Slayder
text: My apologies, Lord Byron, but orders are orders. This is where you meet your end!

speaker: André
text: Heh heh... Welcome, fools. Allow me to give you a fool's death!

speaker: André
text: Th-this can't be... Scopio... Avenge me!

speaker: André
text: Oho, look what we have here! My dear sister, the traitor, turning up in a place like this. Your sins have soiled the honor of my House Jungby, and now, you must make your amends with your very life.

speaker: Aideen
text: André... What a pitiful man you've become…

speaker: André
text: What? Could it be... Brigid?! So, not only do I hear that you sunk as low as piracy, but now you are party to treasonous deeds... No matter what it takes, you - the shame of my house - must be put to a timely death.

speaker: Brigid
text: Enough! You murdered your own father! You, André, are the disgrace to Jungby's honor, and to the good name of the Crusader Ulir!

speaker: Langbalt
text: Bwahahaha! It matters not how many of you worms confront me. So long as I wield the great axe, Helswath, the same fate awaits every last one of you! Stay clear, if you still value your lives!

speaker: Langbalt
text: I-impossible... How could I fall like this...? Dannan... Don't fail me…

speaker: Langbalt
text: Bwahaha... Would you look at that. The little brat's made it, as well! How perfect! I'll reunite you with your dearly departed father. He ought to be lonely now!

speaker: Sigurd
text: Langbalt... Langbalt!! You will pay for what you did to my father!

speaker: Langbalt
text: L-Lex... Vile traitor! You would turn your axe on your own father? Shame on you!

speaker: Lex
text: That's right... Shame on me. Just like you've always said... This is fate, Father. Forgive me…

speaker: Vaha
text: Take this! Feel the fiery wrath of the heavens!

speaker: Vaha
text: Urgh... Oh, Lord Arvis... Forgive my failure…

speaker: Reptor
text: Hm hm hm... It's time you had a lesson in obedience. Your teacher will be the supreme thunder magic Mjölnir!

speaker: Reptor
text: Die! If I'm to burn, you will ALL burn with me!

speaker: Reptor
text: Guhhh... Arvis... What in the blazes are you... scheming?

speaker: Reptor
text: Pah! Don't make me laugh, you naïve twit! Consider this a lesson in politics and power! Your father had no power, and hence he is dead! Even a common knight such as yourself can surely appreciate this fundamental truth!

speaker: Sigurd
text: A knight appreciates honor and justice. I see neither of those in your actions! For too long you've soiled Grannvale's honor. I've come to set the fatherland to rights!

speaker: Reptor
text: Such a pity your hard work is all for naught! Byron died a sad, pitiful traitor, and you will meet his very same fate at my hands! In the face of the supreme power of thunder, Mjölnir, you are but a candle to be snuffed! Sigurd, your dying thought will lament your complete and utter lack of power Ahahaha…

speaker: Reptor
text: T-Tailtiu... I can hardly believe it... No matter how traitorous you became... Not once did I expect to face you like this.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Father... I'm sorry...

speaker: Reptor
text: Curse that Claude! How dare he fill my daughter's head with lies... No, it's too late. I have no choice... I must protect the honor of House Freege. Tailtiu, for your treachery, you must die.

speaker: Tailtiu
text: Oh! Father…

speaker: Reptor
text: Aida... How dare you! You treacherous wretch...

speaker: Aida
text: Hah! You're as sore a loser as I expected, Reptor. You'd do well to surrender now.
